loans.name: Caroline Naliaka

texts.en:
Caroline is a 29-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is five years old. She describes herself as a visionary. 
Caroline operates a salon where she weaves and braids hair and sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a shopping center and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation and seasonality. 
Caroline will use this 20,000 KES loan to purchase cosmetics. Her business goal is to have opened another salon in the next shopping center within five years.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a Palestinian, 37-year-old man who raises chicks for sale. Omar wants to purchase more chicks for sale and fodder to feed them. This will expand his project, increase sales and improve his income. He does not have enough money to do this so he needs a loan from FATEN. When Omar gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more chicks and fodder. In this way, his sales will increase and he will improve his income and living conditions. Omar is photographed in his project.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy motor oil, brake fluids, filters, clutch fluids and other motoring supplies.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is married to a house builder and has six children between the ages of one and 17. For the past four years, she has been running a clothing store. 

Victoire is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell. She will save the profits from her loan. In the future, Victoire would like to work as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Annalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Annalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is business oriented because she is able to improve her retail store. She is 28 years of age, married, and has two children. She has been selling different kinds of daily needs, soft drinks and other items needed within the local community of San Miguel Ramon. 

Monaliza has operated her retail store for one year, while also vending frozen foods for three years. According to her, she is able to sell 500 pieces of skinless longanisa (native Filipino sausage) and 200 pieces of tocino (sweetened cured pork) weekly. She would like to buy more stock of groceries and frozen foods, but her profit is not enough due to their household expenditures and school allowances for her children. 

She is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P20,000. She hopes that she can get the amount requested, allowing her to maintain and develop her retailing business. In this way, she could generate bigger income to improve their living conditions and support her two children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase stock groceries and frozen foods for her retail business.

loans.name: Damaris Marbeli

texts.es: La señora Damaris, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, ella está muy contenta ya que gracias al apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de Kiva, su vida a mejorado  por la reconstrucción de  su vivienda para gozar de mayor privacidad, a pesar de enfrentar grandes desafíos económicos, pero siempre con la espereza de tener un mañana mejor, doña Damaris labora en un colegio cercano del municipio donde habita , cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo , sus planes es poder mejorar la parte trasera de su casa ya que con los créditos anteriores realizo la parte delantera de la vivienda  y una  pequeña división . Ella va a comprar bloques , cemento, arena , piedrín, hierro , etc.
texts.en: Mrs. Damaris lives with her family in the town of Ticuantepe. Thanks to the support of Afodenic and Kiva she was able to rebuild her home and have more privacy, thus improving her quality of life. Despite economic challenges, Mrs. Damaris, who works in a nearby high school, hopes to have a better future. With her husband's support she plans to improve the back of their house since she used prior loans to improve the front of the house and build a wall. She will use the loan to purchase cement blocks, sand, gravel, iron, and other construction materials.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for her home

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He sells fruit and it’s a business he has run for three years. He started by planting the vines and after two years, the harvesting began. 

He learnt about Milango from an employee of the company. He is applying for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase more vines to plant. His future ambition is to buy a plot of land in the area and construct rental houses.  He will save the extra money obtained to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more vines to plant.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga, 56, is widowed and resides with two nieces in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she raises ducks, chickens and pigs at home. Her nieces are employed at a garment factory. She is asking for a loan of USD 600 in order to purchase a motorbike for her nieces to drive to work. In the future, she plans to purchase more piglets to raise in order to generate more income to support her family and build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her nieces to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, pants and undergarments.

loans.name: Áreas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Área lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Raquel quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 4 años en el mercedo más grande de Managua.  Ella invertirá el crédito en chayote, tomate, zanahoria, papa…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Sebastian quien se dedica al comercio de tamarindo desde hace 7 años y Javier quien se dedica al comercio de fruta y verduras desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The "Área" group has three members, all enterprising and hard-working people.  Sra. Raquel has been selling fruit and vegetables for four years at the largest market in Masaya.  She will use this loan to buy chayote (pear squash), tomatoes, carrots, potatoes, etc. 

The other members of the group are Sebastiana who has been selling tamarind for seven years, and Javier who has sold fruits and vegetables for six years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for food-sales business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
A woman full of life, hard-working, and very humble - this is Monica. She is aware that she must work hard to achieve the objectives of supporting her family. Monica is a smallholder farmer from Kapsowar area in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. She owns a half an-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The kind mother keeps cows and grows varieties of crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. 

Monica is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Monica. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Monica because the institution believes in empowering women. You can help Monica with a loan that will change her life.
Be inspired during this festive season and paint a smile on Monica’s face with a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia has been running her small restaurant for four years. She sells many types of fast foods like chicken kabobs and tortillas. Silvia has been forced to work from a very young age. Before opening up her restaurant she worked selling clothes around her neighborhood. Because of pain in her legs from the years of hard work, she could no longer continue to sell clothes. She decided to start this restaurant which has been successful.

She needs the loan in order to invest in new tables and chairs. She also wants to build a wall to separate her from her business because she is now using only a large piece of plastic.

Silvia is 46 years old and has 6 children, two of which are independent. She has been separated from her husband for about 15 year. He does try to help his children financially, but he does not provide nearly enough to cover all the basic necessities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to invest in new tables and chairs.

loans.name: Yani

texts.en: Yani is 27 years old and is married with two children ages 8 and 7. She makes fried beans and chips and then sells them through several small shops nearby, or sells them directly to some factories near her village. She sells 5kg of fried beans for $7.50 and 5kg of chips for $13.00.  Her husband, Mulyadi, works as a household goods seller. She needs more working capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys N. is a married mother of 4. She is a hair beautician. She will use the loan to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: I intend to diversify and expand my businesss.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
To purchase a display case and better her inventory.

Comprar una vitrina y mejorar su inventario

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en:
Lamosa, 33, a married woman from Saletele, Fagaloa, runs her own retail shop, thanks to assistance from SPBD. A mother living in one of the remote villages in Upolu, Lamosa has really found the kind of support she needs from her little shop, given the location of their village. Not only does she now have a more stable source of income, she also does not need to come into town to shop for her family groceries all the time, as she can easily do this from her own small shop.

Lamosa understands the challenges of running a small retail shop and that you really need to separate yourself from the business so that you can make a profit and continue to buy stock for the retail shop.

While she has many church and family commitments, Lamosa knows she needs to ensure that these will not have negative implications on the future of her small business. Lamosa acknowledges the assistance from SPBD which has given her the opportunity to start this new small business venture for her family.

loans.use: To stock her shop and for school fees

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Noli

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Noli and her husband, Nyoman Kicen, work as farmers. Due to the increasing family expenses and their children's high school fees, Ni Nyoman Noli decided to start breeding pigs. She got the initial capital from Dinari. Using the loan, she bought 2 pigs which cost Rp. 250,000 (about $28) per pig so the 2 pigs cost Rp. 500,000 (about $55). The rest of the loan was used to cover the pig's food expenses for 6 months. Her pigpen is very simple with bamboo wall and cement floor. Everyday she cleans the pigpen, and then feeds the pigs with food mixtures such as rice chaff, tofu concentrate and dregs. The food cost her Rp. 1,000,000 (about $110). The revenue from selling the pigs were Rp. 2,000,000 (about $221) so the net income was Rp. 500,000 (about $55). She is very grateful that the earned profit can be used to support her children. She hopes to get more loans from Dinari in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Dalam keseharian Ni Nyoman Noli dan suaminya, Nyoman Kicen, hidup dari hasil bercocok tani. Karena kebutuhan keluarga yang semakin besar dan kedua anaknya sekarang duduk di bangku SMU. Akhirnya Ni Nyoman Noli memiliki usaha sampingan yaitu berternak babi. Modal yang didapatnya diperoleh dari Dinari . Dari modal ini Ni Nyoman Noli membeli 2 ekor babi penggemukan dengan harga satu ekor Rp.250.000,- jadi 2 babi harganya Rp.500.000,-. Sisa dari pembelian bibit dipakai untuk modal pakan selama 6 bulan. Kondisi kandang babi Nyoman Noli sederhana, dinding dari bambu dan lantai semen. Setiap hari Ni Nyoman Noli rajin membersihkan kandangnya, setelah itu baru babinya diberi makan dengan campuran makanannya seperti dedak padi, konsentrat dan ampas tahu. Sampai babi siap dipanen, menghabiskan biaya pakan sebesar Rp.1.000.000,-. Sedangkan pendapatan kotornya Rp.2.000.000,- jadi pendapatan bersihnya Rp.500.000,-. Ni Nyoman Noli bersyukur dengan keuntungan yang diperolehnya ini bisa dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan anaknya. Harapan Ni Nyoman Noli agar pinjaman dari Dinari bisa meningkat.

loans.use: To purchase pig seed and pig's food

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is a noble farmer who has worked since he was a young child in the farming fields of his family. His father taught him everything about farming and thanks to this knowledge, today Jose works sowing his land. He fertilizes his land in a natural way. His wife and his two young children are his biggest treasures. They are the reason for which José sees the need to increase his production and to transport his merchandise to the hills like Huancayo. Therefore he needs working capital that will allow him to increase his plantations of diverse citrus fruits that would bring him a bigger income. Let's support this young father who is trying to improve the economic situation of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

José es un noble agricultor que en el transcurso durante la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado con mucho empeño desde que era niño en los campos de cultivo de su familia, su padre le inculcó los gajes de este oficio y gracias a su sabiduría, hoy José puede desempeñarse de la mejor manera y muy prácticamente en la siembra y cuidado de sus terrenos abonándolos y fertilizándolos naturalmente mientras se pueda. Él tiene un familia conformada con sus dos más grandes tesoros, su esposa y sus dos menores hijos, lo cuales son el motor que le animan a progresar y es por su familia que José ve la necesidad de acrecentar su producción y transportar su mercadería a las zonas de la sierra como Huancayo, es por ello que requiere de un capital de inversión que le permita aumentar sus plantaciones de diversos cítricos que le traerían grandes ingresos. Apoyemos a este joven padre que lucha por mejorar la situación económica de su familia.

loans.use: Buy bigger quantities of seeds in order to increase his production.

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (A) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Aisha is a single mother of eight children. She has a small poultry farm. She would like to use the extra business profits to buy food and clothes, and to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To widen the chicken house

loans.name: Tiira Road H Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Grace N.. She is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to expand her fish business. Grace is 33 years old and is married. Her husband is an engineer. She has 5 children ranging from ages 6 to 14, and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 50000 (~ $30 USD) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 200000 (~ $116 USD) to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Hajara N. and Jane N.. Hajara N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to add to her charcoal business with the loan. Jane N. also sells charcoal and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To add to fish business

loans.name: Las Manzanas, Bank Of Hope Group

texts.en:
Martha (pictured far right of Group 1) is a fun and energetic woman who lives with her three children in the town of Los Alcarizzos. She has a ‘colmado’¸ which is a small neighborhood grocery store of sorts, typical of many street corners in towns throughout the Dominican Republic. From her store, she sells fresh vegetables, rice, beans, canned goods, soaps, and toilet paper. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase a better variety of canned goods, desserts and candies, and be able to keep her colmado better stocked. With a better inventory she knows she can retain her current client base, as well as attract new clients and beat out some of her competition.

Her dreams are to see her colmado grow, and to have it be the biggest and best liked place to shop in her community. She wants her children to have the chance to change their lives, improve their futures, and always enjoy the opportunities they are given. She personally hopes to be able to live a more peaceful lifestyle, one where she advances economically and doesn’t have to worry so much about having enough money to take care of everyone.

In her free time Martha loves to visit the hospital and spend time with the sick people who are often forgotten. She also goes to her local church every Sunday. On behalf of Martha, and everyone in her bank—Esperanza International thanks you for your support of her loan!

loans.use: Purchase canned food, desserts and candy

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Chheang Y. is a 32-year-old widow who is supporting her four young children with the revenue she generates from her small grocery store in Kampong Cham. She earns $10 USD per day from her store and from a small plot of farmland on which she grows rice and yams.

She wants to take a loan to buy groceries in bulk to save money and hopefully increase her family income. With any additional cash left over, she will purchase extra rice and yam seeds to plant next year.

loans.use: To buy a large stock of groceries.

loans.name: Luisa's Group

texts.en:
Luisa is a forty-year-old woman who with her husband's help has been operating a mini-market for a couple of years.  She operates in the San Luis community of Santo Domingo.  Luisa plans on buying more items to add to her stock.  The entrepreneur explains that currently she has to invest a large amount of money to purchase the same quantity of goods because of the increasing scarcity of food at a global level.
Luisa says that before there was a lot to be said for running a mini-market, but presently it’s getting difficult to make business profitable.  The entrepreneur hopes that loan received will help her move her business forward and improve her family’s living conditions.
Luisa will receive the funds together with these following women:
Leonora M. D. J., to buy women’s clothing to retail in her community
Carmela R., to bulk-buy clothing for her small store
Odiana R., to replenish a small grocery store
Sandra R., to buy goods for a beauty parlor.
Photo: From left to right: Leonara, Carmela, Odiana, Luisa Y Sandra.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of many goods to replenish a mini-market.

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Oumy Kouyaté is 43 years old, married with 6 children and one other family member in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 4 years. She runs a business selling thioub (dyed cloth). She supplies herself in Mali and sells her goods in Ziguinchor. With her income, she supports her family and ensures the education of her children. Oumy is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Oumy Kouyaté, 43 ans, mariée, 06 enfants et un autre membre de sa famille en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 4 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de thioub (tissus teintés) .Elle s'approvisionne au Mali pour vendre à Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle entretien sa famille et assure la scolarité des enfants. Oumy sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell dyed cloth

loans.name: José Pinto

texts.pt:
José Pinto C. was born in Catembe, is 27 years old and single. He does not have children and lives with his parents, where he contributes to some of the household expenses. José Pinto completed his 3rd year of Accounting at the Commercial Institute of Maputo and is currently trying to enter night courses in one of the higher education institutions.

José Pinto has worked as a full-time accountant for over 2 years, where his day begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 5:00 p.m. He graduated from the Commercial Institute of Maputo and then did a 3-month internship at the same company he works for now. His monthly income is 6,000 MT and he’s able to put away some of it.

This is José Pinto’s first loan with Hluvuku. He found out about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues. In the future, he plans on building his own house and will need to take out another loan.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

José Pinto C., solteiro de 27 anos de idade, nasceu na Catembe, não tem filhos, vive na casa dos pais e naturalmente contribui com algumas despesas domésticas.

José Pinto concluiu o 3º ano de Contabilidade no Instituto Comercial de Maputo e presentemente está a concorrer ao curso pós laboral numa das instituições de ensino superior.

É contabilista de profissão em regime permanente a mais de dóis anos, entra as 7:30 e sai as 17horas. Formou-se no Instituto Comercial de Maputo e teve 3 meses de estágio na empresa onde trabalha actualmente, o rendimento mensal é de 6.000Mt e consegue poupar algum dinheiro.

Para José Pinto este é o 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku e teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku a traves dos colegas e amigos.

No futuro pretende construir sua residência e vai precisar de fazer outro empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.id:
Ni Komang W. enjoys her trade very much. She purchases cocoa from farmers and then resell it to wholesalers. She needs additional capital to be able to compete with other traders. She had obtained a loan from DINARI in the past that helped her business grow. Currently she earns about $3.5 to $4.5 per day. However, this profit is not sufficient to grow the business satisfactorily for W., as she needed to pay for daily expenses too. Furthermore, Cocoa prices has been increasing dramatically. She used to purchase Cocoa for $1.1 to $1.3 per kg, now she purchases cacaos at $2.2 per kg. So she intends to increase her working capital to be able to compete with larger traders. With this capital increase, W. hopes to be able to purchase more cacao, especially from her old suppliers/.

Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Komang W. sangat menikmati pekerjaan yang ditekuninya saat ini. Sebagai seorang pedagang yang membeli kakao dari petani dan kemudian dijual lagi ke pembeli besar, membutuhkan modal yang lebih untuk bisa bersaing dengan pedagang lain. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dirasakan cukup membantu usahanya ini . Keuntungan yang di dapat W. saat ini berkisar antara Rp. 30.000.- s/d Rp. 40.000.- / hari. Namun keuntungan ini belum bisa meningkatkan modal yang di miliki oleh W. karena selain digunakan untuk biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari, W. juga harus bisa mengatur keuntungan ini untuk modal lagi. Hal ini disebabkan oleh karena pengaruh kenaikan harga barang yang begitu drastis. Kakao yang dulunya di beli dengan harga Rp. 10.000.- s/d Rp. 12.000.- / kilo kini melonjak mencapai Rp. 20.000.- / kilonya. Dengan demikian W. bermaksud untuk menambah kembali jumlah pinjamannya sehingga masih bisa bersaing dengan pedagang yang lain. Dengan tambahan modal ini W. berharap bisa membeli barang lebih banyak khususnya semua kakao petani yang sudah menjadi langganannya.

loans.use: Increase trading capital

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 22 and 7 years old. She owns a kiosk and she has been a food seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

Amina is now requesting a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Luavalu

texts.en:
Luavalu I. is 31 years old and married with five children. She has three years of experience in the traditional business of selling necklaces, earrings, and fans. She sells to the public four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~$125 USD).

Luavalu has one previous loan with SPBD (South Pacific Business Development). SPBD loans are Luavalu’s only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. Luavalu would be happy to apply a second loan to improving her business, and thus allowing her to better meet her kids’ educational needs. She will use the money to help pay for the electric and water bills that contribute to the running of her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing maching for her business, pay her water and electricity bill, and fund her kids' school fees.

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Ramzan baji is a wife of M. and has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of one son, age 9, and one daughter, age 10. Ramzan baji’s husband has been in business sellling wood for the past 6 years. Ramzan baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Ramzan baji's loan group includes four other members. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Naziran baji wants to buy bricks for her brick-selling business. Aneela baji wants to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Safia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Shamim baji’s husband owns a shuttering business. He provides beams and ropes to building contractors. Shamim baji has a milk selling business. She has been selling milk for the past four years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to help expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Dinh

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Dinh năm nay 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Dinh rất khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn. Sau khi được vay vốn của Quỹ chị Dinh đã có điều kiện đầu tư mua thêm các loại rau, đỗ… và phân bón phục vụ cho công việc trồng trọt. Đến nay chỉ sau 2 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện hơn, kinh tế gia đình cũng vì thế mà ngày càng ổn định
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các loại rau và phân bón phục vụ cho việc trồng trọt của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. L. Thi Dinh is 50 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2006. Prior to joining the fund, her family's economic situation was very difficult and she lacked the capital to do business. After borrowing from the fund, Ms. Dinh was abL. to buy vegetables, fertilizer for her farming business. Now after only 2 years in the fund, her family's income has improved and their economic situation is more stabL.. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to buy additional vegetables and fertilizer for her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy vegetables and fertilizer

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mr. S. is a 56-year-old rice farmer who lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. Since 1980, he has been growing rice. Rice is the only source of income for his family. He and his wife work hard every day on the farm, even though they face some difficulties. He has two children living at home; one is studying and the other helps on the rice farm. Three other children are married.

To improve his farming business, S. requests a loan to purchase two young buffaloes, and buy some piglets to raise for another source of income.

loans.use: Purchase two young buffaloes, and buy some piglets to raise for another sources income

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Муродов Джамшед Ашуралиевич 1982 года рождения, женат. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хозтоваров и его стаж в этой деятельности 7 лет. Он торгует на рынке "Станция" города Вахдат хозяйственными товарами. В его ассортименте имеются электропечь, электроплита, электрочайники, нагреватели, светильники, ведра и тазики. Также в продажи имеются разновидность чайников, кухонные комбайны, посуды, термосы, утюги. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая.
Джамшед хочет пополнить свой товар, увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Он хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2000 сомони чтоб закупить электропечи и термосы.
texts.en:
Jamshed Ashuralievich M. was born in 1982. Jamshed is married. He has a business which he started seven years ago by selling household items. Now he sells household items at the station market of Vakhdat town. He sells a variety of electrical appliances and kitchenware. He buys wholesale from shuttle traders who bring goods from China. Jamshed would like to increase the assortment of goods and increase cash flow. He is applying for a loan of 2000 somoni for purchasing electrical ovens and thermos bottles.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase thermos bottles and electrical ovens

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Elizabeth es conviviente tiene  37 años, tres hijos de 21,16 y 4 años, los menores están en la escuela estatal.
El esposo de Elizabeth es cocinero, y hace un año, ambos decidieron poner un negocio de restaurante - picantería “El Erizo” abren su negocio partir de las seis de la tarde. Por las mañanas ambos trabajan en diferentes oficios, Elizabeth  trabaja en limpieza publica para la municipalidad.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de víveres arroz, fideo, papa, carne. 
Desde que esta en Finca,  recibe apoyo, charlas que la orientan de cómo llevar su negocio. 
El sueño de Elizabeth es poder traspasar su negocio a otro sitio, por que le queda muy pequeño.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a partner of the Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos (We Will Prevail United Communal Bank). Elizabeth is in a co-op. She is 37 years old, and has three children ages 21, 16 and 4 years old. The younger ones are in a state school. Elizabeth’s husband is a cook, and a year ago both of them decided to open a restaurant business of spicy foods called “El Erizo.” They open their business starting at six in the afternoon. In the morning they both work in different offices. Elizabeth does public cleaning for the city. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, to buy staples of rice, noodles, potatoes and meat. Since she’s been on the Co-Op, she receives support and consultations that teach her about running her business. Elizabeth’s dream is to be able to transfer her business to another site, because it’s still very small where she is presently.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 1000 soles, to buy basics: rice, beans, potatoes, meat

loans.name: Carminia

texts.es: Carminia es soltera, tiene 31 años de edad, en la actualidad vive con sus padres en casa de ellos. Es una mujer muy emprendedora, se dedica a la venta de pollos, los cuales vende a un caserío a tres días de viaje río arriba de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Ahí también, compra y vende madera, con estas actividades lleva 4 años y le va muy bien porque los 200 pollos que lleva a vender salen muy rápido, a un buen precio cada uno (S/.20.00). Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce muchos lugares ribereños y le es rentable. Más adelante, Carminia quiere mandar a construir un galpón para criar sus pollos y dejar de comprar a sus proveedores.  Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Cumbres Mundiales” y le gusta ser integrante porque existe mucha responsabilidad y exigencia entre todos. Carminia invertirá la mitad del monto solicitado en la compra de pollos y el resto en madera.
texts.en:
Carminia is single, thirty-one years old, and currently lives with her parents in their home. She is an enterprising woman who sells chickens to a farm house located in the city of Pucallpa, which is a three day river trip. She also buys and sells wood there. For four years, she has been engaging in these business activities and is doing well because the 200 chickens that she takes with her to sell go very fast at a good price (20 Peruvian Nuevos Soles each). She likes her job very much because she knows many riverside places and it is profitable. Later on, Carminia would like to build a shed in order to raise her chickens and stop buying from her suppliers. This is her second loan with MFP and her bank's name is "Cumbres Mundiales." She likes being a member because it is demanding and entails much responsibility among everyone. Carminia will invest half of the requested loan amount on chickens and the rest on wood.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Abra Enyonam

texts.fr: Cette  dame a pour activité principale le commerce de légumes et de laitue, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001, elle exerce cette activité près du marché local de Lossossimé  à agbalépédo, elle a déjà obtenu 02 crédits de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé. elle veut associé à son activité le commerce de charbons de bois, pour réaliser cela elle sollicite son troisième crédit de WAGES  pour acheter  18 sacs de charbons et des laitues. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est frigoriste, elle a 03 enfants
texts.en:
This woman's principal work involves commerce in vegetables and lettuce. She has been in this business since 2001 and works near the local marketplace of Lossossimé in Agbalépédo. She has obtained two WAGES loans before, and she indeed repaid them. With her business, she wants to include commerce in charcoal. In order to realize this, she's requesting her third WAGES loan to buy 18 sacks of charcoal and some lettuce. She is married to a gentleman who is a refrigeration specialist, and she has three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Rieziddin

texts.ru:
Риезиддин работает в школе преподавателем. Он женат, ему 35 лет, имеет 3 детей. Семья большая и на заработок преподавателя нормально не прожить. У Риезиддина есть немного арендованной земли, где он каждый год сеет различные хозяйственные культуры. Это также приносит ему корм для скота, которого у него несколько голов. Содержание скота приносит в семью дополнительный доход. Риезиддин подал заявку на КИВА и планирует приобрести корову с теленком.
(на фото жена Риёзиддина)
texts.en:
Rieziddin is a school teacher. He is 35 years old and is married with three children. A teacher's salary is not enough to support his large family. Rieziddin rents a plot of land for farming. This helps him secure fodder for the cattle. Cattle breeding is another source of income. Rieziddin has applied for a Kiva loan because he would like to purchase a cow and a bull calf. The photo features Rieziddin's wife.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a bull calf

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya B. is married with one child. She sells shoes and clothing at a market in the city of Nikopol. Lesya has been in this business for nine years. Her considerable experience allows her to choose good products that sell well.

Lesya is a hardworking and honest person. She desires to develop her business further and extend her sales to more places. Lesya would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase her assortment of items for sale.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of items for sale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 55 years old. Edna is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding their fishing business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia O. is thirty-seven years old, married, and is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. All are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Emilia is a trader, trading in charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal from surrounding communities and sells the charcoal on a table in front of her house. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy charcoal in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha trabaja vendiendo comida; tiene un puesto donde todo los días a partir de las 10:00 de la mañana vende almuerzo; Martha es madre soltera, el esposo lo abandonó hace 2 años y tiene un hijo que depende de ella. Ella vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Franz Tamayo de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la refacción de su vivienda; le falta el terminado de obra fina  de dos habitaciones.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación  del préstamo solicitado por Martha.
texts.en:
Martha works selling food. She has a stand where she sells lunch every day starting at ten in the morning. Martha is a single mother. Her husband abandoned her two years ago. She has a dependent son. She lives in her own house in the Franz Tamayo zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to refurbish her house. The work on two of the rooms has not been finished. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies Martha for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for finishing two rooms in her house in order to live more comfortably

loans.name: Phurng

texts.en: Mrs. Phurng S., a  60-year-old housewife living in Tos Prak village in Kandal Province, is married to Mr. Yong Morn,  a farmer who owns a piece of land upon which he cultivates vegetables. Mrs. Phurng S. is requesting a loan to buy a pump machine to support the field. She has a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine to support the field.

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es: El señor Marcial es un hombre que a su 58 años de edad, ha logrado mantener su negocio que hace treinta dos años logro poner con mucho esfuerzo, antes se dedicaba al destace de cerdo y vendía carne, en su casa y en el mercado, poco a poco logro ir vendiendo zapato nuevo y usados el cual hasta ahora vende y ha logrado tener un buen inventario. Reside en el barrio José Dolores Estrada en la capital de Managua, casado y con seis Hijos los cuales están independientes unos son comerciante. Da las gracias a Dios que le ha dado salud y poder sacar adelante a su familia, se ha beneficiado en gran manera con los prestamos en Afodenic lo cual ha invertido en la compra de zapatos. Con este crédito espera comprar variedad de zapatos, nuevos y de segunda mano que estén accesibles para el cliente, el vende en un mercado de la Capital de Managua el mas visitados por los Nicaragüense por la variedad de productos y por su bajos costos. A futuro espera poder vender otros productos para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcial is a man who at 58 years of age, has succeeded, through considerable effort, in maintaining his business for 30 years. At first, he was a pork butcher and sold meat in his house and in the market. Then, little by little he began selling new and used shoes and now has obtained a good inventory. He lives in the José Dolores Estrada neighborhood in the capital Managua. He is married and has six independent children - some are also shopkeepers. He thanks God for his good health and the ability to support his family. He has benefitted greatly from the Afodenic loans which he used to buy shoes. With this loan, he hopes to buy a variety shoes, both new and second hand ones which may be more feasible for his customers. He sells them at a market in the capital Managua which, due to the variety of products and low prices, is popular with Nicaraguans.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
Honoria es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Honoria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Honoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, carne.
Honoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Honoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Honoria is a member of the Kausachun Microfinance Institute—which means “Long live!” in Quechua.

Honoria is a 37-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children. She has a general store in her home in which she sells general provisions, fruits, vegetables, and meats.

Honoria needs a 900.00 PEN loan in order to invest in purchasing sugar and rice. She dreams that her children may one day become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Matha is a member of the Sokoni borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 26 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 6 and 2 years old.

Martha has owned a clothing business for 6 years, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Martha`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh i order to buy more vitenge and kanga(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Martha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more kanga  and vitenge for sale

loans.name: Thaiy

texts.en: Thaiy N., age 33, lives in a medium wooden house where she braids silk skirt for sale. Thaiy N. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She has two children; one of whom assists her with weaving silk, while the other one is married and lives separately. Thaiy N. has been a silk weaver for 19 years, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then takes it to re sell at the market in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has also been hired by the villagers to spin silk where she can earn extra income. Recently, a part of the raw material has been ran out from stock supply; Thaiy N. wants to resupply and is requesting a loan from HKL to purchase more silk to continue weaving.

loans.use: To purchase more silk to continue weaving

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. is from the village of Militar,Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Lorna is married and has 3 school aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating pedicab transport services. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay for the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her pedicab transport service

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem P., 53, is a widow with three children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling fish at a local market in the town, earning approximately US $4 per day. The family is also assisted by her children who are currently employed at a local garment factory with a daily income of US $3 per day. And another child is working in a neighboring country, sending his money once every two months. Those sources of income from her children help cover the household expenses. Mrs. P. is seeking to improve her standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Mrs. P. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work at the factory easily.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza G., 34, is from the village of Aurora. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Feliza owns & operates a retail general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products to the local community. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Feliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enhance her ability to engage in business activities. Feliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products for sale. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which, once again, will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be Feliza's sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for sale

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Rafael es casado con la señora Sarai Ortiz y son una familia aunque joven pero muy bien establecida y trabajadora, ellos anteriormente ya tenían un crédito con nosotros y realizaron su proyecto que fue el inicio de la construcción de un cuarto de baño, pero están tramitando nuevamente para terminar los acabados interiores del cuarto en construcción; el labora para una empresa de asuntos viales y ella para una empresa de venta de muebles para el hogar. 
(el solicitante no se encontraba ya que andaba trabajando fuera de la ciudad y se le tomo la fotografia a su conyuge)
texts.en:
Carlos Rafael is married to Sarai Ortiz. Although they are a young family, they are well established and hard-working. They had a prior loan with us with which they began a project which consisted in building a bathroom. They are requesting new funding to finish the interior touches to the bathroom that's still under construction. He works for a firm that deals with traffic issues and she for a home furniture store. (He, the loan applicant, was unavailable since he was working out of town; the photo is of his wife..

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the bathroom.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La joven María De los Ángeles M. G. es trabajadora del centro de salud Leonel Rugama en Estelí desempeñándose como enfermera.
María va usar el crédito para compra de electrodoméstico como lavadora y una cocina. Quiere la lavadora ya que quiere gastar menos tiempo lavando.
Ella espera que la lavadora y la cocina le ayuden mucho debido a que pasa el mayor de su tiempo trabajando.
María es soltera y solo convive con su hermana, ha trabajado con Ceprodel por 4 años y 4 créditos.
María expreso que sus créditos con Ceprodel han ayudado mucho a comprar su electrodoméstico que necesitan en su casa.
texts.en:
Young María De los Ángeles M. G. works as a nurse in the health center Leonel Rugama in Estelí. She will use this loan to buy home appliances such as a washing machine and a kitchen range. She wants the washing machine because she would like to spend less time washing. She expects that the washing machine and the range will help her a lot, since she spends the majority of her time working. Maria is single and lives only with her sister. She has worked with Ceprodel for 4 years and through 4 loan cycles. Maria says that the loans from Ceprodel have been a big help, allowing them to buy the appliances that they need in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy household appliances (washing maching and kitchen range)

loans.name: Nidjat

texts.en: Nidjat S. is a young, single man living in Baku city, Azerbaijan. He explains that he was born in 1987. For three years now, Nidjat has been in the business of selling clothing. He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN ($2,500) to improve his business by expanding the clothing display area.

loans.use: To improve his business by expanding the display area

loans.name: Ta-Taesu-Tekeh Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Ta-Taesu-Tekeh group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve and they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick. 

Isatu L. is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in a village called Mababato about 45 years ago. She is married to a teacher and they have six children. Isatu has sold soft drinks, sugar, cigarettes, butter, batteries, kerosene, etc., for more then 20 years now. She will use this loan to buy the previously mentioned items in larger quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, sugar, cigarettes, butter, batteries, kerosene, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Sylverien

texts.en:
Sylverien is 50 years old and is married with three children aged between 7 and 21. He also takes care of two dependent relatives aged 16 and 18. He and his family live in Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Kimisagara where his business is located.

Sylverien owns a small pub which sells different kinds of beers and soft drinks. His business is well-known in his village. His wife sells foodstuffs in the market of Kimisagara and they both work hard for their family.

Sylverien’s business is very organized and he is able to employ eight people as helpers. The hours of his pub are from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day, even during the weekend. In fact on Saturdays and Sundays he receives more customers. Shortly, he will have had fourteen years of experience in his business.

The reason Sylverien is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company is in order to expand his business which will help him to earn more profits. With this loan he needs to buy a new fridge which will allow him to cool his beers and soft drinks.

With the additional profits Sylverien expects to earn, he will be reinvesting in his business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks plus a new refrigerator to cool his drinks

loans.name: Fanny Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Fanny Meja vive en la comunidad de Huizhill en la parroquia  Baños a las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia se caracterizada por su gastronomía típica que es sancocho, papas con cuy,  sus aguas termales y sus bosques que se han convertido en el principal atractivo turistico. 

Doña Fanny es sastre y lleva 35 años trabajando en esta profesión aprendió en un curso de corte y confección y ahora realiza unos finos ternos, trabaja sin tener un horario fijo y más cuando tiene obras que entregar, laborando todos los días.

Este es su segundo ciclo en la fundación, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio para la confección de sus prendas de vestir, en su vida personal se encuentra casada y tiene 53 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos su primer hijo de 30  y el segundo hijo de 26 años de edad son casados y viven independientemente con sus familias, su última hija que se encuentra de  18 años de edad estudia en la universidad de Cuenca, su esposo es sastre también de profesión, gracias a su trabajo como pareja han logrado construir su vivienda propia.

Con su nuevo crédito solicotado va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones, encajes y otras materias primas para sus confecciones y seguir trabajando en su pequeño taller. Su meta es  acabar su casa  que aún le falta algunos acabados internos.
texts.en:
Sra. Fanny M. lives in the community of Huizhill in Baños Parish, which is outside of the city of Cuenca. This parish is known for its traditional cuisine, such as “sancocho” (a popular soup in Latin America) and potatoes with guinea pig. Its thermal springs and forests have turned this place into one of the main tourist attractions.

Doña Fanny is a tailor and has been working in this profession for 35 years. She learned through a sewing course and now turns out some of the finest suits. Fanny does not work on a set schedule. Whenever there are more orders that have to be delivered, she works every day.

This is her second loan with the Foundation. She says that her clothing manufacturing business has greatly benefited from these loans. Regarding her personal life, she 53 years old and married. Her relationship has resulted in three children. The first two children are ages 30 and 26, and are married and live independently with their families. Their youngest daughter is 18 years old and is studying at the University of Cuenca. Fanny’s husband is also a tailor by profession. As a result of working together, they have been able to build their own home.

With this new loan she has requested, Fanny will buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, lace, and other materials needed to make garments and keep her working in her small workshop. Her goal is to complete her house because the only things lacking are some of the internal finishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, lace, and other materials

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Khalida wants a loan to buy cans of paint to sell. Shahnaz wants a loan to buy vehicle-repair tools for her motor workshop. Jamila is the group leader of the afore-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Borewala, a city famous for its shrines. 

Jamila is a widow. Her husband died of a heart attack four years ago. She did everything possible for his health but all was in vain. She completely lost herself after his death but she recovered herself for her children. Now her elder son supports the family. He is a painter and paints windows and doors on order. Jamila is applying for a loan to buy items (paint brushes, tins of paint) to increase the income of her son.

loans.use: To buy materials for her son's painting business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking lady who sells tree and plant seedlings in Kiambu to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2004. She says that the business is very profitable because she prepares the seedlings herself and later on sells them. Before she ventured into this business, she was previously practicing farming where she grew cereals and vegetables which she sold in the market.

Mary saves her profits with her group in Faulu Kenya called Step Forward which enables her to access loans because the group guarantees them. She hopes to grow her business into a large-scale operation and improve her living standards in the future.

Mary has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more seeds for her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of flower and tree seeds

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Sumpango Group

texts.es: El grupo Emprendedoras de Sumpango esta conformado por 3 socias, la representante del grupo es Gladys I. las 3 socias se dedican al comercio, todas son originarias de Supango Sacatepequez. La señora Gladys se dedica a la venta de articulos de consumo diario. La señora Serapia quien es la madre de Gladys ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y cilindros de gas propano. Las dos quieren poner una venta de comida. La señora Maria tiene una venta de ropa de segunda y su negocio crece cada dia mas. Las 3 socias han trabajado con FAPE durante varios años y han demostrado que son responsables con los pagos. Ellas sueñan con hacer crecer sus negocios y asi mismo hacer prosperar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Emprendedoras de Sumpango” (Sumpango Entrepreneurs) group has three members. The group representative is Gladys I.. The three members are merchants and all are from Sumpango Sacatepequez. Gladys sells every day use items. Serapia, who is Gladys’ mother, sells tortillas and propane gas tanks. Both want to open a prepared food stand. Maria sells used clothing and her business grows more with each passing day. All three members have worked with FAPE for several years and have been very responsible with their repayments. They dream with making their businesses grow so that their families can prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy everyday use items and gas tanks.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal Los Corrales del cantón Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, nos reunimos con la socias del sector y nos permitió conocer más de ellas,  la señora Diana, tiene 20 años de edad, es madre de un niño de apenas diez meses de edad,  se encuentra muy feliz con su primogénito, lleva una relación de año y medio con su esposo, juntos tienen el negocio de tagua, los créditos que recibe de la Fundación son invertidos en su negocio, consiste en comprar la materia prima para trabajarla, darle un acabado y luego llevar la tagua a los grandes distribuidores en el puerto de Manta, de donde es enviada a otros países del mundo para darle el acabado final y transfórmala en botones, aretes y arreglos en diferentes modelos.
 
El esposo de la señora Diana también tiene otra actividad para poder ayudarse más en el hogar, y en los actuales momentos es chofer de una volqueta que recorre por el sector de la ciudad y provincia, nuestra socia Diana no ha podido terminar sus estudios debido a que se comprometió estando estudiando y luego que salió embarazada dejo de estudiar y para ella terminar sus estudios es el sueño que le gustaría hacer realidad por ello está retomándolos.

Nuestra socia Diana con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo en la tagua y seguir haciendo crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
A staff member of Fundación ESPOIR met with the Communal Bank “Los Corrales” (The Corrals) from the canton of Montecristi in Manabí Province in order to get to know some of the local members a little bit better. One of them is Sra. Diana, who is 20 years old and the mother of a ten month old son. Her firstborn keeps her very happy and she has been married for a year and a half. She and her husband run a business selling “tagua” (the hard white coating of a specific palm seed that is used as a substitute for elephant ivory). The loans she has received from Fundación ESPOIR were invested into her business so that she can buy the materials used in her work. She polishes the tagua and then sells it to large distributors at the port of Manta. For there, it is shipped to other countries around the world for to be processed further and transformed into buttons, earrings, and ornaments of different kinds.

Diana’s husband also has another business to help provide additional household income. At the moment, he works as a truck driver and travels throughout the city and the province. Diana was not able to finish school as she had promised because of her pregnancy. Her dream is to resume her studies.

With this new loan, Diana will invest all of it in the purchase of more tagua so that she can continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase "tagua" (a substitute for elephant ivory)

loans.name: Ahmadshekh

texts.en:
A. Ahmadshekh is a 34-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children. Ahmadshekh works as an inspector of a government agency of social insurance and pensions. Since he earns little he also runs a business raising and selling cattle. He has 12 years of experience in this field. 

Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Ahmadshekh has become a very successful businessman. Ahmadshekh has a friendly family who always try to help each other. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Ahmadshekh wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So for that he applied for a loan of 7,000 Somoni. With your help Ahmadshekh can get ahead.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand cattle holdings

loans.name: Younes

texts.en:
Younes is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon. He started working as a mechanic to earn an income to help with the many expenses of his family. Then, in 2004, Younes opened his own repair shop to improve his living conditions. He changes car oil and repairs tires and the wheel. 

Today, Younes is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase car oil for his garage. He hopes to keep on renewing his equipment and acquiring newer tools in order to develop and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase car oil for his garage

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 35 años, es una madre trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos. El limpiar C. y lavar ropa ajena, han sido en la vida de María una actividad necesaria para vivir. Desde su juventud y cuando la abandonó  su esposo,  dicha labor la ayudó a mantener  a sus hijos. Con el pasar de los años fue desempeñándose en la bisutería, bordados y tejidos a  crochet y agujas. Ahora tiene dos actividades, durante la semana, solo dos a tres días se dedica en la limpieza de casa y los demás días elabora chompas y otras prendas, en el que son exportados al extranjero. Lleva 15 años trabajando en esta actividad  y considera que le gusta su trabajo, porque no descuida a sus hijos, además le da la rentabilidad que necesita. Su mayor anhelo es educar a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, ya que sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su negocio. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa  comprar conos de hilos al por mayor, en diversos colores y grosor, siendo una herramienta necesaria para tejer chompas.
texts.en:
María, age 35, is a hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her four children. Cleaning houses and washing other people’s clothes have been necessary activities in Maria’s life in order to live. Since her youth and when her husband abandoned her, this work helped her support her children. As the years passed, she was working with jewelry, embroidery, and knitting and crocheting items. She now has two activities. During the week, only two or three days, she cleans houses. The other days she makes sweaters and other garments. They are exported to foreign countries. She has been working in this activity for 15 years. The thing she likes best about her work is that she is not neglecting her children. Also, it gives her the profits that she needs. Her greatest desire is to educate her children and expand her business. This is her 15th loan with MFP. She pledges to make her payments on time. She knows that this support will be very useful to the progress of her business. She plans to use the requested loan to buy yarn wholesale. She will buy different colors and thicknesses of yarn. Yarn is a necessary tool to knit sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yarn to knit sweaters

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela V. Z., tiene la edad de 49 años, está viuda, y vive con sus tres hijas. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una computadora. Desea comprar la computadora para que sus hijas que estudian cuenten con una herramienta tan importante hoy día para el estudio, con el fin de que puedan realizar sus trabajos.  Doña Mayela se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café. Es la  primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Mayela V. Z., 49, is a widow and lives with her three daughters. She will use the funds to buy a computer. She wants to buy the computer so that her daughters that are in school will have a tool that is so important nowadays for school so that they can do their assignments. Mayela is a farmer, specifically coffee. This is her first loan request from FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the terms offered. She hopes in future to provide a better quality of life and improved financial stability for her family as well as to continue to grow both as a person and as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Mrs. Kung Yav Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Prey Mul village in the Takeo province has ten people who have been selected and who all make up a village bank loA..  All the members will use their portion of the loA. in varied ways to support their businesses in this current year.  Mrs. Kung Y. is a village bank president who was born in 1944.  Mrs. Kung Y. and her husband, Mr. Chhoeun A., are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family.  Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, but she did not have enough money to support it.  So to improve her production, Mrs. Kung Y. is applying for a loA. to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loA., she will rent a plow machine to plow her own field.  The couple has a child who is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a plow.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif A. is a young married man who breeds poultry and calves in Imishli city. Akif is full of energy and he tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Akif started his business two years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is now a pensioner. Akif has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed the work during his childhood. He is married and has two children. He would like to increase the number of chickens he keeps and build a new coop. This will help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and build a coop

loans.name: Tob

texts.en: Tob I., 27, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Chnang province. Since 1999, she has been raising pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US $2.50 per day, while her husband has a business recharging batteries. He typically makes US $5 of income a day. Tob I. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to make a new investment for her husband. Tob I. wants to buy technician tools for hI.. Before, her husband was a technician, so this time she wants her husband to start this kind of business in order to gain more income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy technician tools

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 40-year-old married man living with his wife in Chtoura. He has worked by transporting sand and rocks in his caterpillar (tractor) for the past 15 years. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to add to what he has saved towards the price of the new pick-up which he bought to increase and improve his work.  His clients are his neighbors and neighboring villages. His father’s support and his good reputation were the key to being introduced to his clients. He is working on expanding his work as much as he can.

loans.use: To pay for the new pick-up

loans.name: Aparicio Santiago

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Aparicio Santiago; el tiene 57 años de edad y es divorciado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio trabaja en un estudio jurídico, el es abogado y trabaja en la ciudad de Cusco desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m por medio saca adelante a sus hijos pero en algunas oportunidades no alcanza, el socio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar ya que dos de sus hijos estudian economía y el otro estudia derecho. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Aparicio Santiago, 57, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank located in Izcuchaca district, Anta province, Cusco department.

He is divorced and has five children.  He works in a law firm; he’s a lawyer and works in Cusco from 8am until 6pm to support his children.  Sometimes, however, it’s not enough.  He wants his children to finish their schooling.  Two of them are majoring in Economics and one in Law.  He is asking for the loan to pay their educational expenses.

He uses this forum to thank all those who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To pay for his children's schooling.

loans.name: Maria Lorna

texts.en:
Maria Lorna L. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, noodles and junk foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Farrah. In 1988, Farrah established his carpentry items business, making and selling chairs, beds, and cupboards. He began his business because he wanted to generate income and establish a savings account for retirement. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about $150 every month from his business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more lumber. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately $300. In the future, Farrah plans to produce more quality products as the demand for his products is very high. He also hopes to buy more working tools, as he wants to train some younger workers. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia is a resident of Arifwala which is a small city in Pakistan, located in Punjab province. It is known for its agriculture industry. Zakia lives there in the area called Mullah Eid Gah which is a small residential area of the city. She came here after her marriage to A. R.. She has 4 children. Three daughters are enrolled in school while her son is below 4 years of age and has not started to attend school yet. 

She supports her family financially by doing embroidery work for her neighboring clients. Her husband is involved in a construction supplies sales business. He provides construction supplies on order to his customers and generates income for the family.
 
Zakia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in larger quantity and improves his business.
