He has been in this business for some time now and Zakia is hopeful that through a loan investment he will successfully be able to improve his business conditions by serving more clients. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zakia.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies sales business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel D. is from the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 48 years old. Miguel is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests corn to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $185 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Miguel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is a 43-year-old married woman, mother of four children and owner of a gift shop since 2000. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy special occasion gifts to sell during this Holy season. May is very experienced in this business and her clients can be anyone, because she works in a very popular area where people visit for shopping. She provides gifts for several different occasions and this is what helps her business to increase. She didn’t find problems at the beginning because she has good communication skills and customer service. She helps her husband and children in their living and hopes to provide them a good and secure living.

loans.use: To buy special occasion gifts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: she want to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Doreen has a business selling fish, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fish for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Doreen hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to study business administration at university.
Doreen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her life-planning skills, which guide her during decision-making.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Mutui Ole  Tako

texts.en:
Mutui Ole Tako L. is 36 years old, married and the father of three school-going children. Mutui has been farming on his own piece of land for the last four years.

Mutui learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use to prepare the land and to buy farm supplies. The farm is located along the main road, which makes it easy for him to get customers for his maize. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, Mutui will reinvest in the farm to increase his maize production. In the future, he wants to venture into commercial farming.

loans.use: to prepare the land and to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Tabatasu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tabatasu” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 per person. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Katrine K. is the leader of this group. The 28-year-old is married to a driver and they have three children who attend primary school. Katrine has been a businesswoman for 15 years, selling palm-oil and rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to resell.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to sell

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Madame HÉLÈNE N. est une femme de 61 ans ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses 03 petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis le 22 juin 2004. 

Elle fait de l'embouche porcine comme activité principale. Et comme activité secondaire elle vend de la crème glacée et de la glace. Elle pratique l'élevage de porcs depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter 15 pourceaux pour renforcer son élevage de porcs et de payer les factures d'électricité liées à la vente de crème et de glace. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille par l'achat de la nourriture et le payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Hélène N. is a 61-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children. She also has three of her grandchildren in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SAINTE ANNE2 since June 22, 2004.

Hélène fattens pigs as her main business. And as her secondary business, she sells ice cream and ice. She has been raising pigs for over ten years.

Her loan will enable her to buy 15 hogs for bolstering her livestock business and covering the cost of electricity associated with the selling of ice cream and the ice.

Hélène's goal is to boost her savings and to help support her family by buying food and covering her children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy 15 hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal for retailers

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a business-lady who does tailoring.  Her business is only eight months old.  She left employment and went into business so that she would earn better income for her family.  Being a mother of two, she works hard in her business to bring up the children.  She hopes to be a successful business-lady in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy fabric and shoes.

loans.use: To buy fabric and shoes.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia works hard to support two children. She is married and has a  vegetable-selling business in the Philippines. 

Venancia requested a 3,500 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. 

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency. 

Venancia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es: El señor Eustaquio es artesano dedicado a la confección de chamarras. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de telas, cierres, hilos, forros y otros insumos para continuar con esta actividad, la cual solventa los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz;  es viudo  y tiene dos hijos. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006.
texts.en: Mr. Eustaquio is an artisan who makes handcrafted jackets. He needs this loan in order to purchase fabric, zippers, thread, lining, and other supplies to continue with this business, which helps him cover the family expenses. He lives in his own home located in the Alto Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. He is a widower who has two children. He has been a member of Impro since 2006.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, zippers, and lining for his jacket business.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor is 54 and resides in Prey Veng province, one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia.  Nhor is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family spends USD 25 on food and USD 15 on other necessary expenses. Nhor is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to finish the construction of her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to finish the construction on her house

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 31 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than ten years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and local fishermen. 

She is married to Sy, 41, who works as a primary teacher in the Baray district. He gets a proper salary each month. 

This is the rainy season and the rain is falling down almost every day, so it is a good time to start planting her rice crop but she doesn’t have immediate cash to do that. So Kim is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds, and she will use the rest of the loan to pay for plowing costs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.name: Morice

texts.en:
Morice is a hard-working businessman. He is married and is blessed with four children.

For five years he has been selling second-hand clothes. He also does welding to supplement his income. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access finance to purchase more clothes and has learned methods for managing his business. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale business. He would like KES 30,000 to buy stocks of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines and earns additional income from abaca weaving.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Yumi Giannina

texts.es:
Yumi nació en la comunidad Papel Pata en el distrito de Echarate provincia de la Convección (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 30 años de edad. Yumi trabajó en la municipalidad de Echarate en el área de Almacén de Obra pero por motivos de salud tuvo que renunciar. Ella es una mujer luchadora que no se deja vencer por las adversidades y decidió aplicar lo que sus padres le enseñaron sobre la agricultura. Ella tiene varios terrenos donde cultiva plátanos y un poco de cacao. Ella vende sus productos en la ciudad de Quillabambaa a 45 minutos de donde vive. En esta oportunidad Yumi requiere el préstamo para limpiar la mala yerba que crece en sus cultivos entonces tiene que contratar peones y después les pagará. Su sueño de Yumi es abrir una empresa de venta de frutas al por mayor. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Caminando Juntos” de la Asociación Arariwa sede Quillabamba.
texts.en:
Yumi was born in the commmunity of Papel Pata, in Echarate district, in La Convección province, in Cusco, Peru.  She is 30 years old.  Yumi worked for Echarate council in the field of storage.  However, she had to give up her job for health reasons.  She is a tenacious woman who doesn't let herself be beaten by setbacks.  She decided to put into practice what her parents taught her about farming.  She has several plots of land where she grows bananas and a little cacao.  She sells her produce in the city of Quillabamba which is 45 minutes from where she lives.  On this occasion, Yumi needs a loan to get rid of the weeds around her crops.  For this, she needs to hire laborers and pay them.  Yumi's dream is to open a business selling fruit wholesale.  

Yumi is a responsible and hard-working person who, owing to these personal qualities, was invited by her friends to join Asociación Arariwa's "Caminando Juntos" community bank.

loans.use: to pay workers' wages

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем, у нее есть 8-летняя дочь. Светлана живет в Бердянске. Она торгует женской одеждой, детской одеждой и обувью на одном из местных рынков. Бердянск - курортный город, где всегда много потенциальных покупателей, будь то местные жители или приезжие отдыхающие. Подходящие цены для покупателей, качество и большой выбор товара, умение общаться с людьми помогли Светлане построить стабильный и надежный бизнес, которым она занимается вот уже 10 лет. Оборотный капитал Светланы составляет 30 000 гривен. 

Светлане необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент товара и пополнить оборотные средства. Этот вид товара очень нравится Светлане. У нее есть поставщики, с которыми она работает уже долгое время и поддерживает деловые отношения. Светлана предприимчива, она старается всегда трудолюбиво относится к своему бизнесу и вежливо вести себя с покупателями, умеет их выслушать.   

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has an eight-year-old daughter. Svetlana lives in Berdyansk. She sells women's clothes, baby clothes and shoes in one of the local markets. Berdyansk is a resort town where there are always a lot of potential buyers, both local and visiting tourists. Reasonable prices, high quality, variety, and the ability to communicate with people has helped Svetlana build a stable and reliable business, where she has worked for ten years.  Svetlana's working capital is 30,000 hryvnia. 

Svetlana needs a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to buy a new range of products and to replenish her working capital. Svetlana really likes this aspect of doing business.  She has suppliers with whom she works for a long time, and she forms business relationships. Svetlana is enterprising. She always tries to work diligently in her business, and to behave politely with her customers and listen to them.

loans.use: to buy a new range of products

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 41 years old and has four children. He now lives in the rural area of Ilagan province, Isabela, where he engages in his economic activities.

Fernando is a nice, responsible, hard-working man who currently engages in the rental of a rice mill machine in their community. He has been engaged in this activity for seven months already, and things are going very well thanks to the determination with which he works. 

On this occasion, Fernando is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy spare parts to repair the machinery of his rice mill machine. He hopes to be able to sustain the needs of his family and to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his rice mill machine

loans.name: Lucrecia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lucrecia de los Ángeles tiene 49 años su actividad es la venta de ropa usada, tiene tres años de experiencia en este negocio a pesar de que no ha sido fácil ya que tiene una pequeña tienda en donde es visitada por amigos, vecinos y familiares, lo inicio con esfuerzo propio poco a poco a ido aumentando su inventario. El crédito es para la compra de pantalón, camisa, falda, trajes. Vestidos. Ella sueña con tener una tienda con un buen inventario.
texts.en: Lucrecia de los Ángeles is 49 years old.  Her activity is selling used clothing.  She has three years’ experience in this business despite it’s not being easy.  She has a small store where she’s visited by friends, neighbors and relatives.  She started it with efforts of her own and gradually has been increasing her inventory.  The loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses.  She dreams with having a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
La señora Obdulia tiene la edad de 40 años, estudia la secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Jorgue quien trabaja de obrero, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando la primaria. Ella y su familia viven en una comunidad que se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera.

Ella nos platica que desde hace mas de 2 años decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo porque quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Obdulia realiza sus ventas de zapatos, saliendo a caminar casa por casa, les muestra a sus amigas y vecinos su catalogos, levanta el pedido y sale a comprar sus pedidos, cuando ya los trae los reparte con sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos, tambien nos comenta que en ocasiones ya llegan sus clientes a ver si tiene nuevos catalogos y le hacen pedidos, ella dice que le da mucha alegria que su negocio prospere.


 Ella necesita este credito para la venta de catalogos y zapatos para su posterior venta

Doña Obdulia espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y en un futuro a sus hijos ofrecerles una profesion.
texts.en:
Obdulia, age 40, has a high school education.  She is married to Jorque, a workman.  She has two children who attend elementary school.  She and her family live in a community that is in a sugarcane zone.

She tells us that over two years ago she decided to start her business of selling shoes by catalog.  She started her business because she wants to help her husband with the household expenses.  She also wants to give her children a better quality of life.

Obdulia sells her shoes by going door to door.  She shows her friends and neighbors her catalog.  She gets the order, and she leaves to buy what is ordered.  She takes the orders to her customers, and she receives payment for her products.  She also tells us that sometimes her customers come to see if she has new catalogs, and they place orders.  She says that it gives her a lot of joy that her business is prospering.

She needs this loan for catalog sales and shoes that she will later sell.  Obdulia hopes that with this investment her business will prosper.  She also hopes that in the future she will give her children a profession.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Shining Star Group

texts.en:
Nkulumo is 47 years old, married, and  has four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in Gweru.  Nkulumo buys and sells a wide range of items including radios and clothing and has been doing so for two years.  She has two employees.  Her main problems are the cost of transport and insufficient funds to expand the business.  She has no other sources of income.

Nkulumo is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock for sale including radios, clothing, shirts, and jeans. She hopes that her business will continue to expand and that one day she will have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase radios and clothing for sale

loans.name: Gulabbas

texts.en: Gulabbas is 55 years old and the father of three children. His wife is a housekeeper. To earn a living, Gulabbas owns a two-hectare field for cultivating vegetables such as tomatoes and potatoes. He also has a garden where he grows fruit. He makes 150 USD profit from selling his crops. He usually sells them in the central bazaar. On his land, Gulabbas is now unable to do any planting because he does not have enough money for seeds and fertilizer. To deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 1500 AZN to buy the necessary supplies. Gulabbas sees this as an opportunity to obtain a better yield which will improve his family's living conditions. This will be his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and garden tools

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Victor tiene un snack de comida rápida y su esposa lo ayuda en su negocio. El crédito lo requiere para aumentar el capital de trabajo ya que comprando por mayor los insumos como ser: arroz, papa, aceite, les resulta más barato y por consiguiente influye en un mejor volumen de ganancias. Vive en casa de alquiler misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz; Victor es casado  y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor has a snack bar and his wife helps with his business. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase his operating capital so that he can buy supplies in bulk such as rice, potatoes, and oil. By purchasing in volume, he will be able to get these products much cheaper and improve his earnings. Victor lives in a rented house in the District of Tacagua in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk such as rice, potatoes, and oil.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 35 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, James has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells local liquor and beer. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer, and will help James to generate greater profits and purchase ad space to attract more customers. James hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like James, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Emma Group

texts.en:
Emma, age 50, has been a rice farmer for the past 10 years. She has requested a loan of PhP 23,900 to purchase fertilizer for her rice plants. Emma has been a member of PMPC for four years. She and her husband live with their four children in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Emma is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each of the two members has her own business.

In the future, Emma hopes to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
This is Rubylyn, who is 34 and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, who is a factory worker, and she is the mother of her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rubylyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rubylyn dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu, age 55, established her vegetable farming business in 1995. She works her farmland four hours a day, seven days a week. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan proceeds to buys seeds and fertilizers. She and her husband have raised one child, now 38. In the future, Bindu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru: Бахри работает на станции скорой помощи дежурным-диспетчером в течении 15 лет. У нее трое сыновей, муж умер 8 лет назад. Двоих последних сыновей женила сама, купила им квартиру. В настоящее время  ее сыновья находятся в России один уехал  с женой, но своих детей оставил ей на попечение. Она одна растит своих внуков - школьников, покупает еду, одежду и прочие вещи. Иногда присылает деньги их отец. Другой сын также уехал и оставил свою жену Бахри, она домохозяйка и Бахри также ей  дает деньги на еду и одежду. Сейчас им необходимо купить стиральную машинку, купив машинку у ее невестки останется больше времени для  детей и другого домашнего хозяйства. Сыновья Бахри обещали присылать деньги матери для покупки нового телевизора на новый год. Она не рассчитывает на  присылаемые деньги от своих детей, а планирует  сама делать покупки и не хочет от них зависеть, потому что она считает, что у каждого сына есть своя семья  и они должны обеспечивать свою семью, а она со своими силами сама справиться, потому что получает заработную плату и пенсию.
texts.en: Bahri has been working as an on-duty dispatcher at a medical emergency service for 15 years.  She has three sons, and her husband passed away eight years ago.  She married off two of her youngest sons and purchased them an apartment.  Currently, her sons are in Russia, and one of them left with his wife, but left the children for Bahri to support.  Bahri is raising her school-age grandchildren by herself, buys them food, clothing and other things.  Sometimes, their father sends back money.  Bahri's other son also left and left his wife, who is a homemaker, and Bahri also gives her money for food and clothing.  Currently, they need to purchase a washing machine because, having bought the appliance, her daughter-in-law would have more time for the children and other household work.  Bahri's sons promised to send money to their mother to buy a new television for the New Year's holiday.  She, however, does not rely on money sent by her sons and plans to make the purchases on her own.  Bahri does not want to depend on her sons because she thinks that since each son has his own family, they should provide for their families, and she can use her own efforts to support her needs because she earns a salary and a pension.

loans.use: to purchase a washing maсhine

loans.name: Retchel

texts.en:
Retchel is 27 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 2 children.

Retchel has a general store in partnership with her sister-in-law.  She also engages in a buy-and-sell business for dry goods.  She earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 49,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Retchel has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Juan De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Juan de Jesús a sus 54 años de edad se dedica desde su casa a la cría, compra y venta de cerdos en un lugar adecuado que tiene para esta actividad, la cual realiza en una jornada de las 5:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m. desde hace cuatro años. Gracias a esta actividad puede generar su sustento y el de sus dos hijos. Actualmente, el señor Juan de Jesús requiere de la compra de cerdos con el ánimo de poder mejorar sus ventas y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y a futuro cumplir su sueño de ampliar la vivienda de sus cerdos y tecnificar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan de Jesús, 54 years old, makes a living working from home by raising, buying and selling pigs in a suitable place he has for such activity. His working day has been from 5:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. for the last four years. Thanks to this activity he can provide for himself and for his two children. 

Currently, Juan de Jesús needs to buy pigs with the aim of improving sales. He hopes to be able to improve his quality of life and in the future fulfil his dream of extending the housing for the pigs and of technifying his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten up and later sell.

loans.name: Rosamaria

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Rosamaria tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Yanatile de la provincia de Calca departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad de Calca. Su actividad económica principal de Rosamaria es la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Tambien, Rosamaria venta de gas en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Rosamaria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas. Su sueño de Rosamaria es ampliar el negocio de venta de gas.
texts.en:
The communal bank  “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” is made up of responsible, hard-working people who provide for their families.  The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco, where they also work.  Cusco is known for its tourism and business, its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for having one of the Seven Wonders of the World, "Machupicchu".  

Rosamaria is 35 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has two children.  She was born in the Yanatile district in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco, but lives in the beautiful city of Calca.  Rosamaria sells groceries for a living and has a grocery store in her home.  She has been running this business for three years and things are going well for her. Rosamaria also sells gas from her home.  She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar as well as other things.  Her dream is to expand her gas sales business.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar for her store.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Hugo y su hijo; Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, huevos, pan, bebida, jabones, entre otros, la tienda está ubicada en el lugar de su domicilio y ya tiene varios años de tenerla, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas,  y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque es el negocio más surtido además posee los productos con mejor calidad a precios bajos, pero sobre todo con un servicio inigualable; María Isabel es una mujer dedicada a su labor, visionaria con muchas metas que ha decidido alcanzar ya que sabe que solo así logrará el éxito, su más grande sueño es hacer crecer su negocio pero necesita de capital para invertir en productos que mas se venden y otros que no tiene, ´por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, y bebidas, María Isabel tiene buenas referencias de pago y una  moral intachable tiene la certeza que cancelara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, bebidas

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is aged thirty eight and is a farmer in Litein county in Kenya where he lives. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past twelve years, producing milk which he sells to the cooling plant and tea at the market in his area and wants to venture in poultry keeping.

He is requesting for 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi kilimo to purchase poultry birds which he will later sell the products and earn extra income to uplift his livelihood and increase his  farming business, he aspires to have doubled his business in the next five years.

Poor markets for his products is his major challenge in farming.

Wilson is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for providing him with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Aina

texts.en:
Aina is 22 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of dry goods to sell for her business.

Aina has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell dry goods for 10 years and also earns an income from general store.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dry goods to sell for her business

loans.name: Aisah Laela

texts.en:
Aisah Laela is a student in the Pasundan Vocational high school 1 actually in Cianjur.
she is a smart student in the school, but she has problem by costs. so she wishes komida and kiva can for help her problem by give her loan for education. and after get the loan she really helpful by that's. So Thank you all for the help.

loans.use: to Pay for half school costs

loans.name: Yvette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yvette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yvette âgée de 32 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Yvette est mariée à un certain Aimé. Le couple a un enfant, qui n’est pas encore scolarisé et à leur charge. Pour cette raison, Yvette vend des pâtes alimentaires, des boîtes de conserve, des condiments et de l’huile végétale dans sa région ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille et à l'éducation de son enfant. Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Yvette sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé

loans.use: Acheter des des pâtes alimentaires, des boîtes de conserve, des condiments et de l’huile végétale.

loans.name: Abshiri

texts.en:
Abshiri is a farmer and salesperson from Kitale area of Kenya. He practises livestock and crop farming to make a living. His priority at the moment is taking care of his family and growing his business in order to generate enough income to provide for his family.
Abshiri is seeking a loan to buy cereal produce from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers at a higher price. Since his experience as a middleman enables him to arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, he prefers to aggregate and stock large volume of cereal produce and sell at once. His business helps local farmers to focus on production, which is the part they are good at, and helps him generate additional income.
During the festive season be inspired and grant her a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Perris would like to pay her daughter’s college fee

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Madame Florence is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a loan of $700 to expand her business. She has the requisite record-keeping skills and has been taught the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kogha Qaseem

texts.en: K. Qaseem  lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with all members of his family. He has a shop to produce sports clothes. Although he is educated, he doesn’t want to work in government offices. He wants to expand his business to make a good business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy new sewing machines and enlarge his shop to create close relations with all business dealer to make a better life for his family and also for himself.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina B.’s passion lies with children. A mother of two, Irina opened her business selling children’s clothing with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past nine years, Irina has successfully operated her business at the market in Melitopol. With her profits, she not only has improved the living standards for her children, but she has been able to support her elderly parents as well.

Irina has requested a loan of $600 to restock her clothing inventory. An optimistic businesswoman with a perfect credit history, Irina plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her children's clothing business

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga is 45 year old lady from the village of Manono. She started her relationship with S.P.B.D. through Faleu Manono Centre, and as a member of this group, she is able to strengthen their fishing business . This is her first loan from this programme, and in the future, it will increase if she follows every guideline of this programme. Faaiuga said that she will use all of this financial support to continue building her business to a good standard, as it is the only income for her family.

loans.use: Fishing supplies

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
I am concerned about the security of my children. For this reason I would like to build a wall in front of my home so that they can be safe under the care of my wife. We live on a street where there is very little light so it is likely that when cars pass, the drivers do not see my kids playing, as they are very small. I therefore am requesting a loan of $600 to build a barrier on my property.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Me preocupa la seguridad de mis hijos por eso me gustaría poner una barda en mi vivienda para que puedan estar seguros al cuidado de mi esposa, tenemos poca luz en la calle así es que si pasan los carros es probable que no vean a los niños que juegan debido a que son muy pequeños”.Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para construir una barda en mi vivienda.

loans.use: To construct a barrier

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio is a an extremely experienced and diligent man, who is very well trained in agriculture which is a field he has been a part of for his whole life. He dedicated himself to this activity when he was very little, thanks to the enthusiasm that his parents instilled in him. It's with much effort that he is able to grow mangos and plantains, which he subsequently sells to wholesalers who bring his products to all the markets in his region. The development of these activities allows him to educate and adequately maintain his six children who are grateful for his effort and sacrifice. Today at 60 years of age, he continues to be an enterprising man who wants to make his way into more competitive markets with his fruit products; for that to happen he needs a substantial increase in investment and he appeals to your generous hearts. The help that he receives is very important and indispensable to ensure a noble end to the life of this working man.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Drejet, Kiva volunteer.

Eusebio, es un hombre sumamente experimentado y diligente, muy bien adiestrado en las labores agrícolas que durante toda su vida fueron parte de é, ya que se dedicó a esta actividad desde muy pequeño gracias al ánimo que sus padres inyectaban en él, es así que con mucho esfuerzo logra producir mangos y plátanos que posteriormente vende a comerciantes mayoristas que llevan sus productos a todos los mercados de su región. El desarrollo de estas actividades le permitieron educar y mantener adecuadamente a sus seis hijos quienes agradecen su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Hoy a sus 60 años el sigue siendo un hombre emprendedor por lo cual desea abrirse paso en mercados más competitivos a través de sus productos frutícolas; para ello necesita una mejora muy sustancial en la inversión que realiza y apela a vuestros corazones generosos ya que la ayuda que reciba es muy importante e imprescindible para este fin tan noble en la vida de este hombre trabajador.

loans.use: Raise capital to increase his production

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married and lives with his family in Vasilyevka.

Andrei sells ceramic tiles in the local department store where he rents a facility for his shop. He is still learning how to do business, as he started his venture only one year ago.

Andrei is a focused entrepreneur. He likes working for himself and being independent. He decided to go into business to be able to support his family and manage his time more efficiently. One of his main goals is to make money and grow professionally.

Andrei has requested a loan of $1000 to buy more tiles to sell in his store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ridhik

texts.en:
Ridhik S., age 35, owns a wholesale soft drinks business, which she started 3 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 5 PM daily, she earns about $45 a month from this business.

Ridhik has successfully taken out a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy soft-drink stock for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Ridhik belongs to a loan group called Baraka, which means “blessing” in Swahili.

loans.use: To buy more soft-drink inventory for her shop

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Noriani

texts.id:
Living in a Hindu neighborhood opens an opportunity for Ni Nyoman Noriani to open a store, which sells Kamen (traditional Balinese costume) and various Hindu worship means. She started this business because her husband’s income as a farmer was insufficient to meet their household needs, particularly now that both their kids were in school. With an initial capital of $100, Ni Nyoman Noriani built her business. She sources her materials from a local market. Since she has been doing this for a while, she has a particular store where she buys her inventory. With a small capital, she obviously yields a small profit, which is just enough to provide food for her family. Ni Nyoman Noriani requested a loan through DINARI Foundation to increase her capital. With this loan, she can buy Kamen and worship means in bigger quantities and wider selections so that her customers will have more items to choose from. She hopes that this business expansion can yield a higher profit, which can support their household needs and her children’s education plans. Ni Nyoman Noriani is very grateful for the loan given through DINARI.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal dilingkungan yang penduduknya sebagian besar beragama Hindu membuat Ni Nyoman Noriani mempunyai peluang untuk membuka usaha berjualan Kamen ( pakaian adat Bali ) dan berbagai sarana keperluan sembahyang untuk umat Hindu. Hal ini dilakukan karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang petani tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Apalagi sekarang kedua anaknya sudah duduk dibangku sekolah. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1000.000.- Ni Nyoman Noriani membangun usahanya ini. Barang dagangan ia beli di pasar yang ada di kotanya, karena pembelanjaan dilakukan secara rutin maka sekarang Ni Nyoman Noriani sudah mempunyai langganan tetap untuk pembelian barang dagangan tersebut. Dengan modal yang sedikit tentulah keuntungan yang diperoleh pun sedikit, dan itu hanya cukup untuk kebutuhan dapur saja. Oleh sebab itu Ni Nyoman Noriani mengajukan pinjaman modal ke Yayasan Dinari ,untuk menambah modal usahanya. Dengan modal tersebut sekarang Ni Nyoman Noriani bisa membeli Kamen dan juga perlengkapan sembahyang dengan jenis yang lebih banyak lagi ,sehingga pembeli bisa memilih sesuai dengan selera mereka. Pengembangan usaha ini diharapkan dapat memberi keuntungan yang lebih banyak ,sehingga kebutuhan keluarga dapat tercukupi dan anak-anak bisa bersekolah kejenjang yang lebih tinggi. Ni Nyoman Noriani sangat berterimakasih atas pinjaman modal yang diberikan oleh Dinari.

loans.use: To buy Hindu worship means in bigger quantities and wider selections so that customers can have more options

loans.name: Sokleng

texts.en:
Ms. Sokleng P., 26, is single and lives with her parents. She has two elder brothers and three elder sisters. All of them are married and live outside of the family house. The family lives along the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ms. Sokleng has been a weaver for six years.  It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then take sells it in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to weave silk and to repair part of her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to weave silk and to repair her house

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty G. sells charcoal, maize, beans and other groceries. She is a single parent of 2 children. Her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She wishes to increase sales.
She is running out of goods.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: The loan is for additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.en:
Agueda has lived in Samana her entire life. She has two children, ages 6 and 11, and a husband whom she looks after and supports. She already has a small business selling clothing, but she hopes to increase her profits with this loan. She hopes it will proviD. the capital to purchase a larger selection of clothes. She will use this loan to buy pants, skirts, blouses, and other clothing that she knows are in high demand. When Agueda is not working, she attends church services or her weekly bible study. One day she hopes to own a large successful clothing store, and she wants to start making repairs to her home as soon as she makes more money.

This is a group loan. The loan will go to support the business of each person in the group. The members help to guarantee the loan for one another.

Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity I. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family, where she sells drinks to the people in her community. She learned this business in 6 months and has been in this business since 2007. Charity needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more drinks for sale to meet the demands of her customers. Charity is a LAPO client. She says thank you to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This 33-year-old, married man is Abdul W., a resident of Ningarhar province. He is the father of five children and the only breadwinner for them.

Abdul W. and his family live in a small rental house in Jalalabad. His two children go to school, but in their spare time, they help their parents at their work.

Abdul W. has been working as a tailor besides his farming and animal husbandry for about 10 years. Before that, he worked in Peshawar (Pakistan) in this field, but when he returned to his homeland, he changed his business and started farming. After a few months, he found himself confronted with a lot of financial problems, because his father was facing some serious illnesses and W. had to spend his own money for his father's treatment. This is the reason that W. lost his capital. Then he borrowed some money from one of his friends and opened a small tailor shop in Behsood district.

As Abdul W. is a hard-working man, he was able to repay the loan just in four months, and finally he bought some new tailoring machines and recruited two other workers for his business.

Now, Abdul W. hopes to expand his business more and increase his daily income, because he wants to enroll his children in some private educational courses and also rent a bigger house for his family. At present, they are living in a small rental house which has just two rooms with a small courtyard.

Therefore, Abdul W. has decided to take a 50,000 Afghanis loan from AFSG for a term of 24 months. He wants to purchase some cloth for the shop with 30,000 Afghanis and buy a cow with remainder of the loan money. He thinks if he does this, he may able to achieve his goals and will bring brilliant positive changes to his life.

Abdul W. dreams of building a big house for his family and of standing on his own feet completely. He thanks the lenders who help him reach his goals in advance.

loans.use: To buy livestock and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar es casado y tiene tres hijas de edad escolar y el señor se dedica a la venta de barbacoa ambulante, el esta solicitando este prestamo para comprarle los utiles escolares a sus hijas, para ofrecerles a sus hijas una mejor educacion y por lo tanto un mejor futuro.
Cabe mencionar que en la foto no aparece el Sr Julio Cesar ya que el dia que se tomo eran las 8:00 de la mañana y el se encontraba en la calle con la venta de su barbacoa, asi es que solo se pudo localizar a su esposa y sus hijas.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is married and has three daughters that are students. He works selling "barbacoa" (slow cooked meat with spices). He requests a loan to buy school supplies for his daughters, so that they have a better education and therefore a better future. It's important to mention that Julio Cesar does not appear in the picture because the day it was taken, around 8:00 a.m., he was out working and selling barbacoa, thus only his wife and daughters are in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies for his daughters

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta tiene 44 años. Ella tiene un negocio en casa, una pensión donde brinda desayunos y cenas. Por las tardes ella ayuda en el comedor popular de su comunidad, adicionalmente, los domingos ella sale a vender mazamorra morada.
El último crédito que ella recibió, lo empleo en la reparación de su congelador que utiliza en su negocio de comida.
Ella cuenta que hace poco le  robaron la olla donde preparaba su mazamorra morada, y como es una olla grande y costosa, necesita un crédito para comprar otra. Asimismo ella necesita también algo de dinero para invertir en su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Modesta is 44 years old. She has a business from her house; a guesthouse where she provides breakfast and dinner. In the afternoons she helps in a popular eatery in her community. Additionally, on Sundays she goes out to sell mazamorra morada (a sweet pudding made from constarch, sugar, and honey).

She used the last loan that she received to repair her freezer, which she uses in her food business. She reports that someone recently stole the pot that she uses to make her mazamorra morada and, since it is a large and expensive pot, she needs a loan to buy another. Additionally, she needs some money to invest in her food business.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large pot for her mazamorra morada (local corn pudding) business and to invest in her food business

loans.name: Rani M. Anwar Group

texts.en:
Rani Baji is the wife of M. Anwar and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 12 years. She has one son whose name is Salman Mohsin. He is two years old. Rani Baji’s husband has a clothes selling business and he has been selling clothes for the past 5 years. He buys clothes from Faisal Abad and sells in his own city, Arifwala. Rani Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rukhsana Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Zubaida Baji and Zulaikhan Baji and Zainab Baji each want a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes tiene 29 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposa y su hija en casa de su suegra. Creció con la actividad de la agricultura, sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad, y hasta hoy, él sigue sembrando, en sus campos se cultivan por temporadas,  dedicándose a ellos hasta el tiempo de cosecha; pero en tiempos que no cultiva se dedica a vender carnes R. de todo tipo, y aprovecha en juntar los pellejos con lana que  negocia por libra, le pagan desde S/ 1.20  a S/.1.50, le va muy bien y le es muy rentable, también su venta de papa, pero para ello tiene que esperar periodos de 6 meses, en cambio la venta de la carne y la lana es un negocio constante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes para abonar su chacra, además de comprar 4 o 5 carneros, para luego vender su carne.
texts.en:
Diomedes is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter in his mother-in-law’s house. He grew up with agriculture, and his parents did the same work, and he still works planting seeds. He grows seasonal crops on his land, working with the crops until it is time to harvest them. When he is not growing crops, he sells all types of red meat. He also gathers sheepskins with wool which he can sell by the pound. They pay between 1.20 soles ($0.38) to 1.50 soles ($0.48) per pound and the business is profitable and going well. In addition, he sells potatoes, but he needs to wait periods of 6 months for the potatoes to grow, whereas the sale of meat and wool is a year-round business. This is his first loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA). He will buy fertilizers for his land with this loan, and also 4 or 5 sheep so he can later sell their meat.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for his farm and some sheep

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman A. Z. is a 23-year-old young woman who sells office and school supplies. She is good at what she does, which is why she has been able to support her family, especially her sick father who needs special care and medicine.

Eman wishes to expand her business and purchase more office supplies to sell. She is requesting a loan of $1200 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more office supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica P. is a 46 year old trader.  She is married and the mother with four children. They all attend school in the village. She trades in onions, tomatoes and pepper etc. in a village at Nkawkaw where she lives. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods in bulk and sells them in the surrounding towns during their market days. Her business helps two of her kids finish junior high school. She requests a loan to enable her to buy increased stock of tomatoes, onions, pepper to scale up the business. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education to give them a future and hope. 

Veronica belongs to a village bank called ‘Divine’. She hopes to receive a $400 loan to grow her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables like onions, tomatoes and pepper etc.

loans.name: Norkul

texts.ru:
Норкул 49 летний мужчина , отец семерых детей, жена домохозяйка.Норкул  работает бригадой, строителем.В состав его бригады входят его три сына, которым более 20 лет.Они очень сплочённая семейная бригада.Также всей семьёй они занимаются откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота.Сейчас у него 5 коров,из которых две дают молоко.Для увеличения коров и ремонта коровника он хочет получить займ.
На фотографии Норкул в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Norkul is 49-years old. He is a father of 7 children. His wife is a homemaker. Norkul is a construction worker. He works with a team that includes three of his 20+-year old sons. It is a close-knit family, which, in addition to construction work, raises livestock. Norkul has 5 dairy cows and is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase more cows and renovate the cowshed. The picture features Norkul on the day of disbursement.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: G. and his wife want  to grow pigs together. They have a room for the animals in the court house in the town of Orhei where they have their place of business, They will store the necessary fodder there. Now they decided to ask for a loan to buy food for the pigs. G. and his wife work together in caring for the animals. He does not have any experience in this field, and he is in the process of launching his business. This is his first loan with MicroInvest. The pigs will multiply, and then be sold in the neighborhood market. In the future, this client plans to increase the number of pigs to sell and also to raise a new breed of pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig fodder

loans.name: Isela

texts.es: Isela tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su madre. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas desde hace un año, empezó a realizar esta actividad en su casa, la cual está ubicada frente a un parque y atiende todos los días por las mañanas, también se va a vender de forma ambulante en eventos deportivos con una de sus canastas, a veces la ayuda su hijo mayor, pero generalmente va sola. Para Isela este negocio es una distracción que le permite Interactuar con sus clientes, que generalmente son los niños; y las ganancias le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias de su grupo que apostó por mantener su banco comunal en momentos de conflicto, y ahora se compromete a seguir promoviendo la unidad. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de mercadería en golosinas, confites y gaseosas y aprovechar la etapa escolar donde tiene más clientes.
texts.en:
Isela is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in her mother's house. She has been selling candy and soft drinks for a year, beginning by working out of her house, which is located in front of a park. She works every day during the morning, and also goes out to sell on foot at sporting events with her products in a basket. Sometimes her oldest son helps her, but usually she does this alone. For Isela this business is a something that allows her to interact with her customers, who are generally children, and the earnings allow her to pay her household costs.

This is the second time she will have a loan with MPF, and she is one of the members of her group that bet on maintaining their communal bank in times of conflict, and now she promises to continue promoting unity. The money she is asking for will be invested in the pruchase of candy, pastries, and soft drinks, so she can take advantage of the school year, when she has the most customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy, sweets, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Mrs. Beverly P. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married with one child who works in a call center. Her husband is a retired sales manager. Starting their married life was not as easy as they thought they could overcome.

Beverly worked at snack vending and later they were able to establish a sari-sari store and successfully provide education for her child. Her passion for business still continues. Later, she encountered Paglaum MPC with whom she can access additional capital, savings and insurance.

The desire of their heart is to open another branch in a nearby locality in order to provide employment for those in need.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is a rice farmer. She is 42 years old and has two children. She dreams of having a bigger farm someday. She would like to grow her business to help keep her family together and meet all their needs. Her husband, Edgardo B., is planning to work in Manila, the capital city of the Philippines. She thinks that if her business flourishes, her husband would no longer need to leave to earn a living.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help her improve the fertility of her farm. This in turn will lead to a better harvest.

CEVI is helping Julieta and the rest of the farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides access to those who want to start a business. It provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan Q. is a farmer who knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Elshan is takes care of his four children, who are the meaning of his life. 

Elshan is requesting a loan in order to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.

loans.use: Purchase two calves, along with fodder

loans.name: Ouyètiè 9 Group

texts.fr:
Ouyètiè 9 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Nitabogoro de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 5 enfants. 
Elles excellent principalement  dans la culture de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 9 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 9 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ouyètiè 9 is a group of married women of the village of Nitabogoro in Koutiala City, Region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They average 33 years of age and have at least five children. The women excel in growing peanuts and millet. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. After having correctly repaid the first loan, they are now on their second farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting peanuts and millet; some minor supplies and equipment; and some fertilizers and the like, for farming. These items are procured at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Following the off-season, the harvests are stored for a time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold at the same marketplace and at surrounding marketplaces at the retail level (often wholesale), in cash transactions, to customers generally from large cities. The group members each intend to realize, after selling their produce, an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Morng

texts.en:
Morng S., 29, pictured with her husband, is married and resides with him in Prey Veng province. She works in a grocery store and also sells sugarcane juice, typically making $1 each day. Her husband, Som Pheakdey, operates a moto-taxi business and typically makes about $2 each day.

Morng S. would like a loan of $400 to purchase ice cake and sugarcane to sell.

loans.use: To purchase ice cake and sugar cane to sell

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia, trabaja como empleada domestica y sus esposo tiene un taller de electricidad de autos y soldadura.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa como cuidadora.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de material de trabajo (soldaduras, repuestos) en el taller que trabaja con su esposo.
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la cuarta vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elodia works as a maid and her husband runs an auto electric repair and welding workshop. She lives in the Irpavi II zone in La Paz where she takes care of a home. The loan will be used to purchase working capital (welding materials, spare parts) in the workshop where she assists her husband. This is the 6th loan she has received from Impro and the 4th time she has requested assistance through Kiva. Her history qualifies her as a punctual, responsible woman in paying her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of welding materials and spare parts for her husband's electric repair workshop

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
MARY CRIS V. of Sitio Sutay, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental is married with 6 children ranging from 6 to 18 years old.

Having a large family necessitates for Mary Cris and her husband to explore a variety of income generating ventures. Armed with only her entrepreneurial spirit, Mary Cris joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 to borrow capital for a new business venture to augment the income she generated from her "sari-sari" store - the local version of a General or neighborhood convenience store.

She used her 1st to 3rd loans to capitalize a barter trade with local farmers: they bought food stuff and goods from her general store on credit and paid her with grain at harvest time. She also bought several piglets to raise and sell. This side business earns her an additional PHP 1,500.00 per month.

Now on her 9th loan cycle, Mary Cris wants to borrow PHP 7,000.00 to buy cattle to raise and sell to supplement her family income. 

Mary Cris continues to explore other business opportunities in the hope that all these help support her growing family's financial needs. With 3 teen-age kids and 3 youngsters, Mary Cris also prayes that her business activities will inspire the entrepreneurial spirit in her children so that they will grow up knowing that they have the power to become independent and be financially stable if they're willing to work hard.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Purchase livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Daniel Franklin

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel es cliente nuevo y viene recomendado por una de nuestras clientes.  La actividad economica que el desempeña es la atencion de su consultorio Odontologico ubicado en la zona del Rosario.  El vive en casa familiar donde cuenta con un departamento independiente con su esposa y su pequeño hijo.  El señor B. invertira el prestamo en la compra instrumental medico y medicamentos que seran utilizados en el desempeño diario de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Daniel is new client that was recommend by one of our clients. He works as dentist in his office located in the Rosario zone. He lives in his family’s house where he has an individual apartment in which he lives with his wife and small child. Mr. B. will invest the loan in the purchase of medical instruments and medicine that will be used to carry out his daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The client will invest in the purchase of medical instruments and supplies for his office.

loans.name: Zana

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce le commerce de l’alimentation générale à Lomé depuis 1984. Elle a très vite compris qu’elle doit exercer une activité génératrice de revenus pour aider financièrement son mari soudeur à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 04 enfants. Sa boutique d’alimentation générale assure l’approvisionnement du quartier Agoè BKS. Actuellement elle pense aussi vendre des articles scolaires pour préparer cette rentrée et assurer la fourniture scolaire aux élèves de ce quartier populaire. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 bidons d’huile, 01 carton de tomate en boîtes, 01 sac de riz, 03 cartons de spaghetti, 02 cartons de savon de toilette, 20 cahiers de 100 pages, 15 cahiers de 200 pages ainsi que d’autres articles solaires.
texts.en:
This woman has been operating a general store in Lomé since 1984. She quickly understood that she must operate an income-generating business to help her husband, a welder, to provide for their four children financially. Her general store makes sure that the Agoè BKS district is kept supplied. Currently, she is also thinking of selling school items to get ready for the coming return-to-school season and to ensure that the students in this district have school supplies. And so, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy four containers of oil, a box of canned tomatoes, a sack of rice, three boxes of spaghetti, two boxes of bath soap, twenty 100-page notebooks, and fifteen 200-page notebooks, as well as other school items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of 6 children. In 2007, she decided to sell clothes to the neighboring villages to provide, along with her husband, better living conditions for the family. Today, Ghada is applying for a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase additional clothes to satisfy the demand of her clientele, after becoming known by her clientele.

loans.use: purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Jonathan Muthusi

texts.en: Jonathan is married to Agnes and they have three children: Mary (18 years old), Gabriel (14 years old) and George (8 years old). Jonathan was introduced to KADET by existing group members and has no previous credit history. With his loan he will buy cereals (maize, beans and millet) which are in high demand and which will assist in attracting new clients. His area of business is within an estate where high-income earners reside. With the extra profit, Jonathan intends to expand his business. He hopes to make his shop a wholesale operation. He describes himself as focused, determined and hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a stock of cereals

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Selling vegetables and raising goats is the business of Nora C.. She is 39 years old and a business-minded person. She is happily engaged to Prudencio, who is a farmer in their village. The couple are blessed with four children : Matcris, 20 years old, a college student; Julie, 16 years old; Robert, 14 years old, high school student; and the youngest is Fernan, 7 years old, elementary pupil.

Nora would like to improve their way of living and needs to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Due to the large size of her household, her income doesn’t go far enough to meet all their needs. That’s why she is asking for additional capital from Kiva lenders, so that she can buy vegetables and generate more capital for her children's needs. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 pesos.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
S. is a low-income person who live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, S. makes clay pots. She also provides decorating services for wedding parties. She is a good mother who is blessed with three children. Her husband is a military policeman. 

S. needs some money to buy larger quantities of decorating material. To continue to provide good service, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her decorating business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional accessories and cloth.

loans.name: Clarita's Group

texts.en:
Clarita C., 55, is from the village of Reina Mercedes. Clarita is the leader of an ASKI loan group consisting of five members. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Salucong.

Clarita is married and has three school-aged children. She has run a general store for over five years earning approximately 3,000 PHP a month as her sole income.

In 2007, Clarita joined ASKI to access their financial services and to improve both her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth ASKI loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rildo

texts.en:
Rildo learned the craft of masonry in 2002 as an employee of a friend. A fast learner, he quickly began to notice all the possibilities for this type of service in Massachusetts and in 2005 started working for himself. His most difficult challenge was the language.

"I was not fluent in English, and I still am not yet, but it was much worse in the beginning. I had to pay someone to translate everything for me. I overcame this language barrier because my clients saw the perfection of my work and they were very happy with it."

"This is my 4th loan with AUSA. I used my 2 first loans to start building my credit in the US and the 2 most recent loans I used to purchase new equipment for my business. I used credit cards to purchase supplies, but I try to pay the full balance every month to avoid paying the high interest they charge. I read about ACCION USA in a local Brazilian paper. For now I am just focused on expanding my business, but I wish to save and buy a house for my retirement."

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions like ACCION USA support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and proviD. employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Equipment for masonry

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math S. is 57 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital city. She is a good housewife: she cooks very good meals for her family and cares for her children. She is mother of a child who is already married and lives separately and works slaughtering animals to sell.

Currently Math S. depends on the income from her husband’s commerce. He owns a car which he uses to supply a taxi service for a profit.
