Math S. is applying for a loan to use as capital to invest in a new business. She will use her loan to order beef to sell at the market. This will provide her with additional income and she will use it to ensure that her family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To order beef to sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is married and has a daughter. This is an average family from Istaravshan, Tajikistan. However, Mahbuba is a unique entrepreneur. She has been selling fabric for national dresses in the central city market for about 11 years, running her own small venture successfully. The secret of her success is simple: not only does she tell her customers the benefits of her products, but she also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, she doesn’t want to stop where she is with her venture. Mahbuba is seeking a loan of $1000 USD to re-stock the merchandise in her store. We believe that Mahbuba’s desire to excel in pleasing her customers will ensure her further success and encourage new customers to buy from her. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabric to sell for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery goods in bulk.

loans.name: Corina Guadalupe

texts.es: Corina Guadalupe M. D. D. D. 44 años D. edad, Municipio D. Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como albañil, y junto a cinco hijos, tres D. los mayores ya finalizaron sus estudios D. bachillerato, y los dos últimos estudian educación básica. Corina posee un negocio, en el cual comercializa jugos, sodas, fruta, pupusas, golosinas y otros productos alimenticios más. Su negocio esta ubicado en las instalaciones del Colegio Salomón siempre en el mismo municipio en el que vive ella. Dentro del colegio posee competencia, por lo que Corina se esfuerza a diario por innovar en sus productos D. manera que pueda llamar la atención D. los alumnos del colegio en lo más posible. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual desea poder aumentar su inventario, comprando muchos más productos alimenticios, así mismo contar con materia prima para la elaboración D. desayunos y almuerzos. Para Corina el mejoramiento D. su negocio es D. mucha importancia, debido a que el sueldo que su esposo obtiene es bastante bajo para solventar los gastos del hogar y las necesidades D. cinco hijos, es por ello que Corina desea crecer en su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas las cuales serán D. mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Corina Guadalupe M. D. D., 44, lives in Zacatecoluca, La Paz department with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and their five children. The oldest three have finished high school and the two youngest are still in elementary school. Corina has a store where she sells fruit juices, sodas, pupusas (Salvadorean filled corn cakes), sweets and other food items. Her store is located near the Colegio Salomón in her same residence town. She has some competition insiD. the school so Corina must make an effort daily to diversify her stock in order to catch the eye of the school's students as much as possible. She is asking for funding in order to increase her stock inventory buying many more food items; in addition, she wants to have available ingredients to prepare breakfasts and lunches. For Corina, improving her business is very important because her husband's salary is quite low and inadequate to meet household expenses and the needs of their five children. For this reason, Corina wants her business to grow so that sales will increase. This will be of great benefit for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong D. is 36. He owns a motorbike that he uses to provide a taxi service which earns approximately $5 per day to meet his family’s daily living expenses. In addition, he owns a pond where he breeds fish to sell. He also provides fish to his wife to sell in the market. The couple has two school-aged children. Kong D. will use the Kiva loan to build a hedge around his fish pond.

loans.use: To build a hedge around his fish-breeding pond

loans.name: Plunkor Group

texts.en:
Asatu S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Plunkor Group.  She is 35 years old, married, and has five children who range from nursery school to 10th grade.  Asatu was never able to attend school herself. For over 15 years, Asatu has been selling milk in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She says that she provides her customers with good quality milk, which keeps them coming to her for business. Asatu plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more milk. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Asatu is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more milk.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 26 years old, married to Mr Rotich, and they have two children aged seven and four. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is an existing KADET client.

This is Irine's first loan which she will use to plough an extra part of her farm and plant more than in the previous season.

Her future plans are to invest in modern farming: by acquiring a greenhouse, she hopes to increase her productivity leading to more income which will enable her to educate her children and to be an independent woman.

loans.use: To plough the farm and buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Joseph Ndung'u

texts.en: Joseph, age 22, is single and lives in the Ruaka area, a Nairobi suburb. It is an area of mixed businesses with a high population. Joseph is a mobile beautician. He has done this for the last two years. With this loan, he plans to buy more stock of beauty cosmetics. His customers are mainly ladies around Ruaka and its surroundings. He has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, he hopes to open a beauty salon and a beauty college.

loans.use: To add stock of beauty cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Emelda

texts.es:
la señora Maria Emelda C. A. tiene 46 años de edad,  es viuda y dependen de ella dos hijos que estan en la escuela, tiene una hija mayor, su espòso fallecio hace dos años dejandole dos casas y el negocio de pulperia que a administrado bien durante este tiempo.

ademas vende golosinas los fines de semana, tiene la ayuda de su hija para la venta de las golosinas.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de abarroteria para tener surtida la pulperia.
esta muy contenta porque su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas, espera que para un tiempo no lejano tenga una pulperia grande y bien surtida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Emelda C. A. is 46 years ols, a widow, and two children who are students depend on her. She has an older daughter. Her husband passed away two years ago leaving her with two houses and a general store which she has administered well during this period of time.

She also sells candy on the week-ends. Her daughter helps her with the sale.

The loan will be spent on buying groceries for the general store. She is very pleased because her business is growing day by day. She expects to have a big and well-assorted grocery store in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, water, condiments, rice, sugar, coffee, cookies, bread, eggs,candles, matches, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, butter, cooking oil, salt

loans.name: Reaching Our Goals Group

texts.es:
La sra. Lelia esmith, tiene 35 años D. edad, convive con su pareja que la ayuda económicamente. Tiene cuatro hijos. Ella forma parte del grupo "alcanzando nuestras metas", integrado por 8 personas trabajadoras residentes del distrito D. carabayllo. Sus compañeros la eligieron presidenta D. la junta directiva del grupo.

La sra. Lelia esmith, trabaja en su negocio D. venta D. condimentos, el cual está ubicado en su domicilio y al que le dedica todas las mañanas. Con éste trabajo ella pueD. apoyar a su pareja en los gastos familiares y el pago D. colegio D. sus hijos.

Su proxima meta es llegar un negocio mas granD., el cual podría ser una bodega.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. sus condimentos.
texts.en:
Lelia Esmith is 35 years old and lives with her partner, who helps her financially. She has four children. She is a member of the "Reaching our Goals" Group, maD. up of 8 working people living in the Carabayllo District. Her fellow group members elected her as president of their management committee. Lelia Esmith's business sells condiments and is based in her home. She works every morning and this work enables her to support her partner with the household costs and her children's school fees. Her next goal is to run a larger business, perhaps a small grocery store. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her condiments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare condiments

loans.name: Faith And Work Group

texts.en: Alfred M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Faith And Work." He is 38, married and has one child a year and 4 months old. He also cares for one sibling. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 5 years, he has been involved with transportation and the sale of crushed rock in the Thinkers Village community, outside Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy petroleum and other materials like diggers, shovels and old tires used in the production of crushed rock. He describes himself as an easy-going man whose dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more petroleum and other materials like diggers, shovels and used tires used in the production of crushed rock.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Madame Minata Dembélé a 48 ans,  mariée  mère de  5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Dû à des problèmes de famille, Aminata n’as pas pu continuer  ses études raisons pour laquelle elle s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus. Elle évolue dans le domaine du tricotage et de tissage de la  laine et sa vente depuis 15 ans. Elle   a appris cette activité  auprès des Sœurs Italiennes. Actuellement elle exerce à son domicile. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes dans le  mois. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de ses clients, Madame Minata n’a pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2005. Elle a obtenu 8 prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) et 4 prêts individuels tous remboursés correctement. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et compte acheter 3 cartons de laines auprès des commerçants. Elle vend ses layettes  dans la ville de Koutiala  et souvent dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Koutiala à une clientèle  constituée essentiellement de femmes, à crédit ou au comptant. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage  utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms Minata Dembélé is 48 year old, married, and a mother of 5 children. She lives in a polygamous family in the neighborhood of Hamdallaye in the district of Koutiala (third largest adminsitration in the republic of Mali). Due to family problems, Minata was not able to continue her studies, and became interested in income generating activities. For the past 15 years she has been involved in knitting and weaving wool products, as well as selling them from her home. She learned this line of work through Italian nuns. She is well known for this activity, and receives several requests and order during each month. In order to better satisfy her customers, Ms Minata joined the Soro Yiriwaso institute in 2005. She obtained eight group loans and four individual loans, all of which she has reimbursed on time. She stocks up in Koutiala and plans to purchase three boxes of wool. She sells baby clothes in the city of Koutiala and often in the monthly fairs of surrrounding villages to a customer base mostly comprised of women. They pay either by credit or cash. She plans to make a profit of 80,000 FCFA (152 USD) per month which she plans to use to reimburse the interests on the loan as well as contribute to the family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing boxes of wool

loans.name: Los Sánchez Group

texts.es:
El grupo los S. está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes han sido beneficiadas tanto en la oferta de créditos como en el desarrollo empresarial y de autoestima por medio de los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. Esto según expresaron les ha permitido administras su negocio por medio de un registro de las ventas, costos y ganancias e inversión. 
 
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Luisa M. B. quien hace cuatro años empezó vendiendo frescos, helados y sopas en la actualidad gracias a los prestamos y sus deseos de superación tiene una pequeña venta. Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 8 años, 5 años y un bebe de 4 meses por los cuales trabaja arduamente con el fin de progresar.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosibel S. de 24 años la cual se dedica a vender frijoles y nacatamales comida típica abase de maíz y cerdo, y Juana S. desde hace 15 años comercializa nacatamales, elotes, buñuelos, platanitos y tortillas.
texts.en:
The “Los S. Group” is made up of three hard working, entrepreneurial women who have greatly benefited from development and enablement programs such as “Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género;” “Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género;” “Intercambio Empresarial y Articulación de Actores.” This, as they tell us, has taught them to run their businesses by keeping records of their sales, costs, earnings, and investments. María Luisa M. B., the group’s coordinator, began selling fresh frozen treats and soup four years ago, and now has a small store thanks to these loans. She has four children, ages eight, five, and a four month old baby; for whom she works diligently to get ahead. The other members include Rosibel S., age 24, who sells beans and nacatamales (a typical food made with corn flour and pork); and Juana S., who has been selling nacatamales, corn, buñuelos, plantains, and tortillas for the past 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana A. is from the village of Biasong. She is 37 years old. Ana is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ana owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ana has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Ana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zenie's Group

texts.en: Zenie C. is from the village of Del Pilar, Balianago. She is 41 years old. Zenie is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. Zenie is married and has three children; one is an adult and two are school-aged. To make a living, Zenie owns and operates a motorcycle-transport business. Zenie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2004, Zenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Zenie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase motorcycle spare parts. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Zenie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Abaduzakivi Group

texts.fr:
Denise N. est une commerçante âgée de 27 ans qui habite au Quartier 3 Ngangara en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme les pommes de terre et les œufs. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 7 ans. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 2e année de l’enseignement technique en Gestion. Son mari, Alberic Barangeza est aussi un commerçant de produits de boutique. Elle fait juste le 1er  cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2enfants, un garçon et une fillette  qui sont âgés de  6ans et 5ans.Ils sont tous à l’école. 
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de produits alimentaires (pommes de terre et œufs de poule) à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. Elle a été inspirée par ses parents pour commencer le business car c’est le métier qu’ils exercent depuis très longtemps. Elle reçu le premier capital de son mari pour démarrer son business avant d’avoir le crédit de Turame. 

 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  solidaire « Abaduzakivi»
texts.en:
Denise N. is a 27-year-old merchant who lives in Quartier 3 Ngangara, in Bujumbura, the capital of Burundi.  She does commerce in foodstuffs, such as potatoes and eggs.  This has been her trade for seven years. Denise has attended the 2nd year of technical education in management.  She is on her first community loan cycle with Turame.  Her husband, Alberic Barangeza, is also a merchant of shop goods.   Denise is the mother of two children, a boy and a girl, who are 6 and 5 years old.  They are both in school.  Denise is asking for a Kiva loan to increase the quantity of goods (potatoes and chicken eggs) to sell in hopes of having a big profit.  She hopes to have a lot of capital in the future to allow her to do a lot of business.  She was inspired by her parents to start this business because it was their trade for a long time.  She received initial capital from her husband for starting her business before her loan from Turame. She is a member of the solidarity group "Abaduzakivi". 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the quantity of goods (potatoes and chicken eggs) to sell in hopes of having a big profit

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon V. is from the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 44 years old. Corazon is married and has four school-aged children. Corazon owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks for sale. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 7000 PHP and was used purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

Corazon is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sanobarhon's Group

texts.en:
Sanobarhon A. is the leader of the group. She is 39 years old and a widow. She has a son and two daughters, all of whom are in school.  Two years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Sanobarhon started to sell convenience goods on the market. In this way she makes approximately $110 per month.  She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more goods to increase the turnover of her business and a refrigerator to store products. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

Saerahon S. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 34 years old and married. Her husband works in Russia, so she takes care of two sons and a daughter by herself.  All the children are in school.  Saerahon is a farmer. She makes money by cultivating cotton and reselling livestock after fattening.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education and finish repairing her house.

Shohidahon T., 28, is married. She has a daughter and a son. Shohidahon is a school teacher and her husband works in Russia. She also makes money by reselling cattle after fattening.  In this way she makes about $65 per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a bull for breeding. 

Gulerahon T., 26, is married.  She has a daughter and a son.  Gulerahon breeds livestock for making money and her husband works in a factory.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase sheep for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 48 años, es casado y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años junto con su esposa decidieron abrir un restaurante turístico en las instalaciones de su propia casa, puesto que cuenta con amplios espacios, alrededor de áreas verdes, que le permitieron incursionar en este negocio. Su esposa es la que prepara los platos típicos, además es la encargada de buscar los contratos con los clientes, que por lo general hacen pedidos para que puedan elaborar banquetes, bufets y almuerzos para algunos eventos que se presentan; asimismo procura tener todos los productos e ingredientes que necesita para preparar dichos platillos. Su capacidad de administrar bien su negocio, le dado mucha ventaja para que su negocio alcance el sostenimiento, por tal motivo ha decidido intensificarse en este negocio y conseguir contratos más rentables. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, pero su esposa ha sido  una de las socias antiguas de su banco comunal que por motivos de salud temporal su esposo asume la titularidad del crédito, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias, asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sillas para que ya deje de alquilarlas, asimismo desea comprar una cocina industrial a gas.
texts.en:
Juan is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his two children in their own house. Ten years ago, he and his wife decided to open a tourist restaurant in their own home, since they had ample space and lived near the green spaces, and these circumstances permitted them to enter this business. His wife is the one who prepares the typical dishes, and furthermore, she is in charge of seeking contracts with customers, who generally place orders for them to prepare banquets, buffets, and lunches for the various events that occur. She also procures all the products and ingredients that she needs to prepare these typical dishes. Her ability to administer their business well has given it a great advantage so that it is reaching sustainability. For that reason, he has decided to increase his efforts in this business and obtain more profitable contracts.

This is his first loan with MFP, but his wife has been one of the oldest members of her community bank. Because of temporary health reasons, her husband has assumed responsibility for the loan. He is very happy to know that he has financial support, since they know that he is responsible in his payments. Furthermore, he is grateful to be part of his community bank because all its members are very united people. At the same time, he is thankful to the people who will be granters of the loan that he is applying for, since it will be very useful to him in the progress of his business. With the loan that he is seeking, he will buy chairs so that he can stop renting them, and he also wants to buy an industrial gas stove.

loans.use: Buy chairs and an industrial gas stove

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
At 50 years of age, Fe C. never feels tired of doing things to make money to support everyday living. Sometimes Fe's five children who are independent and have their own jobs (Mary Ann, Mary Jane, Alife, Alexander and April) have given her money from their salaries. However, Fe does not stop there because she knows her children need their incomes for their own families in the future. Fe wants to be the one who who helps her children's families, especially her youngest daughter, Alinie, who is a college student and still dependent on her. That’s why Fe decided to join Kiva field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), to borrow capital that she needs to run her rice retail venture.
Now, her business is still running, but Fe need additional funds to expand the business. She wants to increase her stock of rice that she sells from her house. This will make her business grow.
Fe has a simple dream of ensuring that her family do not experience hard things. To be able to do this will make her happy, and that’s why she will never get tired of helping them, even in little ways. If this dreams happens, Fe also hopes to extend a helping hand to others, especially her relatives who also need support. Fe is very glad for the inspiration and encouragement that give her strength to continue dreaming of the best in life.

loans.use: To finance her rice retail business

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Foday. He is married and has three children, ages 2, 5 and 10. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is helping educate her. 

In 1992, Foday established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to provide for his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about $175 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Foday has already received and successfully repaid four loans from ARD, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately $300. 

In the future, Foday plans to sell wholesale and supply to other traders, build two additional stalls and hire a sales person. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used jeans

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is requesting for 80,000 Kes to buy 10 bags of sugar, 10 bags of rice and other products for resale. He runs a general store in Kiambu where he sells sugar, rice, bread, flour, cereals among other products. He is a member of Thuita Victory SHG and the group has guaranteed this loan. He has been in this business for four years and hopes to grow it into a wholesale. 

Through Faulu Kenya trainings, Paul has learned business focus and he describes himself as God fearing and proactive. He is 37 years old, married and a father of two.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of sugar, 10 bags of rice and other products for resale

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May S. is from the village of Usocan. She is 36 years old. May is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, May owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. May has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, May joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. May is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by May from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Poak

texts.en: Poak L., 30, is a tailor, earning an income of 3 USD per day. L. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 5 USD per day. The family spends 35 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and 30 USD on other necessary expenses every month. L. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.en:
Akramjon uses his small van as a taxi, transporting passengers around his city. Akramjon started driving a taxi two years ago. He makes around $35 per day which is enough to support himself his wife and their four children. Akramjon is a positive influence on those around him and demonstrates responsibility and a good work ethic. He has requested a loan for $2000 USD to help pay for some maintenance on his taxi. We are grateful for this opportunity to assist him with his business and help keep him out on the road earning a living. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for maintenance his minivan

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina M. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Fatina has a tailoring business, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Fatina has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase material to make clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Fatina hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a small retail shop that sells sugar and soap.
Fatina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her new games.

loans.use: To purchase material to make clothes for resale

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut W., a 42-year-old woman living in Pangkung Liplip Kaliakah Village, is the head of the group called "Tunjung Wiguna", They have obtained a loan of Rp. 15,000,000 and the group has a total of 10 people, so that each person will obtain a loan of Rp. 1.5 million. Ni Ketut W. raises pigs from birth up to the age of three months; they are then ready for sale so that within a 6-month period she may sell two times. 

Ni Ketut W. can maintain 3 to 4 head of pigs. From the sale of livestock she can obtain an average of Rp.600.000 per six months. With these earnings she can help cover the family living expenses. The members of the group hope that in future this cooperation can continue to run smoothly.

loans.use: Buy more pigs

loans.name: Missewou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Missewou  a  36 ans et marié.  IL a 2 enfants  à   charge. Il exerce  comme métier   la fabrication et la vente des  chaussures et  sacs.  Il  s’approvisionne  au  Niger,  au Mali et à Lomé la capitale du  Togo.  Il  a commencé  en  1995 son activité  et  revend  les  marchandises  sur 103 Rue, Wahala.  Il demande  un prêt  pour   acheter  50  cuirs  et  5  boîtes de  colle.
texts.en: Mr. Missewou is 36 years old. He is married and has two dependent children. His profession is making shoes and bags for sale. He stocks up in Niger, in Mali and in Lomé, Togo’s capital. He launched this business in 1995 and sells his wares at 103 Wahala St. He is requesting a loan to purchase 50 leather hides and five boxes of glue.

loans.use: Purchasing leather  hides and glue

loans.name: Helena Jemutai

texts.en:
Helena Jemutai C. is a married woman of 51 years. Her husband, Luka C., is a farmer and adds to the family income. Together they have six children. They live in Iten in the outskirts of Eldoret. 

She sells groceries and cereals in the Iten market and has been in this business for 20 years now. She gets a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This will be Helena's sixth loan from KADET Ltd. She has been repaying all her other loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to buy more groceries and cereals for resale. 

In the future, Helena wants to buy a plot in Iten town and construct rental houses so that she can get additional income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and cereals for resale

loans.name: Jemutai

texts.en:
W., 22 years old, is married to Wilson Ruto, a 30-year-old farmer, and they are blessed with two children aged four and two years old. W. has run a retail shop in the Kimaam trading centre for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 5,500.

W.'s loan from KADET LTD., her first, will be used to purchase dry maize, salt, tea leaves, soap and sugar for her shop. She intends to use the additional profits to educate her children and also improve the stock in the shop. W. hopes to eventially own a large and well-stocked shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Darío de 40 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Margarita junto a su esposo en su chacra han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingreso, es la venta de productos de cacao, café y hojas de coca, las cuales vende a las empresas acopiadoras situados en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus plantas. Con el tiempo desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable. Con el crédito solicitado, será para la adquisición de semillas de barbasco, ya que cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno para poder cultivarlas.
texts.en: Margarita is 37 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own house together with her husband Darío, age 40, and their 4 beloved children, for whom they would like to provide a better quality of life. The hard work carried out by Margarita together with her husband on their fields has resulted in crops that are very well cared-for, and on sales days, her products are purchased rapidly. Her main source of income is the sale of cacao, coffee and coca leaves, which she sells to the wholesale companies located in the city of San Francisco. What she likes best about her work is harvesting her fields. She has done this work for 17 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is protecting her crops from the insect pests that can affect her plants. With time, she would like to acquire new fields to expand her crops. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she has been very punctual with her payments. In her communal bank, she is a very responsible member. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy barbasco seeds, since she has 2 hectares of land where she can cultivate them.

loans.use: to buy barbasco seeds

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old and has three children.  She is married and has one child who is still in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosalina has been farming rice for six years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activity.

In the future, Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fadea

texts.en:
Fadea is a 26-year-old mother from southern Israel. This past January she began operating a small kiosk/market selling nuts, snacks, sweets, cold and hot drinks. In Israel, it is almost a national pastime to eat sunflower seeds, pistachios and other such snacks – so much so that in many places you find kiosks on almost every corner. Fadea saw that no such store existed in her area or near her neighborhood, so she decided to grab the opportunity.

Fadea needed this loan to pay for light remodeling, paint, a rolling stand, toaster oven and refrigerator for the cold drinks. She wants to continue and expand her business. She employs one part-time worker and hopes to expand so her business will be open 7 days a week to meet demands. Her true dream is to open a savings account for her son and future children ensuring they always have a safety net.

loans.use: to pay for light remodeling, paint, a rolling nut-and-sweets stand, toaster oven and refrigerator for cold drinks.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is 50 years old and married. She has 3 children ages 24, 20 and 16. Her husband works as a farmer.

Eustaquia has a food-vending business. She makes rice cakes, banana and camote cue, and other delicacies. She goes around her community to sell what she makes. Eustaquia also buys and resells vegetables.

Eustaquia requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and bananas. She also plans to use part of her loan to buy fertilizers for the farm her husband tills. Eustaquia plans to renovate their house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and bananas

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 35 years old and married to Margaret who contributes to the family income. He has been running his business for a period of about six years with an income of about KES.11,000 a month.

This is his second loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He hopes to be a leading vegetable supplier in Thika town.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, spinach and onions for sale.

loans.name: Shirzad

texts.en:
Shirzad is 54 years old and is married with two children. As well as his children and his wife, the housekeeper, Shirzad is also supporting his parents.

Shirzad sells different types of equipment and he also serves customers by providing copy, printing and scanning facilities.  He has already been in this business for about eight years. Shirzad has many clients who make the business successful and bring stable income to the large family.

Today Shirzad requests 1200 AZN. He is planning to purchase computers to sell through his business. This is Shirzad's second loan and he would like to assure everyone supporting him that he shall repay this loan as well as he repaid the previous two. We believe Shirzad as he has established himself as a trusted borrower of AqroInvest Credit Union.

loans.use: to purchase computers to sell

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
From the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, Nourn, age 53, is a rice cultivator and a married woman who makes a daily income by planting crops on her own farmland. From this, she can earn approximately $2.50 each day.  Her husband is the other source for earning some income by providing building stone and wooden houses for his neighbors and other villagers. Nourn has given birth to two single kids who assist her in the field. From the Kiva loan, she is seeking to purchase a few farming raw materials, such as fertilizers and seed to facilitate rice-growing. 

She hopes she can help her husband's business buy more construction tools, to build a new house and to enlarge her crop-planting business. These are some of Nourn's future plans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seed to facilitate rice-growing.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, surge por el contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el 19º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2006. Cuenta actualmente con 15 miembros, todas ellas trabajan de forma solidaria y en un ambiente de cooperación  
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María Alicia, tiene 6 hijos grandes es casada y tiene una Despensa y Mercería en su domicilio. Está en una esquina muy vistosa y concurrida de la zona. Cuenta la Señora sueña con poder ampliar su negocio, lo cual le servirá para tener mas productos en exhibición, ella por medio de su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y brindar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demás para abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is from Encarnación and was formed after one of the members got in touch with the foundation.  The group is in its 19 loan cycle and has been operating with the foundation since 2006.  It has 15 members, all ladies who work individually, but in an air of cooperation.

María Alicia is one of the members.  She’s married and has six adult children.   María Alicia runs a grocery and general store out of her home.  It’s located in a very well-known and travelled zone.  She wants to expand her business, which will allow her to have more items on display and, through her work, allow her to get ahead and provide a better future to her children.

She is asking for this loan so in order to buy food, drinks, vegetables, and other things to stock her business and be able to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, pork, cheese, tomatoes and paper packaging.

loans.name: Rosevelita

texts.en:
Rosevelita is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosevelita is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosevelita has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell.

Rosevelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosevelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es: El señor Jorge, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre a su hijos en los estudios para que lleguen a la universidad y logren realizar una carrera, don Jorge desde hace varios años laborar en una empresa privada, la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para realizar de una sola vez la compra de materiales de construcción ya que quiere realizar un muro  para tener mayor privacidad y así  no entren a robar ya que en los últimos meses han  intentado robar dentro de la vivienda , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva  ya que sin ellos  no fuese posible realizar la construcción del muro de la casa donde habita .
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his wife and children in the Ticuantepe municipality.  The plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and to always support his children’s education.  He will do this so that they can attend the university and achieve a career.

Jorge has been working for a private company for several years.  The biggest disadvantage he encounters is that his salary does not cover purchasing construction materials all at once.  He wants to build a wall in order to have greater privacy.  With a wall people cannot get in the house and rob them.  In the last months there have been attempts to rob inside of his house.

His is grateful for the support from Afodenic through a Kiva loan.  Without the loans it would not be possible to build a wall around his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall around his home.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana dedicada al servicio fotográfico y servicio de fotocopias en el mercado de la zona de Colcapirhua ya hace varios años atrás ofreciendo el servicio fotográfico para todo acontecimiento social, como matrimonios y bautizos fiestas de zonas , etc.  Ella trabaja bastante para que sus hijos no sufran de necesidades como ella algún día lo sufrió por tal motivo el crédito actual es para comprar una computadora para uso de estudio para sus hijos, ya que ellos necesitan en la universidad, esto facilitara bastante a sus hijos para realizar todos sus trabajos prácticos. El deseo de la señora es poder hacer concluir todos los estudios de sus hijos y verlos profesionales algún día y también que sean personas  de bien, ella es muy amable y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roxana offers photography and photocopying services in the market in the Colcapirhua area.  For several years now she has been offering photography services for all social events, such as weddings, baptisms, local festivals, etc.  

She works a lot so that her children do not lack necessities as she once did.  For this reason, the current loan is to buy a computer for her children to use for their studies, since they need it in the university.  This will make it easy for her children to complete all their assignments. 

Roxana's desire is to be able to have her children finish their studies and to see them as professionals one day, and also that they be respectable.  She is kind and is grateful to the institution for the support it is offering.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 23-year-old married businesswoman.  For the last one year, she has been selling milk to earn a living.  She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  In the next 5 years, she wants to become a major distributor of milk in her region. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy milk.

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Barrrio Nuevo Huixtepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre barrio nuevo huixtepec, esta historia es acerca de la señora Claudia, ya que es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 36 años de edad, esta casada con el señor paulino con quien tiene 6 hijos Alejandro, Paulo, Leobardo, Ana, Fernando y Sergio, de los cuales 5 estudian, dos de ellos estudian segundo y tercer año de secundaria, los otros tres, segundo, cuarto y quinto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa artesanal desde hace mas de 20 años.

Doña Claudia decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, para sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, y continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas material como son: hilos, agujas, mantas, cuadrille, etc.

Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner su tienda de ropa artesanal, así tener una mejor producción e incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que así podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que pueda seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, para así seguir apoyándose a sí mismo y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.

Otras de las compañeras de doña Claudia son: Ofelia, victorina, Enedina y edelfina, quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: venta de carne, frutas, comida, ropa,
texts.en:
This group is called “Barrio Nuevo Huixtepec” and this story is about Claudia since she’s the group representative.  She’s 36 years old, married to Paulino and they have six children: Alejandro, Paulo, Leobardo, Ana, Fernando and Sergio.  Five of them are in school.  Two are in 8th and 9th grade respectively and the other three are in second, fourth and fifth grades in elementary school.  She has been making and selling artisanal clothing for over 20 years.

Claudia decided to start this business because she needed to improve her family’s quality of life, to raise her children, and she did not have enough economic solvency to be able to provide them with a better education and to continue investing in her business.  The loan she got will be invested in purchasing more materials like: thread, needles, fabric, embroidery hoops, etc.

She wants to continue investing in her business to make it grow much more because she wants to build a locale to set up her artisanal clothing store and to have a better production increasing and improving sales and income because that way she’ll be able to continue to support her children’s education so that she can continue improving their quality of life.

She is very grateful to Kiva lenders and to Fundación Realidad because thanks to them she’s getting ahead and has been able to have a business of her own to continue supporting herself while providing a better quality of life for her family.

Claudia’s fellow group members are: Ofelia, Victorina, Enedina and Edelfina who carry out a variety of activities like: meat sales, fruit sales, food sales and clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, frames, etc.

loans.name: Nikiema Yaar Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rasmata est la représentante du groupe N. YAAR. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Trois(03) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des légumes depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à la cité AN II en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de choux, 01sac d’oignons, 01sac d’aubergines et 01 sac de carottes.

Mme avec ses économies contribue à payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres hangars pour ses légumes et aider son mari pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the N. YAAR group.  She is married and has three children.  Her eldest child is 13 years old and her youngest is 10 years old.  All three of her children attend school.  She is responsible for five people.

Rasmata has been selling vegetables for five years.  She stocks up in Cité An II.  Her customers are both men and women.

Rasmata would like to buy one sack of cabbages, one sack of onions, one sack of eggplants (aubergines) and one sack of carrots. 

With her savings, Rasmata contributes towards her children's school fees.  She plans to open additional locations for selling her vegetables and to help her husband in providing for their family.

loans.use: to buy one sack of cabbages, one sack of onions, one sack of eggplants and one sack of carrots

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Maria, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres viven con ella.

Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños,ropa interior y calzado, desde hace 8 años. Ella lo aprendió de una amiga que la invito a salir a vender y así comenzó con poquita mercadería, pero poco a poco lo fue ampliando.

La mercadería la compra en la capital del país, tarda aproximadamente dos horas en llegar allí, se transporta en vehiculo propio. A veces compra en una ciudad más cercana, que esta a una hora de distancia de su comunidad. Maria se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana para ir a comprar la mercadería y para venderla cuando tiene que salir lejos; pero cuando es más cerca se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana. 

Ella recorre distancias de más o menos una hora o una hora y media, esto lo hace en vehiculo propio y busca los días de comercio en cada ciudad o que tengan algun dia feriado o actividad, por que sale todos los dias.

El prestamos era invertido en la compra, de mas cantidad de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños,ropa interior y calzado, ya que comprando los paquetes, le resulta más barato y se ira preparando para la época navideña. Comprara más y a más bajo precio, lo que permitirá la obtención de mejores ganancias y crecerá al mismo tiempo su negocio. Lo que desea Maria es ampliar su cobertura y vender otra clase de productos a parte de la ropa, como es la venta de lácteos.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and a single mother of four children; three of them still live with her.  She’s been selling clothes for women, men and children, underwear and footwear for 8 years.  She learned from a girlfriend who invited her to go out selling and she started out this way with just a little merchandise but gradually expanded it.

She buys the merchandise in the nation’s capital and it takes her about two hours to get there; she transports herself in her own vehicle.  Sometimes she buys in a nearer city that’s only an hour away from her community.  When she has to go far to get it, María rises at 4am to do so to then sell it but when she goes to get it closer she gets up at 5am.  She travels distances of more or less an hour or an hour and a half in her own vehicle and she seeks out the market days in each city or if they have a holiday or special activity so she goes out every day.

She will use this loan to buy larger amounts of clothes for women, men and children, underwear and footwear because by buying the bundles it’s less expensive and she can start preparing for the Christmas season.  She will buy more for a lower price which will allow for higher profits and more business growth at the same time.  What María wants is to expand her coverage and sell other types of products, like dairy products, besides clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, underwear and footwear.

loans.name: Neulex

texts.en:
Neulex is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Neulex has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Neulex has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts for resale, and will help Neulex to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Neulex hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Neulex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Neulex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale,

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Batbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and their two kids are in school. He started his raw materials (wool and cashmere) business in 2007. He travels across the countryside to get his products. His business is in pretty much the same place where he started due to financial challenges. He wants to expand his business by buying more products. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have plenty of opportunities to expand my business; however, I have always limited resources." He is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy 40 lambs and goat kids.

loans.use: To buy 40 lambs and goat kids.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса замужем, у нее двое взрослых детей. Раиса живет в городе Мелитополе и занимается розничной торговлей мужской обувью и одеждой на привокзальном рынке № 3. Она занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 12 лет. На данный момент в товаре у нее 25 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль же составляет около 5 000 гривен. 

Раиса предприимчива и общительна, она всегда стремится уделить должное внимание каждому потенциальному покупателю. Раисе необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент сезонной одежды и обуви для продажи. На дополнительную прибыль она будет оказывать финансовую помощь дочери. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Raisa is married and has two adult daughters.  She lives in the city of Melitopol and is involved in retail sales of men's shoes and clothing at the train station market number 3.  Raisa has been in this business for 12 years.  Currently, she has 25 000 hryvnia invested in her merchandise.  Her net profit is about 5 000 hryvnia.  Raisa is entrepreneurial and communicative.  She always tries to pay the necessary attention to every potential customer.  Raisa needs a loan in the sum of 10 000 hryvnia to expand her selection of seasonal clothing and shoes for sale.  She will use the additional profit to provide financial assistance to her daughter.

loans.use: to expand her selection of seasonal clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Junel

texts.en:
Junel is 23 years old and lives with his parents. Instead of lazing at home, he has engaged himself in a business of rice farming, as source of income. He wasn't able to seek a better employment because he only finished high school. He plants and harvests rice to sell.

As of now he has had insufficient funds, so he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. He would like to improve his crop production so that he can help make his family live fortunately.

Junel wants to achieve financial independence, and he also aspires to have a wife and children someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Pelepetua is a single woman in her late twenties. To earn a living, for the past year she has been running a general store. She works from 7 am to midnight, and she is able to earn nice monthly profits from doing so.

This would be Pelepetuas’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, which she successfully repaid, to increase her inventory of items in her shop and to pay school fees. She is now seeking this second loan to again increase her stock of goods to sell to her customers. Pelepetua’s dream is to one day build her own house.

Pelepetua will share this loan with her loan group, "Machimbo," which has a total of 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to expand her store's inventory of goods

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,gallinas y ovejas,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Cachimayo,la socia tarbaja desde las 8:00 a.m ahsta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y alimentos para los animales.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still working in the business of breeding animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and sheep. The member raises and fattens them for later sale at the different markets that exist in the district of Cachimayo. She works from 8:00am until 4:00pm and through this work she brings up her son. Her dream is to expand the business of raising animals. The member is asking for a loan in order to buy animals and animal feed.

The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for the animals

loans.name: Melinmon Reine Patricia's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Reine Patricia la responsable, âgée de 35ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins a 5ans. Elle commercialise des chaussures depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Fiandev. Le profit généré par ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'aider son mari à achever la construction de leur maison. Reine Patricia se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of 2 people who are joint guarantors. Reine Patricia, the leader of the group, is 35 years old, married and the mother of 2 children who go to school. The eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest, 5.

Reine Patricia has been selling shoes for several years and gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and satisfy the demands of her customers, she has requested and received funding from Finadev. The profits generated thanks to this funding will enable her to help her children get an education and support her husband in finishing off the construction of their house.

Reine Patricia is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. 

Jane is happily married and the proud mother of six children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. 


Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds. 

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Jane to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy second hand furniture shop business

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane has been supplying schools and small organizations with printing services. She has been in this business since 1997. Because of the quality of her work, Viviane has signed partnerships with several schools and organizations within the community. She requests a loan of $500 to enable her to buy printing materials in bulk order which will minimize the cost of production. Viviane is married and has 6 children. Her business’s impact on the community is a positive one. Today, Viviane employs 3 people and supports the basic expenses of her household. Her future plans include expanding the business and offering employment to more people in the community.

loans.use: To buy printing materials in bulk in order to reduce purchase costs

loans.name: Nik Mohammad

texts.en: Nik M. lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He has 20 years experience as a butcher. He has a shop and he wants to open another shop for his son. He wants to take a individual loan to buy all the butchering tools for the new shop and to enlarge his business and make a good income for his family. He wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy butchering tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Description of Business

Gabriela has 6 years of experience as a seamstress. She learned this trade from her mother, and by attending sewing courses. Thanks to her savings she was able to buy a sewing machine. Her parents helped her with other machines. She works every day of the week, with her mother helping her in her business.

Use of Loan

With the loan, she will invest in thread, fabrics, zippers and hooks. In addition to skirts and blouses, she has requests to make gym uniforms as they are in the sports season in the schools.

Personal Information

Gabriela is 26 years old and single. She lives with her parents and her brothers in a simple house. She studies information technology at the university and will graduate soon. In the afternoons, she also works in a shop selling greeting cards. She hopes to improve her sewing workshop, bringing better service to her clients.

Descripción del Negocio

Gabriela tiene una experiencia de 6 años con su actividad. Aprendió el oficio de parte de su mama y asistiendo a cursos de costura. Gracias a sus ahorros logro comprar una maquina de coser. Sus padres la apoyaron con las otras maquinas. Trabaja todos los días de la semana realizando costuras. Su mama le ayuda en esta labor.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de telas, hilos, cierres. Tiene pedidos de elaboración de uniformes de gimnasia ya que estamos en la temporada de olimpiadas en las escuelas. Además de elaboración de faldas, blusas.

Información Personal

Gabriela tiene 26 años. Es soltera. Vive con sus padres y hermanos. Su casita es de construcción mixta. Ella estudia la carrera de informática en la Universidad y esta próxima a graduarse. Por las tardes trabaja en un local de venta de tarjetas de ocasión. Su deseo es poder adecuar su taller de costura. Brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
The women of ComUnidad or communal bank “El Mirador at first appeared very timid. Nevertheless, after a few minutes of questioning they began to show their personalities and entrepreneurial spirit.

Many of the women have dedicated themselves to weaving traditional clothing of the region or working as housekeepers from their homes. However, little by little they soon discovered an untapped market for nutritional foods at different levels in the local economy. It is because of this vision and enterprising drive that Friendship Bridge has decided to support them with a loan, with help from Kiva. The average loan requested by each woman is of Q200 (Guatemalen Quetzales) or $264 USD. This means that these women are willing to invest a considerable amount for the improvement of their business.

The women will use the loan for varioU. activities. Many of them will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and cultivating tools in order to plant and harvest vegetables and sell them in the local market. The loan will also be used to purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk and resell them in the local market. The women will also purchase maize in bulk in order to prepare tortillas for later sale. Other women will purchase chickens and pigs to help grow their business of raising animals.

The dreams of these women go hand-in-hand with the wellbeing of their children. These women would like to receive this loan so that they can invest in their business. The money earned will allow them to purchase better clothes for their children, fix and enlarge their homes so that their children can live comfortably, and to pay for their children’s schooling. This will allow their children to enjoy a better future. Finally, the dream of one woman was the other women would be in God’s graces helping them pay on time and allowing the group to become a solid group of colleagues and friends. Friendship Bridge will do what is required to monitor and distribute the loan funds, will allocate the appropriate loan amount to each borrower and will establish guidelines for this to take place.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras que constituyen la ComUnidad o banco comunal “El Mirador” son unas mujeres que al comienzo reflejaban una mirada temerosa. Sin embargo, al pasar los minutos y las preguntas ellas empezaron a sacar a relucir su personalidad y su actitud empresarial.

Mucha de estas señoras han sido artesanas de pequeñas, tejiendo los trajes típicos de su región o trabajando dentro de sU. casas como empleadas domésticas. Pero, poco a poco fueron descubriendo un mercado virgen para la venta de productos alimenticios en distintos niveles de la economía local. Es por esa visión y empuje empresarial que Friendship Bridge ha decidido apoyarlas con un crédito, por medio de los prestamistas de Kiva. El promedio del primer crédito solicitado por cada señora es de Q2000 o U.$264. Eso quiere decir que estas señoras están dispuestas a invertir una cantidad considerable para el mejoramiento de su negocio.

Las señoras van a usar su préstamo para distintas actividades. Muchas de las señoras van a usar su préstamo para comprar fertilizante, semillas y herramientas de cultivo para poder sembrar y cosechar vegetales y venderlos en el mercado local. También, el préstamo se va a utilizar para comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor y revenderlas en el mercado local. Asimismo, ellas van a comprar maíz al por mayor para prepara tortillas y luego venderlas. Otras señoras van a comprar pollos y cerdos para agrandar su negocio de crianza de animales.

Los sueños de estas señoras van de la mano con el bienestar de sU. hijos. Ellas quieren solicitar este préstamo para que de esa manera ellas puedan invertir en su negocio y con el dinero ganado puedan comprarles mejor ropa a sU. hijos, arreglar y agrandar sU. casas para que sU. hijos puedan vivir con relativa comodidad y para que ellas puedan mandar sU. hijos al colegio. De esa manera sU. hijos puedan disfrutar de un mejor futuro. Finalmente, el sueño que una señora tuvo fue que el resto de sU. compañeras estén en la gracia de Dios para que todas puedan pagar a tiempo y de esa manera construir un grupo sólido de socias y amigas. Friendship Bridge va a hacer todo lo posible mediante capacitaciones, otorgando el crédito apropiado a la necesidad de la clienta y la fomentación de valores para que eso suceda.

loans.use:
Purchase tools and supplies for the cultivation and harvesting of vegetables. Purchase of animals to raise and resell. Purchase of quality materials for embroidery. Purchase of maiz to prepare tortillas for sale. Purchase of vegetables and fruit in bulk to resell.

Comprar herramientas e insumos de cultivo para la siembra de vegetales. Comprar animales para su crianza y reventa. Comprar materia prima para sus tejidos. Comprar maíz para preparar tortillas y luego venderlas. Comprar verduras y frutas al por mayor para su respectiva reventa.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
My name is Zahida B.. I have two girls. My elder daughter is in kindergarten. My younger daughter is not of school age yet. I live with my family in a mud house in Raiwind, a small semi-urban town in Pakistan.
My husband is a daily wage laborer who polishes tile floors. I sew clothes for women in my neighborhood and sell milk from my house to increase our household income. I need a loan of $225 to buy another cow for my business. I hope to give my children a secure financial future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
