Marina K. is married with a grown son and a 14-year-old daughter. Her family lives in Berdyansk, on the Azov Sea.

Marina works in the local market, “Privoz”, selling women’s pants, skirts and footwear. One of the advantages of her business is a good balance of price and quality. Marina has been working with Nadiya Ukraine for four years. She has a perfect credit history and can be characterized as a very disciplined client with integrity. Currently, Marina has about $7000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $6000 and her monthly net profit is about $4000.

Marina is hoping to use this loan of $1200 to help attract additional funding, modernize her business and increase customer demand. She also wants to use some of her profits to remodel her apartment and possibly purchase a vehicle which would serve business purposes and make life more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Damisson

texts.pt:
Damisson Absalão S., 28, was born in the neighborhood of Boane, in Maputo, Mozambique, where he still lives with his young son and three sisters in his mother's house. A teacher at an elementary school in Boane Sede, Damisson has been working toward a college degree in Education/Pedagogy since 2005. In 2006, with money saved from his job as a teacher, he bought a piece of land, with the goal of eventually building his own house. Per a friend's suggestion, he joined the Hluvuku-Adsema credit program in 2007. Now on his third loan cycle, having paid his first two loans in full, Damisson will use the amount of $525 to buy more materials, so he can finally start building his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao :Bairro 7 Cliente : Damisson Absalão S. Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo:12.000,00 MT ( 508 USD) Aplicação: Compra de Materiais de Construção Data Inicio: 28-01-08 Data Fim: 21-07-09 Damisson Absalão S., de 28 anos de idade e pai de um filho, nasceu no distrito de Boane. Província de Maputo. Tem 4 irmãos dos quais três são meninas. Filho de pais separados e estando ele a viver com sua mãe . Começou a estudar na escola primaria de Boane . Depois passou pra a escola secundaria Joaquim Alberto Chissano para fazer o nível básico, não havendo o segundo ciclo no distrito seguiu para Escola secundaria da Matola para fazer o segundo ciclo do ensino secundário. No ano seguinte começou a trabalhar como professor na escola primaria de Boane Sede . Em 2005 engrena na faculdade pedagógica para se formar na área de ciências pedagógicas estando ainda a frequentar o curso. Em 2006 comprou seu terreno com seu próprio fundo, e tendo dificuldades de ter valor para compra de material de construçao para começar com a sua obra comenta com um dos seus colegas de trabalho sobre a deficuldade e ele aconselha-o a procurrar um Banco sendo este nosso cliente fala-lhe da Hluvuku-Adsema e aproximou-se pra saber dos requisitos e mete seu primeiro pedido de empréstimo no valor de 8.000,00MT tendo pago sem nenhum problema. Depois deste mete segundo pedido no valor de 12.000,00MT que já foi aprovado na sua totalidade. Tem como maior sonho ter sua própria casa.

loans.use: To buy construction material to build his house

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mr. Sim S., age 74, a widower, is a construction worker who builds houses. He earns an average of $3 a day. He has eight children. Six of then married and live away from home, and two sell rice, earning $50 each a month. Mr. S. would like to use this loan to purchase construction tools to assist in his work.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy C. and her husband, Mr. Phoung Ya, married in 1972. They have six children; two sons and four daughters. All of their children are employed full time. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Thy has been a weaver for over one year. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman in the village who then sells it in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, she buys recycled materials in her village to resell. She started this business two years ago. Her husband raises cows.

Thy is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase materials for silk weaving and buy recycled materials to resell.

loans.use: to purchase materials for silk weaving and buy recycling materials to resell

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa S., who is married with two children, prepares and sells a food dish called ‘Wakye’ that is made of cooked rice and beans. It is very nutritious and love by Ghanaians. Her business is doing well and she wishes to increase the food production and sales.

She is asking for additional capital to buy more food items for the food production and sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for food production and sales

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
For more than 13 years, Marcelina worked at making shoes. There was a lot of competition however, and she had to give up this business.

Three years ago, together with her daughter, she decided to sell music CDs and DVDs as well as to make labels for their storage cases, and to sell these wholesale.

She currently has two sales points in central Lima. Her daughter is in charge of delivering the labels, and she also sends requests to the provinces. The loans she has applied for have been used to pay for printing costs for the labels.

Marcelina would like to have a computer store, which her brother-in-law has told her can be a profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Marcelina trabajó por más de 13 años haciendo zapatos. Sin embargo, había mucha competencia, por lo que tuvo que abandonar ese negocio.

Fue así que hace 3 años, junto con su hija, decidió vender CDs y DVDs de música, así como mandar a hacer las carátulas de los cases de los CDs y ofrecerlos al por mayor.

En la actualidad tiene 2 puestos de venta en el Centro de Lima. Su hija se encarga del reparto de las carátulas. También mandan pedidos a provincia. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para pagar los gastos de imprenta que las carátulas demandan.

A Marcelina le gustaría tener una tienda de computadoras, puesto que su cuñado e ha dicho que es un negocio rentable.

loans.use: Pay for printing expenses for CD and DVD labels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flor María needs a 2000 soles loan to buy rice, sugar, vermicelli and vegetables.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a business selling basic foods. The business is her family's sole source of income. Her husband is unemployed, so she must work very hard to support the family. She decided to take out an 8-month loan, which will help her increase sales, her range of goods, and the business's profitability.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиева Назока проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 30 лет . Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует продуктами питания. Этот бизнес являетсмя единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж нигде не работает , поэтому ей самой приходится очень много работать , чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот, ассортимент и прибыльность бизнеса.

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is a member of the Kusikuy communal bank. She is 59 years old, married, and has 3 children. Delfina lives in the traditional neighborhood of Calvario, close to the church with the same name. She has a store where she sells groceries, red meat, chicken, vegetables, and drinks. The store is open from 6:00am until 9:00pm, and her children help her at the store because Delfina is in delicate health.

Delfina needs a loan of 2,100 soles ($725) to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles. She dreams of having a better-stocked store, and that all of her children have their own homes and financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy. Delfina es casada, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Delfina vive en el barrio tradicional Calvario, cerca D. la iglesia con el mismo nombre, Delfina tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes, carne, pollo, verduras, bebidas, actividad que realiza D. lunes a domingo desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Delfina esta algo delicada D. salud.

Delfina necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos. Delfina sueña con tener una tienda más surtida, que todos sus hijos tengan casa propia y estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles

loans.name: Loisi

texts.en: Loisi Soo is 36 years old and married with four children.  She has worked with her husband in the taro and banana business for five years, and sells the fruit to people in her village on a regular basis.  Loisi earns about $160 per week, and has already successfully paid off previous microfinance loans, which are her only access to capital.  Loisi is now requesting a loan of $850, which will be used to buy more sophisticated equipment for her banana business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, sprayers, and other gardening equipment

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 60 años, vive con su hijo D. 18 años Nelson, el cual es estudiante. Se viene dedicando a la venta D. ganado, el cual cría desD. en casa y venD. en las diversas ferias D. la ciudad. A Julia le agrada su trabajo, ya que siempre le han gustado los animales, a los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, siendo su trabajo muy esforzado, ya que  ayuda D. su hijo trasladan el ganado para su venta, lo que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo.
Un día D. venta, Julia se levanta las 6 D. la mañana para viajar a las ferias trasladando el ganado y regresa en horas D. la noche, agotada por el trajín del viaje. Julia quiere que su hijo Nelson sea un hombre D. bien y quiere acostumbrarlo al trabajo para que no vaya por el mal camino, que ve ella, esta corrompiendo ahora a la juventud. Con el dinero con que se le brinD. comprará más ganado para hacer su negocio más productivo. En el futuro, a Julia le gustaría tener un negocio paralelo, el cual pueda administrar su hijo.
texts.en:
Julia is 60 years old and lives with her son Nelson, who is a student and 18 years old. She makes a living by selling livestock, which she raises in her home and then sells in various markets in the city. Julia likes her job and always has liked animals, which she raises with much affection and dedication. Due to the difficulty of her job, her son helps her transport the livestock to the markets, which requires a lot of effort. On the days she sells the livestock, Julia wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to travel with the livestock to the street markets and returns in the evening hours, exhausted from the labor of the trip. Julia wants her son Nelson to be a good man and wants to accustom him to the job so that he doesn’t go down the wrong path because in her eyes, he is being corrupted by his young friends. With this loan, she will buy more livestock in order make her business more productive. In the future, Julia would like to have a similar business that her son could operate.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of livestock that she raises and sells

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Marco Antonio V. vive en la Localidad de El Torno desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos pequeños, actualmente se dedica al negocio del internet, siendo propietario de un cibercafé y un punto de llamadas. Negocio que le permite mantener a su familia.
Su esposa es dueña de otro punto de llamadas, es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de seguir adelante, su objetivo es llegar a agrandar su negocio y comprar más computadoras, para poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Marco Antonia V. has lived in the city of El Torno for approximately 5 years. He owns his home, and lives there with his wife and three small children. Marco is in the internet business, as he owns an internet and long-distance phone cafe. This business allows Marco to support his family. Marco's wife owns a separate phone cafe, and is a hard working person, who has a desire to succeed. Marcos' goal is to expand his business and purchase more computers so that he can help his children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers

loans.name: Mohijon

texts.en:
Mohijon N. is 50 years old. She is married with 2 children. Mohijon is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and educate her children. Thanks to her example, her children are now working adults.

Mohijon sells various sorts of dried apricots at the local food market in the town of Isfara. She purchases her products from wholesalers and then, after processing them, sells them at a local market. She has been in the business for 15 years. She got her startup money after saving from her previous business.

Mohijon has received 15 loans from IMON International. The loans have helped her business; her customers tell her that her business is well-stocked with high-quality products. Furthermore, having cash in hand has permitted her to purchase more goods and make better deals with wholesalers. Now she is requesting a loan in order to purchase dried apricots. She will re-make them to sell in the market at the best prices. With your help, Mohijon will be able to get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots to sell

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok R., is the leader of the five-member group; all the borrowers live in Svay Dongkom Commune of Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. Sok R. is a 58-year-old widow. She sells lotus flowers for ceremonies. She travels to find the lotus flowers in the ponds far away from her home. She has been running her business for a long time ago. She is responsible for three children; two of them are single and one is widowed. All of her children live with her in the family home. Her widow-child works with her selling lotus flowers. To make the business and family's transportation easier, Sok R. requests a loan to purchase a motorcycle. The loan will help her reduce her business expenses.

The other four borrowers are:

  • Pok C., 40, and a widow. She sells different kinds of flowers and requests a loan to purchase more flowers to sell.
  • Sek S., 44, raises pigs at home and sells flowers. She requests a loan to buy flowers to sell.
  • Sum T. is 40 years old. He is a local construction worker, who requests a loan to buy house repairing. (T.'s wife appears in the photo in his place.)
  • Srey P. is 34 years old and a widow. She sells groceries and she requests a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for business and family transportation needs

loans.name: Abau

texts.en:
Abau Luke sells beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Abau is 29 years old and single. A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D., 31 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Médina Diambéré depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des draps de lit. Elle veut  renforcer son captal. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou D., age 31, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Médina Diambéré for two and a half years. Her work consists in buying and reselling bed sheets. She wants to build up her capital. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in bed sheets

loans.name: Enecito

texts.en:
Enecito S. owns 1 hectare of land, which he inherited from his parents. He is 39 years old and still single. He started tilling the farm when he was just 10 years old. They were so poor that he was not able to finish his studies. Instead, he helped his parents on the farm to raise their family and have enough food to eat. Now that he finally owns the farm, he wants to make it grow in honor of his parents. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy good quality rice seed and fertilizer to improve his yield. In that way, he can also save for his future family. The loan will greatly help Enecito grow his farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help alleviate poverty. It helps people start and have their own business. They provide all their clients like Enecito not only credit but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and Urea fertilizer.

loans.name: Afiafi

texts.en:
Afiafi S., 40, is married with seven children. She has two years of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (approximately 260 USD).

Afiafi has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Afiafi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of sugar, a freezer, coolers and plastic bags to make ice cakes

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон- мужчина 51 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Рахмон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Рахмон кредитуется уже больше 1 года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у него большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Рахмон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Rahmon is 51 years old. He is married with 3 children. Rahmon rears and sells livestock and his wife processes and sells milk. Rahmon has been receiving loans for over 1 year. When he came to ask for his first loan, he had very few animals. Currently, he has several small cattle. His wife has only 1 milking cow. Rahmon plans to buy another milking cow with a calf for his wife. He is thankful to those providing loans for making his dreams come true.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing and sale of cattle

loans.name: Jehly

texts.en:
Jehly B. just had her harvest recently during the time CEVI visited her. She is about to do land preparation in her farm. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase crude oil, herbicides, and complete fertilizers. She hopes that with her loan she will have better harvest next time. 

CEVI provides not just loans to clients. It also gives training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase crude oil, herbicides, and complete fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema T. is married and runs a small business selling second-hand clothes in the Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. She buys her items wholesale from various supplies and sells them retail. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
P. Trần Thị (649000468) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four school-aged children.

P. owns and operates a business providing furniture rental services to local community members. P. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2000, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

P. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en: Olena is married with one child. She sells men's clothing at one of the open markets in Melitopol city. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her growing experience and the constant demand for the type of goods she sells motivated Olena to start a second location. It will not only increase her sales and profit, but give some one a job and a stable income. Olena is requesting to borrow 13,900 UAH. She has used business loans before and considers them very helpful.

loans.use: to open new business location

loans.name: Samya

texts.en:
Samya is married with three children. She appears in the photo with her husband and twin daughters.

Samya and her husband work at their pottery business: he works on pottery, making vases and coloring them, while she helps him by selling them in the market. They have small shop in the market.

Samaya and her husband need this loan to buy raw materials to make new products and designs. Samya has been with FATEN for a few years and she has taken four loans starting with 200 USD. She has repaid all her loans in full and on time.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make new products and designs

loans.name: Mrs. Kumba

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Kumba M., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. Mrs. M. sells cooked rice, meat and vegetables as well as soft drinks in her small restaurant on the Azzolini Highway in Makeni. 

Kumba is seeking a loan from SMT for the second time in order to help her further improve her business. With the previous SMT loan, she was able to improve her business and personal life. Having repaid her previous loan successfully, she is now requesting a new loan of Le 3,000,000.00.

Mrs. M. is now age 32. She was born in Bo city, southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a police officer and they have two children. One of her children has just written the Basic Education Certificate Examinations (BECE) and the other is in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II). Kumba has been selling cooked rice for a year going on two now. With this loan, Kumba will be able to buy bags of rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), a floor mat, cups and spoons, plates, more drinks to sell and a musical set to entertain her customers. She will also expand her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients and expand her restuarant

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Don Francisco Antonio esta solicitando su 7mo  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo  en la construir una habitaciòn, trabaja como obrero de Campo en el INTA de Nueva Guinea desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijos estudiando su primaria, vive en la zona # 3 en Nueva Guinea,  se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable  para con  sus hijos, los enseño a trabajar y a estudiar para ser personas de bien, su esposa se encarga del cuido de sus hijos y de los quehaceres del hogar,  es muy querido en su centro de trabajo por ser una persona de buen vivir, responsable, trabajador y  sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y llegar a conocer a sus nietos, salud y que su familia siempre permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Francisco Antonio is asking for his 7th loan with AFODENIC to build a room. For eight years he has been a field worker for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute for Agricultural Technology) of Nueva Guinea. He has two children who attend elementary school. He lives in the Zona #3 in Nueva Guinea. He is characterized as being a very responsible man with his children. He taught them to work and to study to be good, decent people. His wife is in charge of taking care of the children and the household chores. In his work center he is very well liked for being a person who lives right, is responsible, hard-working, and friendly in his community. His dreams are to improve their living conditions, come to know his grandchildren, to have good health, and that his family always stays united.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. is 25 years old, married to Leah Njeri and they have one school going child.

Peter has been operating a road side cafe in Naivasha town for the last six years.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan well which he used to make seats for his clients at the cafe premise. With the proceeds of this second loan, he is planning to diversify and start selling cereals on the side. This will enable him capitalise on the income generation as the original business and this one will give him more profit and sustainability.

He has future plans of expanding his business, buying a plot and building rental houses.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy cereals for sale.

loans.name: Hanie

texts.en:
Hanie C. is from the village of Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Hanie is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Hanie raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Hanie has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hanie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hanie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Hanie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Mrs. Josefina R. is fifty years of age and from the village of San Pedro, Roxas, Isabela. She is engaged in the business of fattening pigs. At her age, she can still manage taking care of a number of pigs. She is doing this for her family, especially since she still has children who are attending school.  A few months ago she sold one of her raised animals because her child needs money for her school tuition fee. 

Josefina's only source of income is through her piggery, so she is really working hard, but due to financial constraints, she wants to borrow a Php 7,000 loan from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of her pigs and for feed. She is optimistic that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: Maintenance of her pigs and feed

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en: Silvester is a 36 years old and the father of four children between the ages of two and 14. He runs the Lucky Summer Kerosene Pump Shop, where he sells general household items. He also takes on painting jobs as a source of extra income. Silvester has had his shop for three years and is widely thought of as hardworking and determined. He has applied for this loan for $275 to buy sugar and eggs to sell to his customers. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a wholesale supply company so that he can live a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar and eggs to sell to his customers

loans.name: Ma. Devy

texts.en:
Becoming a widow has not stopped Ma. Devy D. C. from continuing to work hard for the betterment of her family. At 45 years of age, with two children who are 21 and 22 years old, Devy lives in the village of Brgy. Tuig, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.

Many years ago, Devy wanted to help her husband pay for their family expenses, so she put up a general store and it lessened the financial burden on her husband. As her store grew, she needed additional capital to sustain its growth – this is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003. It enabled her to expand her store operations even more. When her husband died, she was so grief-stricken even her business was affected for some time, but then she realized that she still had her children to support and to live for, so she focused all of her attention in this new direction and moved on with her life and her business.

Because of her invigorated efforts, her business began to grow again and with the help of loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she now earns a minimum of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She saves most of her income for the security and future of her children after spending for household expenses. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP was used as additional working capital for her general store. Now that it is fully repaid, she is applying for a new loan, borrowing the same amount of 18,000 PHP for her eighth loan cycle which she intends to use in her general store as additional working capital to buy more products to sell.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon(a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Unn

texts.en:
Unn K. is 50 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2000, she has been working as a silk weaver to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 3 in profit every day. Her husband makes and sells rice wine. On average, he is able to make about US$ 2 a day. Her husband also does farming in the rainy season. This couple has two children, one of whom is a farmer.

Unn K. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1100 to purchase a tractor to assist in their farm work.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Mrs. Tum H. is 46 years old. The name of her husband is Mr. Pea Hieng. This couple has three children. Their first child is twenty-two years old. Their second child is fifteen years old. Their third child is six years old. Two of the children are attending the local school while the other is a garment factory worker. This family lives in the Preaek Ta Sau village, in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Tum H. is a farmer who owns a 0.5 hectare field of land on which she cultivates rice, in order to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate the rice and she would use rest of the loan to buy fuel, rice seed, and to hire the laborers to plow the field. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the rice, to buy fuel, rice seed, and to hire laborers to plow the field.

loans.name: Tanutsu Women Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Tanutsu Women' group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan in order to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Aminata K. (second from left) is 35 years old. She was born in Makeni and is married to a businessman. The two of them have 3 children – one in secondary school and two in primary school. Aminata sells margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years. With her share of the loan, she will buy packets of margi, bags of salt, and bags of sugar.

loans.use: Buy packets of margi, bags of salt, and bags of sugar

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas has owned a citrus fruit project since 2006. He opened this type of project after seeing a need for such services in the region and because this kind of business makes a good income for the person. He is the one who supports his wife and only child with this business. Once the harvest is cultivated, he distributes it to the market. Today, Firas is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy new tools to augment the cultivation.

loans.use: To buy new agricultural tools.

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Mayra es maestra de educación primaria es muy trabajadora, ya que después de dar clases haces trabajos labores en casa, ella está solicitando el crédito ya que su mama está muy grave y va ser operada y por lo que le conviene ese dinero.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra is a primary school teacher and is very hardworking - after she has given her classes she does chores at home. She is asking for this loan as her mother is very ill - the money is to pay for her operation.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is to pay for her mother's operation

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea T. is 58 years-old and a villager who lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. He and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. At present, they own only one ox to support their farming, therefore Mr. Chea T. would like to purchase another ox for plowing his rice field. In addition to farming, he collects palm juice which makes a small income to support his family. This couple has three children who are all seamstresses in the garment factory. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase an ox.

loans.name: Soko Akutiyemina

texts.en: Soko Akutiyemina T. is a 64-year-old pharmacist in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Born in Malikiya village, Kambia district, northern Sierra Leone, Soko is married to a nurse and they have seven children. Two of their children are in college and five are now working and living on their own. Soko has been running a private pharmacy since 2001, the year that he resigned from government service. He is seeking a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to invest in his business. He will use this loan to buy drugs wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy medicines wholesale to add to his pharmacy inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for his supermarket

loans.name: Lucy Wairimu

texts.en: Lucy is fifty years old and married with four children. She lives in Kasarani, a Nairobi suburb. Lucy operates a retail shop for selling spare motorcycle parts at Nyamakima bus terminus in Nairobi town center. She has done this for the last year. With this loan, she plans to buy stock of motorcycle spare parts to sell in her retail shop. Her customers are mainly motorcyclists at Nyamakima bus terminus.She has never borrowed from another financial institution. In the future, she hopes to develop a well-stocked shop to supply other small-scale dealers in spare parts.

loans.use: To increase her stock of spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Yaneth Lorena

texts.es: Yaneth Lorena tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, cuando dio inicio fue con muy poco capital de trabajo pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su familia lo más necesario. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, jugos, detergentes y sopas. Su deseo es acondicionar su vivienda y además invertir en una amplia variedad de productos para su pulpería.
texts.en:
Yaneth Lorena is 38 years old. She has a small general store. She has had this business for more than 6 years. When she started it, she had very little working capital because she always wanted to make sure her family had everything they needed. She is requesting this loan for working capital to buy sweets, bread, cookies, juices, detergents, and soups. She hopes to equip her house and also invest in a large variety of products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, bread, cookies, juices, detergents, and soups for her store

loans.name: Deyanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Deyanira del Carmen Alemán P. desde pequeña se dedica al comerció recuerda que a la edad de siete años le vendía a sus compañeros dulces y al ir creciendo fue cambiando sus productos. En la actualidad está señora de 44 años hace cinco años que se dedica al comercio de ropa y verduras. 

Ella tiene siete hijos pero solo cinco están con ella de 21, 19, 17, 9 y 8 años quienes después de clase le ayudan en el negocio. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa ya que tiene muchos encargos.
texts.en:
Deyanira del Carmen Alemán P. has been selling items since she was a little girl. She remembers, at the age of seven, selling candy to her friends and over time began selling different products. Sra. Deyanira is now 44 years old and has been a merchant for five years selling clothing and vegetables.

She has seven children, but only five (ages 21, 19, 17, 9, and 8) still live with her. They help with her business after their classes. This loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing since she has several orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Monsieur Yaovi A. is a 27-year-old man who owns a stall selling second-hand clothing. He buys and sells his items in the capital city of Lomé.

As an ambitious young entrepreneur, he is successfully growing his business and, to do so, is taking his second micro-loan from WAGES. This loan of 350,000 CFA will be used to purchase more second-hand clothing and other items as needed.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing and other items

loans.name: Olidier

texts.es: Olidier V. S., tiene la edad de 29 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo de 3 años que es  su mayor prioridad.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cerdos para la cría y engorde. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para poder desarrollar animales de mejor calidad, y obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. El desea aprovechar  las instalaciones que posee para desarrollar la actividad de los cerdos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Olidier  tiene varios años en este negocio de cerdos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Olidier V. S. is 29 years old. He is single and has one three year old son who is his top priority. He is asking for this loan in order to buy hogs to raise and fatten up. He wants to give them adequate care in order to develop better quality animals, so that he can obtain the greatest amount of income possible when he sells them. He wants to take advantage of the pens he has to raise the hogs. This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR and he is pleased with the ease through which he was able to obtain it. Mr. Olidier has been running this hog business for several years and wants to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life, give them economic stability, and continue to grow as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis de 51 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), el vende pescados desde hace años para mantener a sus 7 hijos y esposa. 

Una amigo de Luis le animo para que vendiera pescado ya que la falta de ingresos ocasionaba que su familia no viviera bien, con un dinero prestado comenzó a comprar y vender pescado, poco a poco pudo vender pescados por saco. Ahora el trabaja desde la mañana hasta las tardes vendiendo pescados como tilapia y corvinas. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar para continuar con su negocio pescados de varios tipos y camarones. En el futuro el quiere comprar un solar para construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is 51 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil (a suburban zone surrounded by the Guayaquil estuary). He has been selling fish for the past to years, in order to support his wife and seven children. One of Luis’ friends encouraged him to begin selling fish because he needed an income and his family didn’t live well. He borrowed some money and began buying and selling fish. Little by little he was able to sell fish by the sac. Now he works from morning to night, selling fish such as tilapia and corvina. He will use the money from this loan to buy various types of fish and shrimp to continue his business. In the future he would like to buy a lot on which he can build his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish and shrimp for resale

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun N., age 32, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards and wooden beds. She sells rattan that she and her husband produce or that they order from other makers who live in the village. 

Bun N. uses her cow cart as transportation and it takes a week to sell all her items. Recently she lacks enouigh cash to buy raw materials to make more of her products to satisfy the needs of her customers, so she has applied for assistance through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make more of her products to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida V. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte, Ilagan. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Adelaida owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Adelaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Adelaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: en 2003, N. kossiwa s'est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes et de tissus bazins, pour conquérir plus de client elle dans le quartier de kégué et de ses alentours fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.Voulant dynamiser son stock elle sollicite pour sa première fois de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de pagnes et de bazins de diverses Qualités.elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2003, N’ZONOU Kossiwa began to sell pagnes (traditional sarong-like clothing) and bazin fabric. In order to win over more customers, she operates as an itinerant vendor in the Kégué neighborhood and the surrounding area. She gets her stock at the large market in Lomé. She wants to pep up her stock, so is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy various kinds of pagnes and bazins. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes and bazin fabric

loans.name: Mrs. Ngann Tha Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people make up this village bank loan located in Si Sla village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for different ways in which to improve their living. Mrs. Ngann T. , born in 1981, was selected by the other members to be the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Savan Douk, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family living, and he is a duck breeder. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Ngann T. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, and also to hire a plow machine to plow her field. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are students, while the other one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Margaret  Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and married to Charles T.. They have four children who are still financially dependent on them. She has been running the farm for a period of six years with a monthly profit of about KES 25,000. She is dairy farming and keeps poultry, at the same time.    

She wants to use the loan to expand on her poultry activity by purchasing more broiler chicks to raise and later sell, at a profit. She hopes to become one of the best poultry farmers in her location. She also hopes to see her children realizing their dreams in life.

loans.use: To expand on poultry activity by purchasing more broiler chicks to raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Julia del Carmen tiene una pulpería. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio para aumentar su inventario. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar y esta forma de realizarlo es su mejor forma. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, gaseosas y productos lácteos.  Pues la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda que ha logrado obtener una gran variedad de clientes.
texts.en: Julia del Carmen has a small grocery store.  She has had this business for more than 16 years.  This isn't the first time that she has asked for financing.  It has been a great help to her business so she could increase her inventory.  She has always liked to work, and this is her best way to do it.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy basic grains, detergent, soft drinks, and dairy products.  Her business is located in her home, and she has managed to obtain a large variety of customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 55-year-old married man and the father of three children. He lives in Lebanon. He has been working as a house builder for almost 25 years. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients. Due to his long history in this occupation, he has acquired good experience and a good business reputation.

Today, he has the opportunity to expand his business into other areas. He is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a pick-up vehicle to move his tools and to facilitate his movements to the projects where he works. He is certain that with the help of the loan, he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a pick-up vehicle

loans.name: Rosa Angelina

texts.es: Rosa Angelina tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio, por lo que no ha sido fácil administrar este negocio, con tanta competencia que tiene. Ella inicio con pocos ingresos, pues no tenía el capital suficiente para invertir en más productos. Ella es una mujer luchadora  que siempre busca la forma como trabajar para mantener su hogar. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, ropa en general, cosmético y calzado.
texts.en: Rosa Angelina is 27, and she sells general merchandise.  She began 5 years ago but it hasn’t been easy since there is a lot of competition.  She started with few items since she didn’t have enough capital to invest in many products.  She is a hard-working woman who is always looking for a way to support her household.  She will use the loan to buy towels, sheets, clothing, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 46 years-old and married with two children. She operates a general store where she sells food stuff and cereals. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kes to add stock of rice and maize. She hopes to open a mini-supermarket in the future. She has learnt how to keep her business records and financial management from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya ltd. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of rice and maize.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta S. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Violeta is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services and making curtains & basketball uniforms for local community members. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring materials such as needles & thread. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Violeta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials such as needles & thread

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean O., 41, is a farmer, earning an income of $3 per day. O. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

The family has to spend $11 on food, $10 on electricity supply, and $20 on other necessary expenses every month. 

O. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds to improve her farming business. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and rice seeds to improve the farming business

loans.name: Kamala

texts.ru:
Kamala M. 33 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Kamala yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione  vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Kamala ochen trudolubiviy chelovek.
Ona uje 7 let zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyeqo otca, kotoriy toje zanimalsya skotovodstvom s molodosti.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva moloko iz kotoroqa ona delayet razniye sorta sira i prodayot ix sosedem kotoriye ochen dovolni kachestvom i vkusom tovara.
texts.en:
Kamala M. is 33 years old. She is married and has two children. Kamala is an internally displaced person, she is a migrant from the town of Fuzili and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her husband and children.

Kamala is a very hardworking person. She has been doing animal husbandry for more than seven years. She has learned this business from her father who has been also doing animal husbandry at a young age.

Right now she needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and increase the amount of milk from which she makes different kinds of cheeses and sells it to her neighbors who are very satisfied with the quality and taste of the product.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a vegetable selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Judith faces a major challenge of seasonality. During dry hot season the availability of vegetables for sale is lower and demand is higher hence not meeting customers demand. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Judith has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second business selling milk  

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more milk for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Judith hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her sister.  

In the future, Judith hopes to take a course in hairdressing. Judith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by getting her more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the town of Kitale, in Western Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for eight years and supports his children, who are 3, 11 and 14 years of age, through the farming business. Currently, he sells maize, bananas and sugarcane locally. 

Joseph has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES to buy a dairy cow. The income from the cow will help pay for his children's education and feed his family. In five years time he wants to purchase three motorbikes for transporting the dairy produce.

Like many farmers in Kenya, Joseph believes that unpredictable weather conditions and low prices are the biggest challenges facing the business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Después de trabajar durante varios años vendiendo mercancía, hace un año, Gladys Elena J. R. decidió ubicarse en un local con el fin de incrementar sus ventas, mejorando así su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Actualmente Gladys quien vive en Rionegro Antioquia, necesita de un préstamo para comparar mercancía y así ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos; en el futuro Gladys espera que su almacén tenga un gran reconocimiento.
texts.en:
A year ago, after working for several years selling merchandise, Gladys Elena J. R. decided to set herself up in a shop with the goal of increasing her sales and thereby bettering the quality of life for herself and her family. 

Today Gladys, who lives in Rionegro Antioquia, needs a loan to purchase merchandise and thereby expand her business and increase her income. In the future Gladys hopes that her store may be widely known.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: José David

texts.es: José David se dedica a brindar el servicio de nintendo. Hace  como parte de su propia fuente de ingresos, inicio como la necesidad de fuente de ingreso, ya que tiene que mantener a su familia, sin embargo lo supera ofreciendo el mejor servicio en los videos juegos. Esto le llena de satisfacción y ánimo para continuar en este negocio por lo que desea mejorar y abastecerse de más productos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de discos, controles, reparación de televisores, mesas entre otros productos para agrandar su negocio. Sueña con agrandar cada día más su actividad y proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
José David offers a Nintendo service. He does this for part of his income, and started the business because he needed a source of income in order to support his family. He gets ahead by offering the best video game service. This makes him feel very satisfied and excited to continue with his business, which he would like to improve and stock with more products.

He will use the requested loan to invest in games, controls, television repair, and tables, among other products to expand his business. He dreams of growing his business a little more each day and of providing the earnings his family needs.

loans.use: to invest in games, controls, television repairs, tables, and other products to expand his business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a fermented fish ("tinabal" making) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruit and vegetables.  Remedios is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her fermented fish business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 34 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her fermented fish making.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 37 ans, Akossiwa est célibataire et n’a aucun enfant en charge et pourtant elle n’entend pas  baisser les bras  au quotidien,  cependant elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis 1996.pour son activité de revendeuse, elle  s’approvisionne ici à Lomé et revend dans sa boutique qu’elle tient à domicile.
texts.en: A young woman of 37, Akossiwa is single and not raising any children. Nevertheless she does not hesitate to get on with ordinary life, so she has been tending a general store since 1996. For her work as a small-scale merchant, she buys her inventory here in Lomé and sells her wares in her shop located in her home.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, from the village of Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 35 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture selling agricultural equipment in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more equipment for her enterprise, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her farm supplies business.

location.town: Liloy-Santo Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 35 years old and has six children between the ages of 17 and 35. For the past four years, she has been selling foodstuffs. Her business is doing well and has enabled her to feed and educate her family. 

Eugenie is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell in order to increase her profit. In the future, she plans to buy a cow from which she hopes to get milk.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff and items to sell

loans.name: Sigismond

texts.en:
Sigismond is 26 years old and is married with one child, aged one.  He runs a distributor store for a brewery and for soft drinks in Aberdeen, the western part of Freetown.

Sigismond has owned this business for five years and sells soft drinks, wine and beer at his store. He also receives income from his elder brother who lives overseas. He says that the main challenge to his business is during the rainy season, when sales are much slower compared to the dry season.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soft drinks, beer, Heineken and clean water. Sigismond says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living and increase his capital. In the future, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drink, beer and clean water

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 51 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Perla runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as sardines and groceries to sell in her store.

Perla has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and toothpaste. 

In the future, Perla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 54 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene tres hijos en etapa escolar. Viven en la comunidad de Triboline, anexo de la ciudad de Sivia, donde tienen su propia casa construida a base de material rustico. Lucila, se dedica a la actividad agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de frutas como: piñas, mangos, pacay, plátanos y frutas cítricas, actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace 20 años. Recuerda cuando tuvo su primera parcela, empezó a construir su propio sueño, ya que tenía mucha fe, desde luego que lo consiguió. Ni bien salieron sus primeros productos, ella los vendía en el mercado de su poblado, pero de vez en cuando acudía a la feria de distintas localidades, así se hizo conocida por sus clientes. Ahora todo lo que produce los lleva a la ciudad de Ayacucho, para que los pueda vender al por mayor, de esa manera logro percibir buenos ingresos económicos lo cual le sirve para sustentar los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero  en tiempo de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de la recolección de los frutos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras y posteriormente cosechar frutos de calidad. Su plan a futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble, con la necesidad de brindarle seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este será su 13avo crédito, por la cual se siente muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo de parte de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados. Con los 1,700 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes naturales para mejorar la tierra de su parcela.
texts.en: Lucila is 54 years old. She is divorced and has three school-aged children. They live in the community of Triboline, an outlying part of the city of Sivia, where they have their own house built from simple materials. Lucila works in agriculture, specifically as a producer and seller of fruits such as pineapples, mangos, pacay ["ice-cream beans"], bananas and citrus fruits. She has been doing this work for 20 years. She recalls that when she had her first plot of land, she began to work toward her personal dream, since she had great faith, and because of this she succeeded. As soon as her first crops were ready, she sold them at the marketplace in her town, but she also sometimes went to the markets of other towns, and thus she became known among her customers. Now, she takes everything she produces to the city of Ayacucho, so that she can sell it wholesale. In this way, she is able to earn a good income, allowing her to pay the costs for educating her children. In general, she works independently, but at harvest time she needs help from laborers who take on the work of collecting the fruits. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields and later harvest high-quality fruits. Her plan for the future is to rebuild her house using solid materials, because she needs to provide security and comfort for her family. This will be her 13th loan, and she is very happy to know that she will have support from all of you. In this way, she feels secure in buying what she requested, and she is ready to make her scheduled payments on time. With the 1,700 Peruvian new soles, she will buy natural fertilizers to improve the soil on her piece of land.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes van a la escuela, Jose trabaja como chófer ya que cuenta con su propio auto, con el cual presta el servicio de transporte , la familia cuenta con buenas referencias personales. El Sr. José va a utilizar el crédito para hacer mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que este es su principal fuente de trabajo; su sueño de Jose es ver crecer su negocio y comprarse otro carro para así aumentar su negocio. El esta muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old living in his own house with his wife and two minor children who go to school.  José works as a Driver and he owns his car that he uses to provide transportation services in the Santiago-Ica region.  The family has good personal references.

José will use the loan to service his vehicle because it’s his main work tool.  José’s dream is to see his business grow and to buy himself another car to increase business.  He is very grateful for the loan he’s been granted.

loans.use: Para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido is married with three children. He is 50 years old and lives in Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Candido has a charcoal retail business. He has had this business for six years. Each month, he earns approximately 15000 Philippine pesos. Candido has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Candido hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 50-100 sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pablo Cruz

texts.es: Pablo se dedica al servicio de carpintería, inicio por la necesidad de tener un trabajo pues tiene dos hijos menores de edad que mantener. Uno de sus sueños es proporcionarle ciertas mejoras a si vivienda. El crédito es para la compra de serrucho, madera, clavos, pega, cepillo, y otras herramientas, la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes pedidos pues él tiene una amplia variedad de productos como sillas, comedores, roperos, escritorios, puertas entre otros.
texts.en:
Pablo is a dedicated carpenter. He began to do this skilled trade due to the necessity of finding work, since he has 2 minor children to maintain. 

One of his dreams is to make certain improvements to his house. 

This loan is for buying a handsaw, wood, nails, glue, a brush, and other tools. Most of his customers ask him to fill a variety of orders. He makes lots of products, including chairs, dining tables, clothes cabinets, desks, and doors, among others.

loans.use: to buy a handsaw, wood, nails, glue, a brush, and other tools for carpentry.

loans.name: Leticia Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.

En este lugar vive la señora Leticia, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no ha tenido hijos, ya que espera terminar sus estudios en Ing. Comercial para en un futuro darles lo mejor a los hijos que lleguen. El marido es policía.
 
Ella en sociedad con su mamá tienen un local en su casa en el cual venden adornos de barro y cerámicas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 14h00, ya que a estas horas ella tiene que desplazarse hasta la ciudad de Manta donde realiza sus estudios, pero cuando ella no está su mamá se hace cargo del negocio,  ellas compran a artesanos de su zona las artesanías  semi terminadas ya luego ellas las pintan y les dan el acabado para venderlas a sus clientes. Llevan seis  años con su negocio y dice que le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta porque sus compañeras son puntuales en los pagos y por la ayuda que les da la institución.
 
Su  meta es que la institución siga adelante ayudando con los créditos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Pila” meets at a site also called “La Pila” in the canton of Montecristi every 15 days. This place is well-known in the province and throughout the country for its rich traditional culture. This is also where a wide variety of handicrafts are made by the residents who have continued the customs of their ancestors.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Leticia. She is 26 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has no children. Leticia hopes to finish her studies in Business Administration so that she can have a better future for when she does have children. Her husband is a police officer.

Leticia and her mother manage a shop in her home where they sell decorations made of clay and ceramics. She works every day from 8am to 2pm before she has to travel to the city of Manta, where she takes her classes. Whenever she is away, Leticia’s mother takes over the business. They buy local handicrafts that are partially finished and then they paint them and provide the finishing touches before selling them to their customers. Leticia and her mother have been in business for six years and she says that they are doing well.

This loan will be used to buy more handicrafts in all forms and shapes to restock her business. Since joining the Communal Bank, Leticia was elected president and likes the fact that her fellow members are punctual with their payments. She also enjoys the assistance that Fundación ESPOIR has given her.

Her goal is to have Fundación ESPOIR continue assisting her by providing these loans.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Green Pastures Group

texts.en:
Judeth is 42 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She also cares for one dependent. Judeth is from Masvingo, Zimbabwe.. 

Judeth runs a clothing business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for three years. The main challenge she faces is the lack of sufficient working capital. 

Judeth is requesting a loan of $400 to buy material to make school uniforms for sale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay school fees and buy food for her family. In the future, Judeth plans to open a clothing factory.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials for school uniforms.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe vive en una localidad muy pequeña ella es viuda y a su responsabilidad tiene a cuatro hijos que a un están estudiando.

 Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  pollos  y  pavos  de rancho, para posteriormente venderlo en  la misma localidad, en ello lleva  cinco años y cuatro meses  en donde nos platica que le va bien ya que ha logrado mejorar cada día sus ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos.

Lo  que lo motivo ha esta actividad fueron sus hijos ya que desafortunadamente  su esposo falleció hace seis años, para eso ella busco la manera de cómo obtener ingresos y decidió  criar pollos y pavos, así lograr tener como sostenerse  con sus pequeña familia.
 
 Lo que ella desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo pueda mejorar cada día más sus ingresos y así también seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives in a small town. She is a widow and takes care of 4 school-age children.  

She seeks credit to buy turkeys and chickens for later re-sale.  She has worked raising poultry for 5 years and 4 months, and tells us that all is going well and that each day she has been able to improve her income to better support her children.

Her children encouraged her to start the business, since, unfortunately, her husband passed away six years ago. She began searching for a way to gain an income and decided to raise chickens and turkeys, so as to be able to sustain her small family. 

She hopes that with this small business and the loan she will be able to improve her income each day, and thus continue supporting her children so that they are able to have careers.

loans.use: to buy chickens for re-sale.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр с женой и 5-летней дочкой живет в Никополе. Он занимается небольшим бизнесом по переработке грецкого ореха, а также торгует овощами, фруктами и ягодами. Александр – предприниматель с многолетним стажем, занимается торговлей с 14 лет. На данный момент сумма в товаре у него составляет 65 000 гривен. 

Александру необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию грецких орехов для последующей переработки. Скупив нужное количество ореха, Александр будет перерабатывать его и продавать в период с февраля по апрель в Россию, Турцию и Италию. Александр – очень предприимчивый человек, всегда хорошо знает, где купить и кому продать. Его все знают, как молодого человека с перспективным бизнесом, благодаря которому его семья всегда обеспечена. Александр планирует и дальше заниматься этим бизнесом, потому что он выгодный, и, если заниматься им прилежно, грецкий орех будет и дальше пользоваться устойчивым спросом на оптовом рынке.   

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Alexander with his wife and a five year old daughter live in Nikopol. He runs a small business of processing walnuts as well as selling vegetables, fruits and berries. Alexander is a businessman with many years of experience. He has been selling for fourteen years. At this time the amount in his inventory equals to 65,000 hryvna.

Alexander needs a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvna to buy a batch of walnuts for followed processing. After buying a necessary amount of walnuts Alexander will process it and sell it during the period from February through April to Russia, Turkey and Italy. Alexander is a very entrepreneurial man, and always knows where to buy and whom to sell. Everyone knows him as a young man with a promising business thanks to which his family is well taken care of. Alexander plans to continue with this business further because it is very profitable and if it's run diligently the walnuts will continue to have a stable demand on the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy a batch of walnuts for followed processing.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra.
