Luz Marina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia sigue trabajando en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de utiles escolares,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,fideos y galletas y tambien vende utiles escolares como cuadernos,lapiceros,lapices,borradores entre otros utiles escolares,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de utiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas y tambien para comprar cuadernos,lapiceros,libros y lapices al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 32 years old, married and has two children. She continues to work at her business selling groceries and school supplies. She sells primary-need products like rice, sugar, milk, noodles and cookies, as well as school supplies like notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers and other items. She works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m., and through these businesses is able to make headway for her children. Luz Marina wants to expand and improve her store. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as notebooks, pens, books and pencils at wholesale. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as notebooks, pens, books and pencils at wholesale.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Shamira, who is in her early 30s, is married with one child. She has had a beauty salon business for one year now. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use it for buying more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to have an internal salon.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Royal," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City. She is 53 years old. Marilou is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, she raises and sells pigs. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and for daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 58 years old and married with four children. He supports his family by farming. He patiently cultivates their farm, planting corn seeds in order to provide for his family’s needs. With his fellow farmers who help him to operate his business, he is slowly reaching his desired income.

Antonio's goal of improving his family's standard of living is almost within reach. However, because of the high prices of food and other necessities, he cannot save enough for the business, an emergency fund, and his youngest child's school fees. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 from Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He says that this loan will be a great help to him for improving his business, which will possibly become a great source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en: Yar is a 30 year old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. For the past three years she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: o purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhay is a single mother who, at 56 years old, is still working hard. To make a living, she cultivates rice crops in Prey Chor district. She usually grows rice twice a year, during both the rainy and dry seasons, earning an average of $2.50 per day. She has six children, three of whom are already married. Currently however, one of her married daughters doesn’t own a house and is living with Chhay at home. 

Mrs. Chhay wants this loan in order to buy a piece of land, on which she will build a thatched house for her daughter to live with her own family. The land is in a good location, where Chhay’s daughter can operate a business selling things to the local people. Chhay is very happy and appreciative of the support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: Lleny, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de tener muchas ganas de progresar, está casada con Fernando quien es mecánico, fruto de esa unión tiene tres hijos de 12, 8 y 2 años de edad, a quienes quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Lleny es la venta de fajas femeninas de diversos modelos y marcas de mejores calidades, las cuales compra en la ciudad de Lima, donde tiene una tía quien le envía los productos a pedido. Ella los vende entres sus colegas de su trabajo, siendo ella docente, proesión que aún ejerce, pero la venta de éstos productos tiene más de 03 años. Sus ventas lo realiza a crédito cobrando cada 30 días. Le gusta su actividad pues le permite tener un ingreso económico adicional al sueldo de su trabajo ya que muchas veces no le alcanzaba para pagar sus cuentas a pesar que las comparte con su esposo. Viendo la rentabilidad que tiene ha decidido continuar con su negocio y ahora tiene planes de abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos para motos ya que su esposo es mecánico. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido de contar con el apoyo financiero para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en compra de repuestos de motores para la venta, donde su tendría el apoyo de su esposo en la venta.
texts.en:
Lleny, 34, is a hardworking, dedicated woman besides having a strong desire to make progress.  She’s married to Fernando who is a mechanic and they have three children who are 12, 8 and 2 years old who she loves very much.  They live comfortably in their own house.

Lleny’s activity is selling various brands and models of high-quality women’s girdles that she buys in the city of Lima where she has an aunt that sends her the products she orders.  She sells them among her coworkers; she’s a teacher and is still practicing her profession, but she’s been selling these products for three years.  She sells on credit collecting every 30 days.  She likes her work because it produces extra income in addition to her salary because often she did not earn enough to cover all her expenses even though she shares them with her husband.  Seeing the profitability she has, she’s decided to continue with her business and now plans to open a motorcycle spare parts shop since her husband’s a mechanic.

This will be MFP loan #2 and she feels grateful to have financial support to reach her goals.  She also feels comfortable in her communal bank because she believes that its members are responsible people.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell where her husband will help her with the sales.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Honou

texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Togoville, Mrs. A. Honou has been selling cowry (shells) for over 10 years. She studied in Ghana and speaks English very well. She is a mother of four (04) children. She divorced 5 years ago and has to take care of the children alone. She thus spread into pearls, an activity which she has mastered and manages with rigor. She currently has a large customer base, which she finds it difficult satisfying owing to lack of substantial capital. Thus she requested a credit of $750 to buy a supply of pearl and constitute a secure stock for the end of year. As her activities increase, she will generate enough revenue to take care of her children.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC

Née en 1970 à Togoville, Madame A. Hanou exerce le commerce de cauris depuis 10 ans. Elle a fait ses études au Ghana et elle parle bien l’anglais. Elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Divorcé avec son mari, il y a 5 ans de cela, elle dût prendre toutes ses charges et celles de ses enfants. Elle s’est lancée alors dans le commerce de perles dont elle a la maîtrise et gère avec rigueur. Elle dispose aujourd’hui d’une clientèle assez importante qu’elle n’arrive pas satisfaire pour insuffisance de fonds de roulement. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $750 pour s’approvisionner en perles et constituer un stock sécurisant pour ces fêtes de fin d’année. Avec l’augmentation de ses activités, elle pourra dégager un revenu adéquat lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy a supply of pearl and constitute a secure stock

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina A. is 42 years old and married with eight (8) children. She operates her restaurant and catering business in the ancient city of Benin City in Nigeria. She is a reliable client of LAPO who started her business in the year 1983. The loan will enable her to improve on her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and catering items

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has 12 years experience of selling gas for domestic use. She began thanks to the help of her ex-husband who lent her the money with which she bought 10 gas cylinders. Little by little her capital has grown and she now has 110 gas cylinders. She works 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, from 8am until 8pm. After this her brother is in charge of minding the site and she pays him for his help: in this way she is helping to provide employment.

Patricia would like this loan so she can invest in purchasing more gas cylinders. Demand is growing and is providing a good income.

Patricia is 38 years old and has two daughters. Currently her business site is rented. Her current husband has a small car he uses to work at night. With their savings they hope to renovate the site in order to provide a better service for their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia tiene una experiencia de 12 años con el servicio de venta de gas de uso domésticos. Se inicio gracias ha la ayuda de su ex esposo el cual le presto un dinero con el que compro 10 cilindros de gas Poco a poco fue haciendo su capital y ha logrado crecer. Actualmente cuenta con 110 cilindros de gas. Trabaja 12 horas del día todos los días de la semana desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. Luego del cual su hermano se encarga de atender el local. Ella le paga por su atención. De esta manera esta ayudando con una fuente de trabajo.

Patricia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de mas cilindros de gas. Su demanda va en aumento y le esta dando buenos ingresos.

Patricia tiene 38 años y dos hijas. Actualmente el local donde tiene su negocio es arrendado. Su actual esposo tiene un carrito el cual lo trabaja por las noches. Con sus ahorros piensan en adecuar el local y darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy more gas cylinders

loans.name: Albino Pinto

texts.pt:
Albino Pinto M. was born in 1964. He is a native of Chiure, Cabo Delgado province. He is a son of fieldworkers, and he is a father of 2 children. He attended school until the 7th grade and was recruited to obligatory military service. He transfered to the city of Maputo where he continued his studies until the third year of Comercial school and obtained a house. In 2000 he sold his house and moved to the Bagamoyo village where he resides until this day. With the money from the sale of his house, he built another house and developed his water business. The architect's miscalculations of the structure caused the water tanks to collapse, and Albino lost his investment. Still, he continued with his project, and with the help of some friends, he was able to purchase a new water tank. He also came to know Hluvuku and asked him for a loan, increasing the number of tanks to two. With his second loan he purchased a pump with greater capacity and increased the number of tanks by one, subsequently increasing the number of customers. With the current loan of 1,200 dollars he intends to purchase more tanks and tubes.

He services 91 clients with fixed contracts, and another 300 people benefit from his business. He hopes to invest in other villages where the community suffers from diverse sicknesses due to a lack of natural water. This business helps him support the six people who are his responsibility. He pays the salaries of 2 workers, and helps support the reduction in the country's unemployment rate.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Albino Pinto M., nascido em 1964, natural de Chiure Província de Cabo Delgado, filho de Pais camponeses, pai de 2 filhos estudou ate sétima classe e foi recrutado para servico militar obrigatorio, tendo sido transferido para Cidade de Maputo onde veio continuar com os estudos até terceiro ano Comercial e adquiriu uma casa por alienação. Em 2000 vendeu a casa e mudou-se para o Bairro de Bagamoyo onde reside até então. Com o dinheiro da venda de casa construiu outra e com o valor remanescente dicidiu abrir um furo de água para fazer face a escassez de água potável que se atravessa naquele bairro. O mau cálculo da estrutura por parte do técnico causou o desabamento dos tanques e perda do investimento aplicado. Mesmo assim continuou com seu projecto e com ajuda de alguns amigos conseguiu comprar um outro tanque retomando a actividade. Através de colegas conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema tendo recorrido a um empréstimo de 25.000,00mt e aumentou para 2 o numero de tanques de abastecimento. Com o segundo empréstimo de 42.000,00mt comprou uma bomba com maior capacidade e aumentou mais um tanque e consequentimente o numero de clientes. Com o empréstimo de 30.000,00MT pretende comprar mais tanques e tubos para alastrar cada vez mais a sua rede, visto que a procura deste precioso líquido é cada vez maior.

Conta actualmente com 91 clientes com contractos fixos e com cerca de 300 que se abastecem directamente das fontanárias instaladas em sua residência. Tem como perspectiva investir noutros bairros onde o as comunidade sofrem devido a falta de água potável. O seu projecto é de vital importância pois abastece a comunidade em água potável evitado de certa forma várias doenças de natureza hídrica , resultante da falta de água potável e/ou consumo de água imprópria, por outro lado incurta as distãncias para aquisição deste precioso líquido. Na sua vida pessoal este projecto incrementa a renda ajudando-lhe a sustentar 6 pessoas que estão na sua responsabilidade e para além de pagar salários a 2 (dois) trabalhadores que emprega ate então, participando deste modo para a redução do elevado índice de desemprego que assola o país.

loans.use: To buy pipes for his water business

loans.name: Zulaihon

texts.en: Zulaihon Mamadjonova has been running a business with her sister for over 5 years. She is married and has 3 children. Their business is located in the wholesale market Atushbazaar, in Khujand. Together, they rent one container and display their goods there. They sell slippers, plimsolls and galoshes for all ages. They buy their goods from Istaravshan and bring them in bags; one batch of shoes consists of approximately 100-400 pairs. Presently demand for plimsols and galoshes in Tadjikistan is very high; therefore people from neighboring districts come to Atushbazaar to purchase them. Zulaihon wants to purchase some more inventory and is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for business expansion

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti M. is resident of Dholko and lives with her husband and son. Dholko is located in Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this town are engaged in business.
Her husband, Mr. Monaj M., works in a private office. Her son is studying in grade 11. Only the income of her husband is not enough to run the household expenses. So, a year ago Mrs. M. opened a cosmetic shop. She sells different types of cosmetic goods like creams, powders, oils and glass bangles in her shop. Now she seeks a Rs10,000 (US$175) loan to buy cosmetic goods, because demand for cosmetic goods are increasing in that area.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic goods

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza M. lives in Khujand; she is married and has one child.  She has been an active and serious client of MicroInvest since 2006, and because of her credit history she is now eligible for larger loans. She works in the joint-stock company “Navbakhor” making winter wear.  Firuza M. has a side business in embrodiery. She uses regional motifs and brightly colored thread in her embroidery, which make her needlework unique and eye-catching. Mrs M. is asking for a loan of $450 to purchase special brightly colored embroidery thread.

loans.use: To buy embroidery thread

loans.name: Kito A Group

texts.en: Edith S. is married and has six children. She runs a small appliance-repair shop, and has joined with a group of her friends to apply for a loan to expand the business. With the extra income made possible by this expansion, she would like to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To expand a small appliance-repair business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Alberto A. M. was born in the Boane, a province in Maputo in 1980. He is 27 years old. He lives with his parents and his brothers. He attended night school until the 9th grade, but because of the violence in the neighborhood he stopped going. He married when he was 25, he has a 4 month old son.

He started working providing construction material to the Education ministry. Today he has a business in the Agrarian Investigation Institute in Boane. He is also building another business in Boane block 2. Alberto’s business employs 2 people. Alberto has been working for the government for 1 year and 8 months as an agricultural technician. He was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by friends. His first loan was of 10.000mt. Alberto is requesting a loan of 25.000mt to finance his business. For him this credit is direct way to grow his business. In the future he plans to build a home of his own.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 7 Cliente: Alberto A. M. Actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 16.000,00mt ( 677 USD ) Aplicação: Compra de material de construção para venda Inicio:28-01-08 Fim: 22-05-09 Alberto A. M. , nasceu em Boane Província de Maputo em 1980, tem actualmente 27 anos de idade . Vive ate então num ambiente familiar com os pais e os irmãos mas numa casa própria, Estudou ate a 9ª classe, devido muita violência na vila de Boane viu se com necessidade de ter que parar de ir a escola. Pôs frequentava o curso nocturno. Aos 25 anos de idade casou se e tem, actualmente, um filho de 4 meses. Começou esta actividade ha muito tempo fornecendo material de construção ao Ministério de Educação. Actualmente tem o seu estabelecimento no “INSTITUTO DE INVESTIGACAO AGRARIA de Boane , Mas esta a construir um outro estabelecimento na zona de Bloco 2 em Boane e conta com 2 empregados. Ė Funcionário Publico ha 1ano e 8 meses, com categoria de técnico de agricultura.

Já trabalhou numa instituição de crédito na zona de Dlhanguene na cidade de Maputo. Conhece a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA durante uma conversa com alguns amigos tendo aproximado e solicitado um credito no valor de 10.000,00MT para o comércio. Desta vez solicita outro empréstimo no valor de 25.000,00Mt Para ele, o credito é a forma correcta e directa de dinamizar desenvolvimento. Tem como perspectivas de ter uma casa condigna fora do recinto da casa dos pais.

loans.use: To buy stock to increase his business

loans.name: Gulam Naqashband

texts.en: Gulam Naqashband lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the father of 3 sons, and all his sons are outside of Afghanistan. He is supporting himself and his wife. He has a small business growing crops. He has good experience since he has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Still he is supporting his family, and now he wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan so that he can work hard and cultivate all his land to make good income to help his family.

loans.use: To expand his little farming business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. lives in her local community in Igbaye Lagos State Nigeria. At 38 years of age, with 4 children, she has the goal of pulling her family above poverty. As a petty trader she travels to main Lagos where she buy shoes, clothes, plastic rubber and baby items that she sell in her community. Gladys has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years and she has being in her business since the year 2000. She requests the sum of $875 to enable her to buy more shoes, clothes, baby items and plastic rubbers for her business which will be able to serve her customers better

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Cobbina Ato

texts.en: Cobbina Ato A., who is married with no children, is an electrician. His repair and phone sales business is doing well, but he wishes to increase sales. Cobbina Ato is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more equipment to facilitate his repair work and to sell more phones.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to facilitate repair work

loans.name: Sady

texts.en:
Mrs. Sady U., 58, is a widow with five children and lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Of the other four children, two weave silk at home, one is a construction worker, and the other one attends a local school.

Mrs. Sady has been a silk weaver since 1965, having acquired the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora is a seamstress with 30 years of experience. From a young age, she learned how to sew in order to help support her family. Over time and after seeing the need to be independent and form her own family, Pastora decided to invest her savings in the purchase of the equipment she needed to become a seamstress. Pastora is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. Her husband is retired, so he receives a pension with which he helps his wife cover the household expenses.

Pastora currently lives alone with her husband, which is why she would like to improve her house in order to spend a peaceful old age with her husband. For the moment, however, she wants to focus all her efforts on setting up a clothing factory, which is why she is requesting a loan in order to purchase fabric and continue offering her customers a variety of styles and colors.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Pastora es una costurera con 30 años de experiencia. Desde muy joven aprendió a hacer costuras para ayudar a mantener a su familia, pero con el tiempo y en vista de la necesidad de independizarse y formar su propia familia Pastora decidió invertir sus ahorros en compra de accesorios para poder desempeñarse como costurera. Pastora tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada, su esposo es mayor de edad, recibe una pensión y le ayuda a su esposa con los gastos del hogar.

Actualmente Pastora vive sola con su marido, es por eso que desea poder darle condiciones a su casa para poder pasar junto a su esposo una vejez tranquila. Pero por el momento se dedicará a enfocar su esfuerzo en llegar a poner un taller de confecciones, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para poder adquirir telas para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes variedad de estilos y colores.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income as a carpenter is not sufficient for Patience and her five children. Demand for fish is good, and she is requesting a loan to increase her stock and her sales.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living there for 20 years. She has five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a tailor by profession. The next two sons work in a factory. Her youngest son is in the 5th standard. Her daughter is in the 3rd standard. Parveen baji's husband works in a gas station. Parveen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her eldest son.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Akhtari baji and Rukhsana baji each want a loan to buy bricks from wholesaler to resell. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Safia baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, clothes, sketches) to make decorative embroidered dresses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor J. is 48 years old. She lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, and she is engaged in the commercial service and trade business. More specifically, she trades clothing for children, small wares, and toys. Moreover, she trades such goods in the local bazaar, where her trade outlet is located.

Thanks to the previous loan she was able to secure and successfully repay, she was able to improve her business by purchasing additional goods to later sell. Now, Gulbahor is requesting a business development loan through Kiva in the amount of 2,800 STJ ($825) for 6 months in order to import new seasonal clothing for children.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing new seasonal clothing for children

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga inicio su negocio hace 3 años empezó con la venta de sartenes industriales para la elaboración de comidas, debido a que la situación económica en su casa era muy precaria ya que su marido gana el salario mínimo y no pueden solventar solo todos los gastos y ella desea darle educación a su hijo para que en un futuro sea una persona preparada.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Olga started her business three years ago. She started with the sale of industrial frying pans for making food, owing to the economic situation in her house it was very precarious, since her husband makes minimum wage and they cannot meet all of their expenses and she wants to give her son an education so that in the future he is a prepared person.

She needs a loan of $375 which she will repay in six months to buy merchandise and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Sol Radiante (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is 39 years old and married with three children. She sells women’s and children’s clothing by special order to her friends and acquaintances, and has been in this line of work for many years.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of $500 (1500 soles) to travel to Lima to buy more clothing to fill her orders. Elizabeth has been a client of FINCA Peru for the past eight years. Her goal for the future is to open her own store to sell new, fashionable clothes as well as a variety of other items.

loans.use: Buy women's and children's clothing to fill custom orders

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena Q. sells food items like rice, cooking oil, sugar, and other items at Atonkwa near Elmina. Helena has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a trader.

Helena has been selling food items since 2000. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy additional capital for her food for her shop for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy as an additional capital to buy more food stuff and groceries into her shop for resale.

loans.name: Proem

texts.en:
Proem S., 44, lives Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling groceries from her house, selling items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has run this business for a long time. S. is married and currently takes care of two children; both of them are single and are employed. Her husband, Sout Shi, is aged 46, and he sells used clothes in Psakraom Market.

S. works hard every day and is very responsible for her family. The grocery business is S.'s main way of earning an income to support her family. She requests a loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With some of the loan, she plans to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for the family's transportation.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana se dedica a dos labores una de ellas, la repostería, distribuyendo sus productos en las tiendas y colegios de la zona, y paralelamente es propietaria de un centro de llamadas telefónicas y servicio de fotocopias ubicado en la zona de alto obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz, frente a la normal de estudiantes. La señora vive con su hija quien estudia en la universidad y a la cual debe sustentar sus estudios ya que su esposo se encuentra de viaje.
Doña Juana invertirá el préstamo en la compra de material para su negocio hojas y material de escritorio para el centro de llamadas y harina para la elaboración de masitas ya que empieza el periodo escolar.
texts.en:
Juana has two businesses. One is a bakery, which distributes baked goods to the stores and schools in her area, the other is a telephone center and photocopy service located in the Alto Obrajes zone of La Paz city, across from the teacher training college. She lives with her daughter, who studies at the university. Juana is supporting her daughter while her daughter's husband is away. In preparation for the school year Juana will invest the loan in paper and office supplies for the telephone center and flour for pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha  es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Bertha es casada, tiene 53 años y 7 hijos, Bertha vende pescado de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos con la ayuda de sus hijas.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado jurel.
Los sueños de Bertha son techar el primer piso de su casa con material noble e implementar una tienda.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the "Tarpuy" Communal Bank which means "Sowing" in the Quechua language.

Bertha is married, is 53 years old, and has 7 children. She peddles fish in the Nery García, an activity that she carries out on Saturdays and Sundays with the help of her daughters.

Bertha needs a loan of $625 which she will invest in the purchase of mackerel.

Bertha's dream is to roof the second floor of her house with high quality material and to open a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mackerel for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina A. is a Tanzanian small businesswoman with four school-aged children. She runs a clothing shop and also sells fresh fish. She purchases the clothing from shops in Kariakoo city business center, and sells them retail to customers at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She also run a business of selling fresh fish to customers. She purchases direct from fishermen and stores it in a deep freezer waiting for customers. She has been in business for three years and has managed to employ two workers who help her to run the business. She needs a loan of Tshs800,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand business.

loans.name: Nurjon

texts.ru: Нурчон  молодой человек 23 лет, не женат. Проживает в районе Уткансой. Живёт он вместе с родителями. С детства он помогал по уходу за скотом своему отцу, а теперь занимается самостоятельно. В прошлом году он был на заработках в России. Но с наступлением кризиса, его сократили с работы. Приехав домой , он начал свой давнишний бизнес, куплю и продажу скота. Также, он приехав в город работает разнорабочим. Друзья Нурчона посоветовали ему в кредит увеличить скот, пока он дешёвый на рынке. Для чего Нурчон и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Nurjon is a young 23 year old man, he is not married. Nurjon lives in the Utkansoi region. He lives with his parents. Since childhood he has helped his father tend the livestock and now he does this by himself. Last year he was a migrant worker in Russia, but with the start of the crisis he was laid off. After returning home he started his old business – the purchase and sale of livestock. Also, he goes to the city and works as a laborer. Nurjon’s friends suggested that he take out a loan to increase his livestock count, while the livestock is cheap at the market. This is why he has turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Khouder

texts.en:
Khouder is a 19-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon. Khouder owns a barber shop. Khouder requested a loan of 700 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his salon. This is the first time that Khouder has requested a loan.

Khouder is speciA. in his work because he does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khouder decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his salon.

loans.use: purchase tools for his salon

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia F. owns a small parcel of land. She is a 48-year-old mother of four children. She wants to grow her business even more. Her husband, Danilo F., is the one managing their farm. Their harvest is what they use for family consumption and to pay for the needs of their family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers. She thinks that by doing so, she can be able to improve her harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to poor Filipino families. Your help could really make a difference in uplifting lives. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro vive en alquiler en la calle Francisco Bedregal de la zona de Ciudadela ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz; está separado de la esposa;  tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte publico en una compañía de radio taxi de la zona sur y con esta actividad  cubre sus necesidades de alimentación y ropa. El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de mantenimiento del auto y poder mantener su fuente de trabajo.

No es cliente antiguo de Impro, pero califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Genaro lives in a rental on Francisco Bedregal Street in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He is separated from his spouse. He has a car with which he works providing public transport on the south side for a radio taxi company. With this activity he is able to cover the basic necessities of food and clothing. The loan he is requesting is to pay the cost of maintenance for the auto and be able to preserve his source of work. He is not an established client of IMPRO but he does qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. owns and operates a sari-sari or general store selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She is 51 years old, married and has seven adult children. She is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Merlyn has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 33 years old. She is divorced, and a mother with two children. Both of her children are in school in the community where they live. She lives with the children at Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana. Faustina works hard to provide food and school fees for the children as a single parent. She is a baker who uses flour for her production. She has been a baker for twelve years now, in spite of the challenges she faces. She prepares pastries like cake, meat pie, chips, etc., and sells them to her customers. She sells them to her customers by herself, in the market center. People also come to her to buy these goods. Her only problem now has to do with a lack of adequate funds to buy raw materials, as prices are going up. She requests this loan support in order to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family, and most importantly, the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is the owner of CineCipher, a multi-media videography company located in the San Francisco Bay Area. He works with small businesses and non-profits to help them tell their stories.

Michael loves owning his own business, but ever-changing developments in technology mean he needs to undertake significant expense to remain competitive.  This loan will allow Michael to upgrade his equipment and software and will help to increase his number of clients and the services that CineCipher is able to provide.

loans.use: Upgrade equipment and software

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
"My sari-sari store income averagely reaches upto 400 to 700 per day while my Cassava plantation, incomed Php 84,000  a month. I have been doing these for 2 years already. These what I use to provide the needs of my family", says Elna G., 52 year old 

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase purchase fertilizers and chemicals to grow her crop.

She joined CEVI last March 2008. She said " CEVI services is very helpful for us farmers especially that they are only asking the lowest interest rate of 2% a month".

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Alex David

texts.en:
Alex is a member of the Hope village bank. Alex is married and has one son who is 10 years-old and goes to school at the local public school. His wife is pregnant and is expecting soon. 
After Alex finished school, he served obligatory military service for two years and then began working because his family needed more money. He worked for out of his home for a while but decided to stop because it did not pay enough. With his savings he bought a car and uses it as a taxi service. Alex says since he joined FINCA it has been a great help to him because they lend him money when his taxi needs repairs. 
Alex needs a loan of 1000 soles for maintenance work on his car in order to continue his taxi service. His dream is to buy and sell used cars. Alex is dedicated to his dream and has already started saving.

loans.use: maintenance work on his car in order to continue his taxi service

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
Help Yourself is a group of 4 borrowers led by Frances W. T., 38 years old, married with 4 children aged 4-10 years. Frances also  cares for 2 siblings. She‘s a 10th grade drop-out due to poverty.
Frances lives and sells in the Fiamah residence south of the capital Monrovia,Liberia, a very crowded community that lacks both water and electricity because people in that community can’t afford them.

Frances’ business is purchasing charcoal wholesale then sells it retail. She also does tailoring.
She is a good tailor. She does good designs and she has plenty of customers who come to patronize her tailoring business. Frances  sells good charcoal to her neighbors; it encourages them to always want to buy from her.
She has been in business for more than 6 years and is hoping to expand. She is asking for this loan to purchase more charcoal wholesale to acquire more profit, because after purchasing more charcoal and expanding her business, she hopes to realize more profit.
Frances dreams of one day building a nice house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal wholesale to acquire more profit.

loans.name: Afaq

texts.en:
Afaq H. is 35 years old. She is married and has three children.

Since she has lived with her husband, Afaq has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and sheep. She usually purchases cattle and sheep at the weekly bazaar which is held in a nearby village, buying at the lowest price so as to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows.

Now, Afaq wants to expand her business. Because her children are grown, she thinks that, with their help, she will be able to look after more cattle and sheep. She is asking for a loan of 1607 AZN to purchase young cattle and sheep. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle and sheep

loans.name: Naqeeb Group

texts.en:
Naqeeb is the group leader of the three-member Naqeeb group. Each member wants to take a loan for expanding their business.

Naqeeb wants to take a loan for his building supplies business.

Salia wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a general store.

Bulqes wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

They are requesting a group of loan of 30,000 AFN, and they are appreciative of the process by which loans are made available.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Pun

texts.en:
Pun S. is 53 years old and lives in the Battambang province with her husband and three of her children.

She is a farmer who typically makes about US $2 in profit every day and her husband is a taxi driver who makes US $4 each day. This couple is also aided by two children, one a construction worker and the other a taxi driver.

Pun S. requests a loan of US $500 so she can purchase a hand tractor and a trailer to transport rice.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor.

loans.name: Kasanda

texts.en:
Kasanda M. is an entrepreneur and a married Tanzanian businessman with one primary school child. He runs a barber shop at Buguruni District in Dar es Salaam.

Business requirements are purchased from the wholesale cosmetics shop at Kariakoo city business shopping center. Kasanda has been in the business for three years and his business income is used to capitalize his business and meet his family’s daily needs.

Kasanda is requesting a loan of Tsh 800,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Senbi

texts.en:
Senbi H. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Olgii province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Two of his children go to local secondary schools, and his two youngest children go to a local kindergarten. Senbi has a small business in meat retail. He rents a small stall at the local food market and sells mainly mutton and beef there. He mostly purchases cattle and sheep from local herders at wholesale prices and slaughters them for sale. As he has been in the business for a few years, he has gained a good network of people in the local meat retail business, which helps him a lot to do well.

Senbi says that in the future, he would like to expand his business and own an underground storage where he would like to keep the meat until the meat price spikes up. He requests a loan to purchase more cattle and sheep for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle and sheep

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en: Arcily P. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and is married. Arcily owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Arcily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta R. is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Alberta is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Alberta owns & operates a business venture providing motor services to local community members. Alberta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Alberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Alberta is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Alberta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess N. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Paraiso Brgy Hilamonan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in food vending. Princess's husband, Jonathan, earns his income by buying and selling household and car tools. They have four children who are between 7 and 15 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Princess N. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the food-vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos from her business activities. Princess N. is a member in good standing of NWTF-Project Dungganon, a Kiva partner. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her food-vending business. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing for her 17th loan the amount of Php 15,000, which she intends to use for her food-vending business. Princess N. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital and to finance her husband's business

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice C. is a 37-year-old married mother of two children who live in Kwirare Busia District. 
She used to do subsistence farming but changed to fish vending in 2006 to boost her income.
With a plan of better education for her children, Loice wants to expand her business by increasing her stock to ensure economic stability for her family. It is for this reason she wants a loan of Ksh.10,000 to be able to achieve this.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Gabril Gertrudis

texts.es: Gabriel Gertrudis tiene 57 años, por lo que este hombre tiene más de 5 créditos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que está muy agradecido por la confianza brindada con este financiamiento. Don Gabriel se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de restaurante, por lo que siempre su establecimiento se mantiene con ciertos clientes. Hace más de 16 años que tiene esta actividad, por lo que tiene una gran experiencia a pesar de tener mucha competencia ningún otro establecimiento ofrece  su carisma. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como verduras, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, carnes y comprar ciertas sillas y mesas. Su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de este trabajo.
texts.en:
Gabriel Gertrudis, 57, has had over 5 loans with Fundación León 2000, for which he is very grateful. Gabriel has a restaurant that is supported by regular customers. He has been in this line of work for over 16 years so he has a lot of experience. Despite a lot of competition, no other establishment offers his particular charisma. He is asking for funding to buy raw materials like: vegetables, basic grains, juices, soft-drinks, meats. He also wants to buy tables and chairs. His wish is to improve his living conditions through this work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 33 years old and is married with three children. She is into the sewing of clothes and sales of tailoring materials. She makes different styles for her costumers. With the profit from the business, she assists her husband in taking good care of her family.

Lucy hopes to expand her business by buying more tailoring materials to sell. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: God's Children Group

texts.en:
Patrick K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Children. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are 3 and 11 years old.

For five years, Patrick has been selling DVDs in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He says that his business is conveniently located, which appeals to customers.

Patrick plans to use his portion of the group loan to buy more DVDs. His dream is to improve his standard of living.

In the photo Patrick is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women. 

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Cesar de 30 años, quien trabaja con ella en la chacra, ambos tienen tres hijos, de las cuales procura brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Es así que trabaja arduamente, todos los días en sus cultivos, Nancy trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, es por eso que siembra semestralmente, con ayuda de su esposo,  habas, papas y arvejas, productos que logra venderlos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, por lo que lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado para comercializarlos, puesto que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Por el momento, solo espera mejorar su producción y así obtener mejores precios. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y asegura que este aporte le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los dos mil soles que  solicita, comprará 3 sacos de semillas de arveja, siendo un producto muy caro.
texts.en:
Nancy, 25, is a cheerful, hard-working young mother; she lives in her own house with her husband, Cesar, 30, who works the fields alongside her, and their three children for whom she hopes to provide a better quality of life. This is the reason behind her daily hard work in the fields. Nancy is trying to change her life for the better. She and her husband plant twice a year: broad beans, potatoes and peas, products that she sells in Tarma’s wholesale market because profits are highest there. What she likes best about her work is to keep her crops pest-free. She has been in this line of work for 7 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be transporting her product to market because the sacks are very heavy. She is hoping to improve production to obtain better prices. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she assures us that this funding will be very helpful for her to grow as a farmer. She is very participatory and cooperative with her communal group. She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy 3 sacks of pea seed, which is a very expensive product.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three sacks of pea seed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with children and all her children are going to school. She stays in Bwaise Lufula Zone, Kawempe Division, Kampala District. Grace takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a three roomed house where she stays with additional family members. Grace has opeartes a school canteen and also works as a clerk at the school. She has been in this business for a short period  and works seven days a week. Grace iniataily  had a retail shop but changed her enterprise to a canteen at a nearby school. The family has access to electricity and piped water. She wants to use this loan to buy more bread, cakes, donuts, mineral water and other eatables for the canteen. Grace’s monthly expenses include school fees and food. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and own another plot of land.

loans.use: To buy bread (buns), cakes, donuts, mineral water and juices for the canteen

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es: Julia Narda tiene la edad de 60 años. Ella se dedica a vender cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella dio inicio con esfuerzos propios inicio con ciertos productos que le fueron otorgados con muy pocos productos, pues siempre le ha gustado interactuar con sus clientes. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. siempre sueña con tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Julia Narda is 60 years old and dedicates herself to selling cosmetics. She has been in this line of business for more than 11 years, because she has always liked to work. She launched her business through her own efforts, with just a few products that were granted to her. She has always enjoyed interacting with her customers. She is requesting this loan to use as working capital, so she can buy additional materials. She has always dreamed of having her own store location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto P. es padre de familia de 4 pequeños a los cuales quieres ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. En esto momento el se acerca a esta institución para que se le apoye en su nuevo proyecto; pues el desea colocar piso cerámico en su vivienda ya que el que tiene es de cemento. Mario es un hombre trabajador pues con este nuevo préstamo serán varios para el apoyo a la mejora de vivienda donde el agradece el apoyo brindado ya que sin esto el no lo podría realizar.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto P. is father to four little ones to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. He has called upon this institution to seek help for a new project: he wants to install ceramic tile flooring in his home because the current floor is cement. Mario is a hard-working man; he has had several loans prior to this one that he used to make home improvements. He is grateful for the help because without it he would not have been able to do them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install ceramic tile flooring.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: El solicitante vive junto con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, posse casa propia que es un modulo donado por la parroquia. Es chofer trabaja en carro alquilado recibe ingresos diarios su esposa trabaja por campañas en fundos de esparragos; actualmente tiene una bebita lo cual no le permite trabajar en los fundos. Solcita el credito para invertir en un negocio de venta de hamburguesas y venta de comida
texts.en:
The borrower lives with his wife and their three children. He has his own house, a unit donated by the church. He is a taxi operator and works in a rented car. He earns a daily income. His wife works for an asparagus farm, but currently has a little baby and is unable to work in the fields. He is asking for a loan to invest in a business that sells hamburgers and food.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus M. is a married man with a year old child. He rents a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and house rent. Chrispinus has been operating his mobile banking business for the last two years. He sells retail to Safaricom Mobile subscribers. He earns his other source of income from his side job working as a house agent. Chrispinus faces the major challenge of theft. He hopes to open another retail shop in the  future. His main aim in working with Yehu is to get a loan to expand his business. 

M-Pesa is a completely electronic banking service (no buildings) that lets average people do banking by mobile phone. They also provide loans. M-pesa has transformed the lives of Kenyans and the role of mobile phones in remittances and money circulation. M-Pesa is a joint venture between Vodafone and Safaricom (the local mobile operator ) with the backing of Citibank and Commercial Bank of Africa. M-PESA allows users to make four basic types of transactions i.e transfer from person to person, transfers from individuals to businesses, cash withdrawals at designated outlets with a profit and loan receipt or repayment.

loans.use: To increase the funds available to lend to his customers.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one son. She also takes care of her elderly parents and helps them with what they need.

Svetlana sells food at a market that is located close to a railway station. She has been in this business for 13 years. Her income is 3,500 UAH per month.

Svetlana is a very open, enthusiastic and responsible person. She has used small business loans several times and always paid them back on time. This time, Svetlana would like to obtain a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to sell more and generate additional income.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory

loans.name: Alima Mohammed

texts.en:
Alima has operated her grocery shop for five years, selling fruits and vegetables to her neighbors.  She is 47 years old, married to Alio Edin, and they have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid her previous loans well and on time, 10,000 KES and 20,000 KES respectively.  

She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her shop, and include other retail products like sugar, maize and wheat flour, milk, detergents and cereals.

loans.use: To expand her shop and add stock of cereals, maize flour, sugar and detergents to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sinerth Khon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is made up of nineteen people who live in Ta Non village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sinerth K. is the village bank president, born in 1984 and selected by the other members who will each use portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living conditions. She and her husband, Mr. Ret Ry, are farmers who own a very small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family; moreover, Mrs. Sinerth K. is a weaver. Since her weaving is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her current business, Mrs. Sinerth K. is asking for a loan to buy more silk. She is a mother of one child who is six years old.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Dina Margod

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina Margot; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de calzados y también se dedica a realizar bordados y tejidos que luego los vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio de venta de calzados y también quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus bordados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer sus bordados.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Dina Margot is a member of the communal bank Virgen del Rosario del Cusco which is located in the Wanchaq district in the Cusco province. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities between her business of selling footwear and embroidery and knitting which she sells independently. She wants to improve her footwear sales business and she also wants to have a store where she can sell her needlework. She is requesting a loan to buy materials to do her needlework. She is grateful to all who are a part of funding this dream and is committed to repaying the loan in the term established.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase needlework materials

loans.name: Maxima Leticia

texts.es: Máxima Leticia Pavón tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos y varios nietos, y reside en Barrio Las Acacias en Juticalpa, Olancho. Máxima posee un puesto de frutas el cual tiene una excelente ubicación ya que está a un costado de la carretera que conduce hacia la Ciudad de Tegucigalpa y esta es muy transitada. En este puesto comercializa todo tipo de frutas, sobre todo aquellas que están de temporada. Inició su negocio hace 14 años con una chiclera y vendía churros, galletas, dulces, etc. pero luego de un tiempo se dio cuenta de que ese tipo de productos no eran atractivos para los transeúntes que pasaban por su puesto así que decidió vender frutas. Con el préstamo comprará una mayor cantidad de frutas como sandias, naranjas y bananos, y así podrá obtener más ganancias que le permitirán llevar el sustento a su familia y cubrir con los gastos escolares de su hijo menor. Una de las dificultades que enfrenta es que uno de sus nietos no camina ni habla y la mayor parte del tiempo tiene que estar hospitalizado y eso le ocasiona grandes gastos. Sus sueños son que la salud de su nieto mejore, tener un establecimiento propio que sea grande y bonito, y tener su propia casa ya que donde reside es alquilado y el pago de la renta mensual es muy caro. Desde hace seis años es clienta de FAMA y con los préstamos obtenidos ha podido superarse y tener una mejor vida económica.
texts.en:
Máxima Leticia Pavón is 46 years old and a single mother. She has five children and various nieces and nephews. She lives in the Las Acacias neighborhood in Juticalpa, Olancho. Máxima has a fruit stand that is located in very busy spot along the side of the road that leads to the city of Tegucigalpa. She sells all types of fruits, primarily those that are in season. She started her business 14 years ago selling candy, churros, cookies, etc., but realized that these types of products were not attractive to the people that passed by her stand. This is what prompted her to start selling fruit. With this loan she will buy a larger quantity of fruit such as watermelons, oranges and bananas. This will allow her to earn more and to continue supporting her family and cover her youngest child's educational expenses. One of the difficulties that she faces is that one of her nephews can't walk or talk and most of the time he is hospitalized. This is very expensive. Her dreams are that her nephew's health improves, to own a large and beautiful store and to own her own house as she is renting and her monthly payment is very expensive. She has been a FAMA client for six years. The loans have enabled her to better herself and to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase watermelons, oranges, bananas and other seasonal fruits

loans.name: Alyiman's Group

texts.en:
Alyiman A. is the leader of this group. She is 59 and a widow.  She is a pensioner and receives 3000 soms per month.  Six years ago, with the initial investment of 25,000 soms, her son started to breed cattle.  Reselling cattle after fattening, he makes 8000 soms per month. Alyiman applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase two tons of coal for heating during the winter season. 

Nurgul C. is the treasurer of the group. She is 37 and married. She has a son and a daughter; both of them are at school.  Nurgul is engaged in cattle raising and her husband works as a private driver.  With money received from the loan, Nurgul wants to purchase coal for heating during the winter season. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle.

Janylkan A., 35, is married. She has three sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not yet.  Janylkan is engaged in cattle raising and her husband works as a firefighter.  With money received from the loan, Janylkan wants to purchase hay for their cattle. 

Kanybek K., 37, is married. He has three sons; two sons are at school and the third son is not yet.  Eight years ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Kanybek and his wife started to breed livestock. With money received from the loan, Kanybek wants to purchase five farm animals for breeding and hay to feed them during the winter season. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase coal for heating during the winter season

loans.name: Trinidad Lisette

texts.es: Trinidad Lisette se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 4 años, que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona responsable que disfruta de realizar este tipo de actividad, pues sabe que tiene que mantener a su familia y sufragar sus gastos. Todos los días se levanta temprano desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, cuando el inicio fue por su esposo, quien le había enseñado este medio de vida, pues actualmente  no tenía un medio de ingreso. Este crédito es para la compra de repuestos y ciertas reparaciones. Sueña con lograr comprarse otro vehículo para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Trinidad Lisettte dedicates herself to providing a taxi service.  She has had the business for more than 4 years.  She is a responsible person who enjoys carrying out this type of activity, since she knows she has to support her family and cover her expenses.  Every day, she rises early at 6 in the morning until 9 at night.  Her husband got her started by showing her this way of making a living when there was no source of income.  This loan is for the purchase of replacement parts and to pay for certain repairs.  She dreams of purchasing another vehicle in order to augment her earnings.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin P. and his wife Mrs. Sokha Born, have been married for more than twenty-two years and have five children--two sons and three daughters. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sarin and his wife are vegetable farmers. He asked for a Kiva loan once already, and he now is asking for his second loan of $1,200 to continue his farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

The couple are both in the picture.

loans.use: buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cayetano lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mayra Molinares Flores quien tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, carne, pollo, jabón, detergentes y chiverías.
La otras integrantes del grupo son Isabel H. tiene una pequeña venta de granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar) y chiverías y Paula María T. se dedica a la venta de tortillas bastimento a base de maíz que no falta en la mesa de los nicaragüenses; ella comercializa este producto en el mercado de Masaya y su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The group Cayetano is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Mayra Molinares Flores; she has a small convenience store. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, meat, chicken, soap, detergents and dairy products.

The other members of the group are Isabel H. who has a small store where she sells basic grains (rice, beans, oil, sugar) and dairy products. Paula María T. sells tortillas made of corn that is never missing from Nicaraguan tables. Paula sells her product on the Masaya market and in her home.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, chicken, meat, soap…etc.

loans.name: Israfil

texts.ru:
Israfil A. 44 qoda. On Jenat on imeyet 3 detey, Dochka 5 let ona xodit v detskiy sadik, sin 3 let i doch 2 let. Israfil i yeqo lubimaya semya jivut v Fuzuli regione.

Israfil uje 13 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Israfil Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Israfil kupiv korovi nadeyetsya uvelichit svoy mesechniy doxod i kolichestvo xorosheqo tovara dlya prodaji. Israfil starayetsya sdelat vse chtobi ulidshit svoy doxod radi svoyey lubimoy jeni i detey dlya ix budusheqo. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Israfil  on ochen blaqodaren lenderam za pervuyu ssudun qde on bral 1200$, Israfil s leqkostyu i bez zaderjik zaplatil vsu ssudu.


http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4557
texts.en:
Israfil A. is 44 years old.  He is married and has three children.  His five-year-old daughter goes to kindergarten.  He also has a three-year-old son and a two-year-old daughter.  Israfil and his beloved family live in the Fuzuli region.

Israfil has been a herdsman for thirteen years.  Right now, Israfil needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand his business.  Israfil hopes that by buying more cows he can increase his monthly income and the quantity of goods he is able to sell.  Israfil is trying to do everything in his power to increase his income for the sake of his much-loved wife and children and their future.  This is Israfil’s second loan.  He is very thankful to the lenders for the first loan in which he borrowed $1200.  Israfil repaid the entire debt easily and in a timely fashion.

Here is a link to his first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4557

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past two years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. Kanga faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco S. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: buying and selling pigs and farming corn and vegetables. She lives in 112, Brgy. Dancalan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her livestock and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Francisco is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can continue to fund the operation of her pig business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Francisco aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her livestock business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay back money I have borrowed from parents to buy house furniture

loans.name: Parkire

texts.en:
Parkire O. is 27 years old, married and supports ten people in the family. Parkire is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land which he has done for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his third loan which he is planning to spend to buy eight bags of Kenya seed-certified wheat and eight bags of fertilizer. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity.

Parkire's dream is to construct rental houses. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: To buy eight bags of Kenya seed-certified wheat and eight bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Banzragch is 33 years old and lives with his mother, wife, and his four children, ages 2 to 15, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.
