His family lives in his mother’s small house, in the outer ger districts of the city. His oldest son and daughter attend school, while his mother is retired and always cares for his youngest son and daughter, ages 2 and 4. His wife is an entrepreneur, and she supports her family by operating her fruit retail stall at Kharhorin, one of Mongolia's largest markets.    

Banzragch has been supporting his family by operating a taxi business for the past two years. In 2009, he started his taxi business using a car that he bought used. So his first car often broke down. During the past two years, he has been able to gradually improve his living conditions and has gained a lot of experience. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another secondhand car, due to safety regulations for transportation. He is requesting a 3,500,000-MNT loan to purchase the secondhand car. 

His goal is to improve his living conditions by building his own small house, and then he wants a happy life with his family.

loans.use: To purchase the secondhand car

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam B. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Zam has a medical clinic, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase medicine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zam hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Zam hopes to own a small cosmetics shop.  

Zam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving more on her business and now that she has enough capital and also getting also new friends.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for resale

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is a twenty-four-year-old married woman with two children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with an aspiration of building a permanent house in the next five years. For twelve years she has been operating a retail shop with which she started with 200,000/= and now her business is worth 3,000,000. She has challenges in price fluctuations and her desire is to own a wholesale shop. Veneranda needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz Marina Martínez tiene un negocio de ferretería, donde vende alambre dulce carretes, cabuya de manilas, clavos, tornillos, pegantes, pinturas en aerosol, puntillas, soportes, bombillos empaques de tuberías sanitarias, roscas, cintas, y en general repuestos para tuberías domiciliarias, eléctricas y en PVC. Ella inició su microempresas al que llamó  “Depósito Surtimar”, una vez quedó sin trabajo en un negocio similar del cual adquirió su experiencia y con  la indemnización  recibida desarrolló su idea emprendedora, para fortalecer su ingreso familiar y generar su propio empleo. Con este negocio ha crecido como persona y también en el ámbito empresarial, su sueño es consolidarla y convertirla en una gran empresa con varios puntos de atención y por eso está aplicando a un crédito de capital de trabajo en cual invertirá en la compra de repuestos eléctricos y tuberías sanitarias, así como en tornillos, tuercas, clavos, bombillos en mayor cantidad de lo que está acostumbrada a hacerlo, con ello  empezará la construcción de su propósito
texts.en:
Luz Marina Martínez has a hardware business where she sells reels of soft wire, manila rope, nails, screws, adhesives, aerosol paints, small nails, brackets, lightbulbs, seals for bathroom pipes, bolts, tape and general spare parts for domestic, electrical and PVC piping.

Luz started her small business called "Depósito Surtimar" when she found herself out of work from a similar business where she gained her experience.  She used her severance pay to develop her entrepreneurial idea, strengthen her family income and create a job for herself.  Through her business, Luz has grown as a person and also as a businesswoman.  Her dream is to consolidate her business and to turn it into a large company with several sales outlets.  For this reason, she is applying for a loan to use as working capital.  She will invest the loan in buying electrical spare parts and bathroom plumbing supplies, as well as screws, nuts, nails and lightbulbs, in larger quantities than she is used to doing.  In this way she will start constructing her plan.

loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts and bathroom plumbing supplies, as well as screws, nuts, nails and lightbulbs in larger quantities

loans.name: Alboradda Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ALBORADA esta ubicado en Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado  por diez personas y es la cuarta ocasión que solicitan un prestamo. La foto fue tomada en la casa D. la señora NARCIZA G. A., integrante del grupo, tiene 41 años D. edad, estudio solamente la primaria, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas D. maíz, tiene en total 3 hijos varones. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar más maíz y refresco ya que sus ventas están creciendo y sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos, elL. la prefieren ya que su trato es muy amable. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo ella se siente muy contenta. Sus ganancias las ocupara para que a uno D. sus hijos lo lleve a tomar unas terapias ya que es un niño discapacitado, y así mas adelante pueda desenvolverse por si solo. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Josefina R..
texts.en:
This group is called ALBORADA and it is located in Puebla, Mexico.  The group has ten members and this is the fourth time that they have requested a loan.  The photo was taken in Narciza G. A.'s home.  Narciza is a member of the group.  She is 41 years old and only completed her primary education.  She has three sons and her business is selling corn tortillas.  She is requesting this loan to buy more corn and soft drinks since her sales are increasing and her customers are making a lot of orders.  They like to buy from her because she treats her customers kindly.  

At the time of requesting this loan, Narciza feels very happy.  She will use the profits she makes to pay for one of her children to have some therapeutic treatment since he is disabled.  This will mean that, in the future, he will be able to manage on his own.

Note: the person who is missing from the photo is Josefina R..

loans.use: to invest in buying more corn and soft drinks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 33 years old. She has four children who are between the ages of 7 and 11. Her husband is an electrician. Josephine owns a shop in which she sells several items, such as candles, matches, sugar, and drinks like tea and fresh milk. With this business, she has bought her own family house. She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business. She plans to reinvest in her business with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy more items to put in her shop, such as candles, matches, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Les Anges De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LES ANGES DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier  à PK11, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. La représentante du groupe, Elisabeth (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née en 1964 à Lagos au Nigéria. Elisabeth est mariée à un revendeur du  nom de Kola. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, et vivant à leur charge.  Il y a près de sept ans que Elisabeth et son mari se sont installés à PK11 avec leurs enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Depuis cinq ans, Elisabeth mène comme activité la vente de portables, des mèches et des produits de beauté par le système de distribution. Elisabeth achète se produits au Nigéria et à Lomé (au Togo). Cette activité génère à Elisabeth des revenus l’aidant à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. C’est la deuxième fois que Elisabeth sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe. Ce crédit permettra à Elisabeth et à son groupe de renforcer leurs activités et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Angels of God is a group made up of three people, whose members live together in the same neighborhood in PK11 in the Sèmè-Podji commune.  The representative of the group, Elisabeth (whose hand is raised in the photo) was born in 1964 in Lagos, Nigeria.  Elisabeth is married to a retailer named Kola.  The couple has four children, all educated and living in their care.  Elisabeth and her husband moved into PK11 with their children almost seven years ago.  The couple takes care of the household responsibilities together.  For five years, Elisabeth has run a business selling cell phones, hair extensions and beauty products through a distribution system.  Elisabeth buys her products in Nigeria and Lomé (in Togo).  This business generates revenue for Elisabeth, helping her to meet the needs of her family.  This is the second time Elisabeth, together with the other members of her group, has requested a loan from ALIDé.  This loan will allow Elisabeth and her group to strengthen their businesses and better respond to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, hair extensions, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 7 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending.  She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.  

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: For the past two years, Araba has been selling fish, porridge and doughnuts at Elmina. She is married to a mason and has five dependents. She helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to make porridge and flour to fry the doughnuts so that she can continue food production. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children. In this picture, Araba is taking out some of the fried doughnuts.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make porridge and flour to fry doughnuts.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
JamA., a 41-year-old entrepreneur, is married and has 3 children. He has been working in transportation for 14 years. His customers include all types of community members. JamA. is very proud of providing this service, especially in the high season, when tourists come and request to discover Lebanon.

JamA. is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, A. Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance on his car, which is his one and only source of living. JamA. hopes to open a tourist company in the future since he knows most of the beautiful places to be seen.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his car

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old and married with 2 adult-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns 40,000 PHP per harvest.

Wilma is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seed to grow. She grows corn and rice to sell and has been doing so for 15 years.

In the future, Wilma hopes that her farming business will become progressive to be able to provide the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en un su propia casa junto a su pareja Cadeon de 53 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanta voluntad y entrega han logrado cultivar Paulina y su esposo, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao y café, dependerá la calidad de frutos que obtenga.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Sivia, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos de café y cacao. Paulina solicita el crédito para contratar jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como en la poda y el deshierbo de maleza. En adelante, espera sembrar más plantas de cacao y barbasco ya que cuenta con espacios sin cultivar. Este será su 12avo préstamo con MFP y se siente feliz por contar con el apoyo de todos ustedes ya que gracias a su apoyo esta prosperando. En esta oportunidad también espera beneficiarse con el crédito por lo cual ella esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en desmonte y cosechas de sus productos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 46 years old.  She is a very hard working woman who lives in her own house with her spouse, Cadeon, 53, and their three beloved children who are the motivating force behind all her efforts.  The products that she and her husband have managed to produce with so much effort and dedication have helped her much to progress in life.  

Every morning she starts off tending to her fields because she knows that the care she gives her cocoa bean and coffee plants determines the quality of fruit she’ll obtain.  What she most likes about her work is caring for the plants and she feels very happy when she sees them big and lush.  She’s been in this line of work for 23 years and the most difficult part is having to transport her products all the way to the city of Sivia which is where she gets the best prices for her coffee and cocoa beans.

Paulina is asking for a loan to hire day laborers to help her with the respective crops to do such chores as weeding and pruning.  In future, she’d like to plant more cocoa bean and barbasco (an evergreen bush) plants because she has uncultivated fields.

This will be her 12th loan with MFP and she feels happy to have support from all of you because thanks to it she’s making progress.  On this occasion she’s hoping once again to be the beneficiary of a loan and she is ready to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the requested 2500 new soles to hire day laborers to help her pick and harvest her crops.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 30 years old and a single mother of three.  She sells construction materials to earn a living.  She has been in the business for four years and has employed two people.  Previously, she was selling second hand clothes. Agnes is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access business loans and save her money.  She needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and ballast.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, sand and ballast

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sari-sari store. Elvira is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy equipment for her trisikad transport business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her trisikad transport

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Hellen has a restaurant business, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food  to cook for sale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hellen hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Hellen hopes to expand her business.  

Hellen is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save money.

loans.use: purchase food to cook for sale

loans.name: Munhnaran

texts.en:
Munhnaran, 30, lives with his children, who both attend high school, and his wife, who supports the family business, in a house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a city in Mongolia.

Munhnaran, who started his business in 2009 by selling Israeli shoes at the Harhorin market, rents a commercial space at the market for 39,000 MNT per month. His daily sales income is 100,000 MNT, and his monthly profit is between 400,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT. He adds warm materials to the shoes in the winter to increase his volume of sales.

Munhnaran is requesting a 740,000 MNT loan to buy more shoes for the business. A responsible and hard-working man with many years of business and work experience, he says, "I want to obtain an apartment leasing loan in the near future."

loans.use: to buy shoes for his business.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She is married to Mr. Chinda who works as a car taxi driver. He works every day until 6 pm. With the profit he generates, Mr. Chinda is able to cover his expenses and his family’s needs. 

For upgrading their living conditions, Chhin and her husband are appealing for some funds from lenders. Chhin will use this loan to purchase some materials for decorating her old house. This family hopes that the funding will create happiness and prosperity for their family. They are a model couple who are able to gradually move their family forward with the intention of providing their children with a better future. This is Chhin's first loan with Kiva and HKL.

loans.use: to purchase some materials for decorating her house.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia has three children aged between one and seven. The older two are currently in school. Her husband is a civil servant. 
Scovia sells second-hand men’s clothes, which she buys from Kampala. She has been running this business for the last three years. Scovia needs a loan to buy more clothes in order to make more profits. With the profits and her savings she hopes to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mariposas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSAS DE ORO” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Julia es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía, venta de maíz, venta de cerveza, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta.

La señora Julia,  indica que hace año y medio que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la ceja y posterior a la elaboración de lo entregará a domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada  y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la reunión, la capacitación en crédito y el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “MARIPOSAS DE ORO” (Golden Butterflies) Communal bank will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer in connection with its Panamerica regional office. The group is composed of eight members and is directed by a board for which señora Julia is the treasurer. The businesses which members of the communal bank carry out include making handicrafts, selling corn, neighborhood shops, and the sale of fruit.

Señora Julia states that for a year and a half she worked with Pro Mujer helping to promote the institution in the area. Currently she has a business selling handicrafts that has operated for three years.

The loan she is applying for will be used to purchase wool taken from the brow and rear of sheep which will be made into products and delivered to customers’ homes. This work allows her to generate income for supporting her family since she is married and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she said she likes the meetings, the training, and the counseling.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa, tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos.

Ella ha adquirido una excelente experiencia, en la panificación, ya que desde que nació sus padres se han dedicado a esta actividad. Cuando ella se caso instalo su propia panadería y ya tiene 17 años de estarla manejando con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ellos asisten a la escuela por la mañana y por las tardes ayudan a los oficios del hogar.

Rosa se traslada  en su vehiculo, a una ciudad del oriente del país, para comprar la harina, azúcar, manteca, levadura, entre otros ingredientes, los huevos se los van a dejar a su casa. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar mayor cantidad de esta materia prima, con el objetivo de aumentar la producción de pan y ofrecerles mejor calidad a sus clientes. 

Al producir más pan, recibirá mayores ingresos y esto le servirá para financiar el estudio de sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Rosa desea comprarle una casa a su hijo mayor que esta estudiando medicina, para que él este más cómodo y ella más tranquila.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their four children. 

She has acquired excellent experience in bread making. Since she was born, her parents have worked in this activity. When she got married she opened her own bakery and now she has been running it for 17 years with her husband and their four children. They go to school in the morning and in the afternoon help with the household tasks. 

Rosa travels in  her vehicle to a city in the eastern region of the country to buy flour, sugar, lard, yeast, and other ingredients. The eggs are delivered to her house. She is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy a larger quantity of these raw materials. Her aim is to increase bread production and offer her customers better quality.  

When she produces more bread, she will receive more income and this will help finance her children's studies and improve their quality of life. Rosa wants to buy a house for her oldest son, who is studying medicine, so he will be more comfortable and she will be less worried.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of flour, sugar, lard, yeast, eggs and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Fe Emily

texts.en:
Maria Fe Emily is 41 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Maria Fe Emily has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 every month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
 
She has been a member of PMPC for about four years. In the future, Maria Fe Emily hopes to be successful in her business dealings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Zayniddin

texts.ru: Зайниддин проживает в районе Джиликул. Он женат. Ему 24 года. У него двое детей. Он уже восемь лет занимается садоводством. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием овощей. Кредит берет для покупки органических и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Zayniddin lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 24 years old, married and has two children.  He has been involved in gardening for eight years.  Besides, Zayniddin is involved in growing vegetables.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of organic and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase organic and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 47 years old and lives in Alegria, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Cresencia has a banana sales business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase 10 baskets of bananas to sell. 

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Cresencia hopes to earn more income from her business to spend on her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase 10 baskets of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Roseline Thècle

texts.fr: Madame Roseline est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est coiffeuse de profession, mais a laissé pour le moment cette activité parce que celle ci ne lui marche plus bien. Elle vend des mèches de tous types, des produits SOBEBRA glacés, bissap glacé et non préparé. Son fonds est situé à son domicile. Vue la situation géographique de son fonds, elle sollicite le concours de Finadev afin de diversifier son activité. Le revenu supplémentaire lui permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie économique et sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Roseline is married and has one child. She is a hairstylist by trade but has left this work for now because it is no longer doing well. She sells hair extensions of any type, ice-cold SOBEBRA products, ice-cold bissap drink (made from hibiscus flowers), and raw bissap. Her business is situated in her home. 
 
Given the geographic location of her business, she is requesting assistance from Finadev to diversify her business. The extra revenues will enable her to improve her family's social and economic situation.

loans.use: to buy 50 assorted hair extensions, 10 assorted containers, and other goods

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is age 27. She has three children between 1 and 4 years old. None of them go to school yet. Her husband works as a motorcyclist. She has spent 4 years selling sorghum. With the loan she will buy more sorghum for resale. Marie Chantal would like to use the profits to make savings and make reinvestment in the same business. She would like to own a big stock of sorghum in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Dianking's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en mai 2011,il est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même localité et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Mme Bâ en foulard blanc et située à l'extrême droite sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et âgée de 56 ans.Sa principale activité est le commerce de légumes.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activités car l'ayant pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et assurer les frais liés à la nourriture pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011.  It consists of members from the same locality.  Their main activity is small retail business.

The group's representative, Bâ, wearing a white shawl, is on the right-hand side in the photo.  She is married and 56 years old.  Her main activity is selling vegetables.

She has a good experience in her business because she has been involved in it for several years.

Her goal is to boost her savings and to cover her children's food expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia de 45 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, agua, gaseosas, jugos, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: comprar refrescos, agua, gaseosas, jugos, etc. por mayor

loans.name: Taitiana

texts.en:
A haircut in Ungheni, a regional center within Moldova on the Romanian border can be expensive for Moldovan standards. Prices have been increasing recently to as much as 60Lei ($4.5), but in Pirlita, a village only ten kilometers away one can still get their haircut for 15 lei ($1) from Taitiana P..  Tatiana has been working as a stylist since she was 18 years old.  She used to work at a hair salon but decided that she wanted to start her own business.  She cuts hair in a room adjacent to her house with a separate entrance.  This room is clean and professional though bare because there is a lack of furniture and the lighting is not the best.  Tatiana would like a loan to buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for her salon. She believes that she will still be able to still charge 15Lei for a haircut and that business will be especially busy soon for the holiday season.  On a busy day she can have as many as 10-20 clients

In the future she would also like to start offering manicures. She is excited about prospect of getting a loan because it can be difficult for women from rural areas in Moldova. Some day she would like to open a massage and comprehensive beauty center.

loans.use: To buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for her salon.

loans.name: Edosomwan

texts.en: Mrs. Edosomwan O. is a 35-year-old woman with three (3) children who lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks on wholesale to the public. She will use the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Balaja

texts.en: T. Balaca Sheshe Oglu is a farmer living in an Internally Displaced Person camp. He has very big family – 6 children and a wife. He has an animal husbandry business and, due to the limited land sources in IDP camps, he has to purchase feed for his animals from the market. Feeding his animals causes him very big problems in improving the business. So he deiced to apply for 1200 USD credit, which will be spent as follows:  600 USD for additional animals and 600 USD as working capital for feed purchases.

loans.use: Buy additional animals and working capital for feed purchases.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Mrs. Obdulia is 40 years old. She is married and has a daughter aged 23. Her husband, Mr. Eleuterio Valiente, is employed in a business working leather which makes for a big part of their family's income.

Mrs. Obdulia started her own Kiosk 18 years ago. It's located in the entrance of the city of Carpeguá. Thanks to her small business and the credits she obtained, she was able to keep progressing and with her earnings she manages to pay for the studies of her only daughter -who is her greatest hope. She is hoping she can finish her studies and have a worthy profession which improves her quality of life.

Her tenacious spirit and her wishes to accomplish her goals, have been the motivation to start her workdays at 4 am, when she goes up to the municipal market which is 40 minutes away from her home to buy the products she later sells. Her neighbours admire her for her sacrifice and her clients are very content with since her products are good and the service she gives them is the best.

Because the home where they live is precarious, Obdulia needs to make a few repairs since the roof and the floor are in deplorable state and urgent repair is necessary. In order to fix them Obdulia is requesting a credit of $1000.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Obdulia tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija de 23 años. Su marido, el Sr. Eleuterio Valiente, es empleado de una empresa de curtidora de cuero quien le ayuda en gran parte con los ingresos familiares. La señora empezó su Kiosco hace 18 años atrás, tiene su puesto en la entrada misma de la ciudad de Carapeguá; gracias a su pequeño negocio y los créditos que obtuvo, ella pudo ir progresando y con sus ganancias logra pagar los estudios de su única hija, quien es su mayor esperanza, desea que esta pueda culminar sus estudios y tener una profesión digna que mejore su calidad de vida. Su espíritu luchador y deseos de cumplir sus metas, son sus motivos para empezar la jornada a las 4 am, cuando va al hasta el mercado municipal que queda a 40 minutos de su casa a adquirir los productos que luego los lleva a su local para venderlos; los vecinos la admiran pues es muy sacrificada y sus clientes quedan muy conformes pues sus productos son buenos y la atención que ella les brinda es la mejor. Como la casa en la que viven es muy precaria, Obdulia necesita hacer unas refacciones a la casa pues el techo y el piso están en estados deplorables y es necesaria una urgente refacción; para ellos Obdulia solicita el crédito de $ 1000 que lo invertirá en las mejoras de su casa.

loans.use: House repairs - changing the roof and floor

loans.name: Elchin

texts.ru:
Elchin E. was born in 1975. He lives in the village of Tekle in Aksu region. He has one child. For 15 years, Elchin E. has been engaged in cattle farming. Before getting his first Normicro loan, he had 3 cows and 5 sheep. His first Normicro loan Elchin E. used to buy a few more sheep. He asks for another loan to continue expansion of his cattle farm.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Эльчин Ехтибаров. 1975 года рождения. Проживает в село Текле Аксуниского района. Имеет одного ребенка. 15 лет занимаеться скотоводством. До получения первого кредита, он держал 3 коровы и 5 овец.После первого кредита полученного из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала купил еще нескольких овцов.Эльчин заново обратился за кредит.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Francis De Jesús

texts.en:
Francis is a very young mother of three girls. Her partner is a taxi driver and works part-time for a company. Eight months ago, just after her third daughter’s birth, Francis had to start a small business to help her husband with the new responsibilities of the family. She sells tennis shoes and trainers for women.

Every month, she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to buy the goods. Sometimes, she purchases the products in Elías Piña, a border city with Haiti.

A short time after her first pregnancy, like many other young girls of her community, Francis had to drop out school so that she could look after her child. Now, she is making plans to go back to school. With the loan requested, as well as purchasing shoes and slippers to supply her business, she will also set aside some money to hire a babysitter for her daughters. Thus, she will have more time to dedicate to her sales activity, and she will also be able to go to school and become a professional.

loans.use: This young entrepreneur will use her loan to supply her small business with a large quantity of shoes and slippers so that she can significantly increase her income for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda Y. lives in B. Gafurov. She works in the Joint-Stock company “Navbakhor" in the commercial industry of the ladies' dressmaking. M. Y. is an active client of MicroInvest from 2007, and already she recommended herself as a serious and strong-motivated client. M. Y. works in the dresses development, design and making. This kind of business requires investments from time to time. She intends to purchase the special threads and equipment because she is a very experienced seamstress.

loans.use: To purchase special thread and equipment

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en: I live in the small town of Borewala in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five girls and three boys. I need a loan to buy my younger son a rickshaw. I know he can do well, because my elder son is also a rickshaw driver and he has trained his brother. I am a group leader of four other women: Ghaforan M., who plans to buy her son a rickshaw; Naseem Akhtar, who is a widow and needs a loan for their wood business; Kishwer B. will invest the loan in their sheep trading; and Farah A. needs a loan for her husband who paints roads such as pedestrian crossings.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Anna M. is 46 years od. She is married and has four children who are between the ages of 18 and 25. She also has two other dependents, who were street children. In 2006, Anna established a business of curing red palm seeds. Anna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase a curing machine.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase a curing machine

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum S. and her husband, Houn Tem, have been married since the Pol Pot regime. They have eight children; five daughters and three sons. Four of their children are married and live in separate houses, the other three children are studing in the local school, and one of her sons is a taxi driver. The family is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sarum is a farmer. She grows rice in the farm near her village, since 1979. After harvesting, she sells some rice product to the middle man in the village and keeps some for family food. Her husband is a full time employee of an NGO in Phnom Penh. 

She is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $1000 for buying a car for her son to run a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a car for running a taxi

loans.name: Wilbruga

texts.en:
Wilbruga is 32 years old and is a married woman with one child, age two years old. Wilbruga owns a small pharmacy, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Wilbruga has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more medicine for her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Estrellas De Atitlan Group

texts.es:
The group "The Stars of Atitlan" has worked with Kiva partner The Friendship Bridge for many years. They are one of the oldest most accomplished communal banks the organization has, and the members are very proud of that fact. They definitely feel a strong affection for the organization and vice versa. The group meets every 42 days in the house of Adela R. to get their training, repay their debts or deposit their savings. There is a happy and responsible ambiance in Adela's home, due to the fact that all the members of an accomplished history.

What they most like about working under a communal bank system is that, thanks to being a group of women with a good record, they are assured access to loans and avoid any red tape. They also enjoy sharing experiences with each other. With respect to The Friendship Bridge, they group feels its a good institution that is trustworthy, gives out loans quickly and has good customer service. They are also satisfied with the training they receive, among the courses the group highlights as especially helpful are business administration, medicinal plants, women's health and family planning, which is particularly stressed because it can have such an impact on their lives. Keep in mind that in rural areas families can become very large and as a consequence it can result in the families falling further into poverty.

Santiago de Atitlan is a place known for the ability of its artisans. The most beautiful bead-based jewelry in the region comes from there. By luck, this group has two members who work in this trade. They will invest their loans in the purchase of beads to make necklaces, bracelets and earrings. Two of the women work in textiles, weaving tradition blouses called "huipiles", while another member embroiders these items with beautiful birds, roses or Mayan symbols. Adela, a woman of strong character and playful at the same time like many women on the Guatemalan coast, sells snacks and American clothing. Finally, Karla R. has a cosmetics business. She buys her items via catalogue and sells them door to door. "The Stars of Atitlan" is a group that empowers all of its members. The members a group that has congealed over time and that works very well together. Due to this, it's imperative that The Friendship Bridge and Kiva members work together to support this group of talented, hard-working women.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Las Estrellas de Atitlan han venido trabajando con Friendship Bridge por muchos años. Son uno de los bancos comunales más antiguos y más cumplidos que tiene la institución y ellas se sienten muy orgullosas de eso. Ellas definitivamente sienten una afiliación fuerte con la institución y viceversa. Las Estrellas se juntan cada 42 días en la casa de doña Adela R. R. para recibir sus capacitaciones y repagar su deuda o depositar su ahorro. En la casa de Adela hay un ambiente de alegría y de responsabilidad. Esto se debe a que todas las mujeres tienen una tradición de ser cumplidas.

Lo que más les gusta de trabajar bajo la metodología de bancos comunales es que debido a que tienen un grupo de mujeres cumplidas ellas se aseguran el acceso a crédito y se evitan el gran problema de la mora. Asimismo, les gusta compartir experiencias de la vida entre ellas. Con respecto a Friendship Bridge, ellas sienten que es una buena institución debido a que es confiable, entrega el crédito rápido y tiene buen servicio al cliente gracias a la labor de la compañera Maria Q.. De la misma manera, ellas se sienten contentas porque reciben capacitaciones. Las mujeres contaron que las capacitaciones que más le gustaron fueron las de administración del negocio, plantas medicinales, salud de la mujer y planificación familiar. Las clientes hicieron hincapié en la charla de planificación ya que si les creo un impacto en sus vidas. Vale recordar, que en las áreas rurales las familias pueden llegar a ser muy extensas y como consecuencia esto puede resultar en que a las familias le cueste salir más de la pobreza.

Santiago de Atitlan es un lugar reconocido por la capacidad de sus artesanas. En este lugar se produce una de las joyas, en base a mostacilla, más bellas de la región. Por suerte, en este grupo tenemos dos clientas que trabajan en ese rubro. Ellas invierten su crédito en comprar bolitas de mostacilla para elaborar collares, brazaletes y aretes. Dos señoras trabajan con tejidos. Dos trabajan elaborando los huipiles, las blusas tradicionales de Guatemala, mientras que una señora borda los huipiles. Ella borda los huipiles con bellos pájaros, rosas o símbolos mayas. Doña Adela una mujer de carácter fuerte y alegre al mismo tiempo, muy típico de las mujeres de la costa de Guatemala, vende refacciones y ropa americana. Finalmente, Karla R. trabaja en el negocio de cosméticos. Ella compra cosméticos por catálogo y los vende de casa en casa.

Las Estrellas de Atitlán es un grupo que amerita el apoyo de todos. Es un grupo que se ha consolidado a lo largo del tiempo y que han trabajado muy bien. Debido a eso, es importante que Friendship Bridge y ustedes por medio de Kiva apoyen a este grupo de mujeres talentosas, aguerridas y trabajadoras.

loans.use: Purchase beads to make jewelry; purchase threads to make and embroider blouses; purchase American clothing and food ingredients; and purchase cosmetics / Compra de mostacilla para elaborar joyas, compra de hilos para elaborar tejidos y bordados, compra de ropa americana, ingredientes de comida y cosméticos

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe S. lives in her own home in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband, Mario Chavarria, and their three children. Lupe is a domestic employee and works in a private home and her husband works for the local government .

The family is going through a difficult situation and are recovering from the death of their oldest daughter from illness, for which there were medical expenses.

The loan she is requesting will be used to build stairs to access the two levels of her home, as currently there are only very weak wooden steps.

This is the third time she has asked for a loan and an analysis has rated her request favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lupe S. vive en casa propia en la zona de Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Mario Chavarria y sus tres hijos. La señora Lupe es empleada domestica en un domicilio particular y su esposo trabaja en la administración publica del departamento.

La familia atraviesa una situación delicada ya que se reponen del fallecimiento de su hija mayor por enfermedad, lo que ocasionó gastos médicos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de gradas para el acceso a dos niveles en su domicilio, ya que cuentan solo con gradas precarias de madera.

Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build stairs to be able to access the 2 floors of her home.

loans.name: Mau

texts.en:
Mau M., 31, is married with 3 children and lives at Moamoa on Upolu Island, Samoa. Her husband works as a carpenter and she has begun a business making and selling "ice cakes" (flavored ices) to the public and villagers 6 days per week.

This will be Mau's first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (US$62). SPBD loans are Mau’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to purchase plastic cups and the ingredients for her ice cakes.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for flavored ices.

loans.name: Has

texts.en:
Has S. H., 45, lives with her husband, Moul Rath, and their five children in Sa Ang. She and her husband work as farmers in the rice fields and make about US$ 2.50 each day. Their children also all work and they too are farmers who grow rice or different types of vegetables to help support the family.

Has S. H. has asked for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase seeds to expand her current farm. She sees the growth of her rice farm as a good way to increase her family's income and improve her standard of living. Inflation has made it a very difficult time economically for many Cambodians and loans that are used to expand businesses and increase incomes can be very helpful.

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo M. is 25 years old. She is married with three children. Since 2007, she has been engaged in bicycle spare parts sales. She has a stall in the local market. She sells spare parts of different types and for various bicycles.

As a result of the success of her business, Shahlo has improved the living conditions of her family and is doing all the best to meet all the needs of her dearest children. But she is not satisfied with the volume of sales and wants to increase her inventory, thus increasing the volume of her sales.

With this purpose in mind, today Shahlo is requesting 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 9 months. She is planning to spend the loan purchasing spare parts for bicycles thus increasing her range of goods. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Shahlo’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for bicycles for re-sale

loans.name: Bibibosafo

texts.en:
Y. Bibibosafo is 37 years old. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary is not enough to meet their living expenses. So Bibibosafo decided 6 years ago to start her own business. She has a trading place near her apartment where she sells eggs, sugar, tea, sweets, and other food. She works very hard to give her dearest children a good education and to make all of them happy.

Bibibosafo is planning to expand her business and purchase more goods to increase the variety of food that she offers. She requests a loan of $1000. Bibibosafo is counting on your help. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her with increasing her business.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristal Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Cristal  está formado por 10 socias, pertenecen a la zona D. Pampahasi y San Antonio D. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia Trabajan con Emprender desD. hace dos años, actualmente están en el 6º ciclo crediticio. La señra Cristina A., es la líder del grupo desD. sus inicios, es la fundadora, cuenta con un puesto D. venta D. frutas en el mercado D. la zona, es una socia muy responsable, que sabe guiar al grupo. El señor David M., es chofer propietario D. un minibús y además mecánico, también fundador del grupo. La sra. Basilia  M., socia antigua, se dedica a la venta D. libros por catálogo. La señora Nicasia G., cliente que ingresa en este ciclo, invitada por las socias que la conocen muy bien, su actividad es la venta D. cordero y queso en la ciudad D. El Alto, mercadería que trae D. su pueblo. La señora Beatriz M. es tambien cliente nueva, que ingresa en este ciclo, fue invitada por doña Cristina, se dedica a la venta D. frutas en el mismo mercado. La señora Julia Vasquez, cliente antigua es cocinera en un comedor popular D. la zona y atienD. contratos para acontecimientos sociales. La señora Elena Angélica M., fundadora del grupo, tiene su puesto D. venta D. DVD's y CD's musicales, y películas. La sra. Agustina C., buena cliente, se dedica a la venta D. frazadas, por pedidos. Elba C., cliente nueva, que se dedica a la confección D. chompas, invitada por las socias a participar en el grupo, por su carácter responsable. La sra. Catalina L., cliente invitada por las socias, venD. ropa nueva y usada americana, en la feria D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Todas las socias del grupo invertirán el crédito en aumentar su capital, ya que tienen que estar preparadas para las fiestas D. fin D. año.
texts.en:
The Cristal Communal Bank is maD. up of ten members who live in the Pampahasi and San Antonio neighborhoods in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. They have been working with Emprender for two years and are currently on their sixth loan cycle. Señora Cristina A. has been the group leader from the very beginning and is also the group's founder. She has a fruit stand in the local market. She is a very responsible member and knows how to lead the group. Señor David M. drives a minibus (the primary form of public transportation in La Paz) and is also a mechanic. He also helped found the group. Señora Basilia M., a long-time group member, sells books by catalogue. Señora Nicasia G. is a new member; she was invited by group members who know her well. She works in the city of El Alto, selling lamb and cheese that she brings to the city from her village. Señora Beatriz M. is also new to the group; she was invited by Doña Cristina to join this loan cycle. She sells fruit in the same local market. Señora Julia Vasquez, a long-time member, works as a cook at a "comedor popular" (a lunch counter that sells low-cost meals to the working class) and cooks for social occasions. Señora Elena Angelica M., one of the group's founding members, sells CDs and DVDs. Señora Agustina C., a good client, sells blankets by special order. Elba C., a new member, sews sweaters. She was invited to join the group because of her responsible character. Señora Catalina L. sells both used and new clothing in the El Alto market. She was also invited to join the group for this loan cycle. All of the group members plan to invest their loans to increase their working capital (to purchase more merchandise to sell, generally), since they have to get ready for end-of-year festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tusuubira Group B

texts.en:
Prossy N. is the leader of Tusuubira Group B.  She is 35 years old and is married with 4 children. Her previous loans have helped her so much with her tailoring business that her business has lasted for a long time.

Prossy has a shop that sells new clothes and clothes that she makes herself for her customers. She is so happy with her business. She also has a tailoring school where she teaches young girls the same trade. Her students have to pay a small amount of money to help her with the rent. 

Prossy needs a loan to buy more new clothes to sell and materials for making other clothes now that the demand is so high.

loans.use: Prossy will buy new clothes for her shop and materials she needs for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is a 47-year-old widow who has two children. As a single parent, she must work very hard to support her family. Currently, one of her children has completed high school, while the other is still in school.  For the past 20 years, Agnes has made a living selling porridge in her neighborhood. She has lots of experience in porridge production and selling to a wide range of customers. 

Agnes has applied for a loan to buy more maize, milk and sugar,  the major ingredients in her porridge. Buy buying in bulk now, she will be able to avoid price hikes and lower her costs significantly. This will allow her to pay for her younger child’s education. 

Agnes is a member of the Awake Trust group, whose members agree to help one another repay loans.

loans.use: To buy maize, milk and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael N. M. is a hard-working businessman. He is 48 years of age, a loving husband and father to 5 children who are all in school. He has 5 years' experience in selling fuel (petrol and diesel).

Due to scarcity and skyrocketing fuel prices, Michael is using the loan proceeds to increase his stock of petrol and diesel so as to meet customer demand. His ambition is to open up a fuel station with large fuel reserves. It is the income from the business that enables him to provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase petrol and diesel fuel for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante llamado Marcos que esta ubicado en una calle concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la atención es durante todo el día, cuenta con 5 personas que se encargan de la cocina y atención al publico. Además atienden pedidos para compromisos diversos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos.
Los sueños de Maria son que su ultima hija sean profesional y que su negocio sea cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. Maria is 52, married, and has 2 children. She has a restaurant called 'Marcos,' located on a busy street in the city of Ayacucho. It is open all day, and she has 5 employees who work in the kitchen and serve the customers. In addition they take orders for a variety of functions. Maria needs a loan for 1200 soles that she will use to by pots and dishes. Maria hopes that her youngest daughter can have a professional career and that her business keeps growing.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots and dishes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita M. D. M., resiD. en Lourdes Colón, departamento D. La libertad, junto a sus hijos y su esposo. Ella posee un pequeño negocio D. productos varias, tales como accesorios para bebés, collares, papelería y pan dulce, este último es  un tipo D. pan típico D. El Salvador, el cual lleva azúcar e incluso en algunos casos jalea. Margarita desea ampliar su negocio, es por ello que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual logre comprar muchas más cosas para su tienda y D. esta manera poder estar dentro D. la preferencia D. las personas aledañas a su negocio. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos y poder colaborar con los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo, ya que por el solo no da abasto con todo lo necesario para su familia, es por ello que es D. mucha importancia para Margarita mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita M. D. M. lives in Lourdes Colón, in the La Libertad department, together with her children and husband. She owns a small business of varied goods, carrying items such as baby products, necklaces, paper goods and “pan dulce”. Pan dulce is a traditional bread of El Salvador maD. with sugar and, in some cases, jelly. Margarita wishes to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan through which she will be able to purchase many more products for her store. In this way, she can attract customers from the vicinity of her enterprise. She does all this with the aim of providing a better standard of living for her children. She also does it to help her husband pay for the household expenses, since his earnings alone do not cover the family’s needs. These are the reasons why it is so important to Margarita to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her general store.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy T. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Lucy sells slippers, shoes, saucepans, and clothing at Abura, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a driver. Lucy uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Lucy will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of slippers, shoes, saucepans, and clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lucy plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Lucy will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of slippers, shoes, saucepans, and clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en:
Lonise G., 67, is the widowed mother of eight children. She has five years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people and public six days per week. She requested this loan to purchase another sewing machine and material for puletasi. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Lonise’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

She has 10 previous loans with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and material for puletasi.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has been a clothes seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the Mwanzo Mgumu group loan (Group code 2019). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bedsheets, khanga and other types of clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Halima is married, and has three children: ages 17, 15 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets, khanga and other types of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, a 41-year-old resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela, is married to Wilson A., a farmer in their village. They have four children: Winnie, 21 years old and already married; Wilgel, 19 years old; Williad, 17, a high school graduate, and Wilson, 11, presently attending elementary school. Violeta and her husband work hard for the improvement of their living conditions.

Violeta sells vegetables harvested from their own backyard vegetable garden, earning an average income of PHP300.00 daily. She wants to make her small business more profitable and so is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to maintain and grow it. Violeta dreams of someday having a motorcycle to make her vending easier and enable her to increase her customer base. She also wishes to send her youngest child to high school and then college if given the chance. She believes that through her sacrifices in vending and her strong faith in God, she will be able to attain her dreams.

loans.use: Business maintenance and improvement

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
ESTADO CIVIL, SOLTERA.

ELLA ESTUDIO LA CARRERA DE MEDICO GENERAL, CON SUS GANAS, PUSO EL CONSULTORIO MEDICO, PARA EMPEZAR CON EL NECESITA MEDICINAS, PARA PODER OFRECER SUS SERVICIOS.

COMENZO CONSULTANDO A DOMICILIO, Y POR PRACTICAS DE SU CARRERA.

DESDE EL AÑO 1999, QUE COMENZO SU PROPIO CONSULTORIO 

APOYEMOS ESTE CASO DE ESTA GRAN MUJER TAN EMPRENDEDORA.
texts.en:
Rocio is single. She studied general medicine and due to her personal drive she opened a medical practice; to be able to offer her services she needs medicines. She began consulting at individual’s homes and while practicing during her studies. Since 1999 she has had her own practice. Lets support this greatly entrepreneurial woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham N., 44, lives in the Batambong province with her husband and four young children. She makes about US$3 daily, selling fruit and growing rice, while her husband makes US$1.50 in construction. She is asking for a loan in the amount of US$300 to reinvest in her fruit store. She is also hoping to purchase a pig to raise and sell with the money from the loan. She sees this loan as a great opportunity to expand her business and is confident that she will see her income increase as a result.

loans.use: To reinvest in her fruit store.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Feeling unhappy and bored, 53 year-old Tita D. had to stop her previous work as a sales lady and shift to the things she’s more interested in. She opened a small store beside their house in Getafe, Bohol with only Php 4,000.00 as the starting capital. She also ventured on fish vending and finds she is interested in it. She even dreams of having a fish farm someday. This enables her to support her husband in providing for their needs especially for the education of their child.

Tita is applying for a loan from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) to improve her businesses. Php 9,000.00 will be enough to purchase more fish and stock for her store. She also appreciates CEVI’s advocacy to promote the importance of saving to their clients.

loans.use: For fish and stock

loans.name: Calixto

texts.en:
Don Calixto has been a businessman for more than 10 years, with an established clientele thanks to the good service and high quality of his products. His clients constantly visit him for music CDs and movie DVDs that are specific to his or her liking. 

The loan that he is asking for will be used to expand his business and venture into selling haberdashery. He hopes to buy merchandise, such as like discs, blouses, jerseys, socks, undergarments, among others, and be able to satisfy the demand of his clientele.

loans.use: To purchase CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie B. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Marjorie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marjorie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Marjorie has operated this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that can help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be put towards expanding the business. This will be Marjorie's 4th loan from HSPFI. With these additional funds, she plans to improve upon and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jawas Pankarita Group

texts.es:
Gregoria V. de 46 años y Nancy Huanta de 20 años son dos integrantes del grupo “Jawas Pankarita”, son madre e hija,  ambas tienen la habilidad de tejer diferentes prendas y lo venden, las dos son madres Gregoria tiene  6 hijos, Nancy  tiene 2 hijos, y necesitan del préstamo para comprar lana y seguir en su actividad económica y así poder ayudar a generar ingresos en su familia.
Las demás integrantes de  “Jawas Pankarita” también tienen sus propios negocios, como la venta de ropa, alfombras, atención de llamadas, tienda de barrio y la venta de comida. Ellas necesitan del préstamo para la compra de  materia prima y mercadería y seguir operando en sus negocios.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha B. es madre de familia, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 1 hija de diez años de edad que asiste al colegio. El negocio que se dedica a esta señora es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio por cuenta propia por lo que trabaja con su esposo, quien es el encargado de abastecer la mercadería, para ello él viaja frecuentemente a la ciudad donde compra las prendas a menores precios. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares es una mujer que le gusta trabajar. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y tallas extra grande que es lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El deseo de Martha es establecer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Martha B. is 40 years old. She has a 10 year old daughter who is currently attending secondary school.

Martha sells clothing in various locations. She opened her business alone, but now now works with her husband who purchases the clothing wholesale. He goes into the city of Leon to buy at the lowest prices. Martha enjoys getting to know new places through her work and working hard

Martha is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of more shirts, pants, skirts, and the extra large sizes that her clients want. Martha's goal is to establish her own store.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Alegria. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Teresita is just starting this business.

In 2008, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Hog raising is the business of Emilyn B.. Aside from this, she also sells vegetables in their village to earn more income. She would like to have her business maintained and she needs additional capital to do it. In connection with this, she is borrowing a loan amounting to 5,000 Philippine pesos for the development and growth of her business. She is planning to purchase more hogs and a sufficient supply of feed for her pigs. The loan she is requesting can help her a lot in maintaining her business; that’s why she prays that her loan will be approved.

Emilyn is 32 years old and a mother of two. Her eldest is 12 years old and her youngest is 7 years old. They are both studying in primary school near their village. Emilyn is married to Edwin, who is employed as a construction worker. The couple is hoping to provide all the needs of their children.

loans.use: To purchase more hogs and sufficient supply of feed

loans.name: Sar

texts.en: Sar U. is 62 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in the Takeo province. Since 1999, she has been working as a professional weaver, making $3 (US) every day, while her husband is a farmer who makes $2 (US) per day. She is asking for a loan of $700 (US), which she will use to purchase more silk to make clothes to sell at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase silk to make clothes

loans.name: Obama Group

texts.en:
Domini K., age 34, is married with three children, ages 15, 5, and 1 year old. She is a tailor, selling tailoring equipment, sarongs, materials, fabrics, and handmade clothing since 2000. She works daily from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m., managing to make a monthly profit of around $267.

This will be Domini's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to expand her tailoring business and repaid the loan successfully. She hopes this loan will help her make her business even larger and more successful. She will use the extra capital to invest in more fabrics and tailoring equipment.

Domini will share this loan with her loan group, Obama, which totals 16 members. In the picture, Domini is first on the left front row, sitting on the blue chair.

loans.use: Buying more fabric for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto F. T. de 50 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Carlos posee una panadería desde hace 10 años, negocio el cual es atendido sobre todo por su esposa, así mismo él trabaja como agricultor y hace viajes a personas particulares ya que posee un pick up. Carlos solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz y frijoles para realizar la siembra, así mismo comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan, el cual lo comercializa el la zona en la cual él vive. Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador, el cual junto a su esposa se esfuerzan de diferentes maneras para poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus cuatro hijos, trabajan muy duro pero obtienen su recompensa al observar que sus hijos cuentan con todo lo básico para seguir adelante y poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto F. T. is 50 years old, lives in Arce City in the La Libertad district. He lives with his wife and four children, who are all studying. Carlos has owned a bakery for 10 years, a business which is mostly run by his wife. He, himself, works as a farmer and he uses his pick-up to work as a private driver. Carlos is seeking this loan in order to be able to buy corn and beans for planting and at the same time buy ingredients for bread, which he sells in the area where he lives. Carlos is a very hard-working man, and he, together with his wife, make an effort in many ways to be able to provide a better life for his four children. They work very hard but their reward is the recognition that their children can count on having all the basics in order to prosper and to be able to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and beans and ingredients for bread for his bakery.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 34 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pequeña hija y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de darle una buena vida.
En la comodidad de su hogar Victoria teje a mano sus coloridas prendas artesanales; todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, ya que tiene que cumplir con los pedidos que le hace un comerciante de los Estados Unidos, quien se lleva las prendas para venderlas en su país. 
Pero Victoria no sólo se dedica a vender lo que teje, sino que también reúne mayor cantidad de prendas de otras tejedoras, quienes igualmente reciben una buena paga por su trabajo.
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es que de cierta forma también ayuda a sus compañeras a progresar, lleva 10 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que dejar de dormir para cumplir con los pedidos. 
Para más adelante, espera formar una empresa con sus compañeras tejedoras, con la cual todas puedan desarrollarse.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Victoria con MFP, en sus anteriores pagos siempre fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también. Las socias de su banco comunal le tiene mucho cariño, ya que es muy responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Victoria, who is 34 years old, is a happy and sincere woman. She lives in a rented house with her little daughter and is willing to work hard to give her a good life. In the comfort of her home Victoria weaves her colorful handmade clothing. She works every day beginning very early because she needs to fill orders for a trader from the United States, who takes her clothing to sell in his country. But Victoria does not only sell what she weaves. She also collects a larger amount of clothing from other weavers, who in turn receive a fair payment for their work. What she likes the most about her work is that in some way she also helps her fellow women to move forward. She has been doing this work for 10 years and thinks that the most difficult part is having to stay up without sleep to fulfill the orders. Looking ahead, she hopes to form a business with her fellow weavers, so that they can all make progress. This is Victoria’s sixth loan with MFP. She was always on time with previous repayments and hopes to be this time as well. The members of her communal bank like her very much, because she is very responsible. With the 1500 Peruvian soles that she is asking for she will buy more wool to make new hand-woven clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen V., 36, is married and lives with his wife in Battambong town, Cambodia. V. is engaged in the agriculture sector growing orange trees on his own plot of farmland. He is able to earn an income of USD 1.5 per day to help cover the family’s expenses. He spends time on his plot of farmland every day taking care of his crops. His wife sells vegetables and fruit at a market located in the center of the town, earning an income of USD 8 per day. V. and his wife try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses. As a result, V. is requesting for a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the expected loan to purchase more fruit to sell to his new and existing customers. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie A. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Binicuil, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling livestock and fattening pigs.

Margie’s husband Juvy helps her run the business. They have four children who are between 2 and 12 years old. Two of her children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Margie A. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in buying and selling livestock and fattening pigs. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Margie A. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund operations of her livestock and pig businesses. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 19,000 for her 17th loan, which she intends to use on her businesses.  Margie A. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Khudaverdi

texts.en: Khudaverdi M. is a 46-year-old man who runs his own shop. He sells different kinds of home products. He is married and has three children. Khudaverdi has nine years of experience in his business. Now he needs 1,600 Azerbaijan New Manat to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more products to increase income

loans.name: Isidora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Isidora Del Socorro ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada. La señora brinda el servicio de costura localizado en su casa de habitación, en el cual elabora pantalones, vestidos, camisas. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace nueve años, cabe señalarse a ella le enseño su madre a coser, y nunca pensó que se dedicaría a esta actividad algún día.
