Ella empezó con este negocio como una búsqueda alternativa de una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera obtener ingresos adicionales además de los de su esposo y brindara estabilidad económica. Con el tiempo ha ido haciendo muchos clientes, los cuales la buscan mucho ya que aducen que trabaja bien y cobra barato. Su préstamo era invertido en la compra de telas variadas para hacer ropa. Ella siempre ha soñado con tener algún día un taller industrial y que pueda brindar trabajo a otras personas y tener mayores ingresos que los que posee ahora.
texts.en:
Isidora Del Socorro is 45 years old and married. She works as a tailor from her house, where she makes pants, dresses and shirts. She started this business nine years ago. She was taught to sew by her mother, but she never thought she would work in this activity some day. She started her business as an alternative source of income that would provide additional income from that of her husband, to bring them financial stability. Over time she has gained many customers, who ask for her a lot since they know she works well and doesn't charge too much. Her loan will be invested in purchasing a variety of fabric to make clothing. She has always dreamed of some day having an industrial shop that can give work to other people and to have more income than she already earns.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital: cloth

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Nora Elizabeth M. D. R. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijas D. 13 y 10 años D. edad, las cuales son estudiantes D. la escuela D. Ilopango, y que dependen por completo D. Nora, ya que ella es madre soltera y no recibe ningún tipo D. ayuda económica. Nora se dedica a la venta D. detergentes tanto en polvo como líquidos, y así mismo lejías para blanquear la ropa. Ella comercializa sus productos D. casa en casa, lo cual le ha resultado muy factible, razón por la que ya desD. hace 6 años se dedica a la misma actividad. Nora solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder comprar detergente, lejías, y papel higiénico, ya que este último posee mucha demanda pero debido a que ella invierte casi todas sus ganancias en los gastos del hogar, le queda muy poco para invertir en el negocio y se le ha hecho muy difícil el poder comprar estos productos por mayor. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, ya que cuenta con el deseo D. poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijas, obteniendo el dinero necesario para invertir más en el negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nora Elizabeth M. D. R. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Illopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her two daughters, ages 13 and 10, who are students at the school in Ilopango and completely dependent on her. Nora is a single mother and does not receive any financial support. She sells detergents in powder and liquid form, as well as bleach for whitening clothes. Nora sells her products door to door, which has proven very practical since she has been in this same business for the past six years.

She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy detergents, bleach, and toilet paper. The last product listed is in high demand but because she spends almost all of her earnings on household expenses, she has little money left over to invest in her business. Therefore, it is very difficult for her to buy these products in bulk. This is why she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. Nora desires to improve the quality of life for her daughters, obtain the necessary funds to invest more into her business, and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase detergents, bleach, and toilet paper to sell

loans.name: Sarah Sackor Group

texts.en:
Missionmah R. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Sarah Sackor Group. She is 58 years old, married and has six children who range from 25 to 40 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For more than 3 years, Missionmah has been running her doughnut business at the Old Road Market in Monrovia, Liberia.  Missionmah prepares her doughnuts well and takes the doughnuts around to customers which keeps them buying from her.

Missionmah plans to use her 14,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 56,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more flour, sugar and oil for making doughnuts. Her goal is to improve her business and buy land for her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Missionmah is the one holding the sign. Naomi D. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar and oil for making doughnuts.

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
EL banco D. Emprendimiento GAVIOTAS es un Banco antiguo dentro D. la institucion cuenta con varias secuencias, esta formado por 13 socios 11 mujeres y 2 varones, son personas responsables que se conocen y se garantizan mutuamente.

El Sr. Jesus es el Presidente del banco D. Emprendimiento GAVIOTAS tiene como actividad la D. chofer propietario cuenta con un vehículo propio es taxi y pertenece a una red D. radiotaxis el trabaja todo el dia, esta casado y es es padre D. familia D. tres hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar el solo mantiene a su familia con los ingresos del taxi ya que su esposo se dedica a labores del hogar, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. repuestos para su movilidad y la refeccion D. la misma. Es una persona responsable y trabajadora con muchas ganas D. superacion y desea mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia.

La señora Carmen es la secretaria D. Actas ella tiene una tienda D. barrio en la calle Tipuani D.  Villa Fatima es un lugar comercial ella mantiene sola a sus dos hijos D. edad escolar ya que esta separada D. su pareja y no le queda D. otra que la D. trabajar duro para sacar a su familia adelante, ya que no recibe ningun apoyo del Padre D. sus hijas,  y con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para surtir su tienda.

El Sr Humberto es el Tesorero del banco el cuanta con una tienda D. celulares y hace tambien reparación y mantenimiento D. los mismos,esta casado y es padre D. dos hijos cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposa quien se dedica a labores D. casa, El Sr. Humberto es una persona responsable y trabajadora con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia en celulares.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos tienen que sacar a su familia adelante solas con ganas D. superacion y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Gaviotas” Enterprise Bank has been part of the institution for a long time. It is maD. up of 13 members, 11 women and 2 gentlemen. They are responsible and proviD. mutual support for one another. Jesus serves as the bank president and drives a taxi during the day. He has his own vehicle and participates in a network of radio dispatched taxies. He is married and is the father of three school-aged daughters. He supports his family with his income as a taxi driver while his wife works as a homemaker. He will use the money from this loan to pay for repair parts and repairs to his vehicle. He is a very responsible person with a great desire to get ahead and improve his family’s quality of life. Carmen serves as the group’s secretary and runs a neighborhood store on Tipuani D. Villa Fatima street. This is a commercial zone. She is separated and she alone supports her two school-aged children. She has no alternative but to work hard in order to move her family ahead, since she doesn’t receive any help from her daughters’ father. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. Humberto serves as the treasurer and has a cell phone store where he also repairs and maintains phones. He is married and is the father of two children. His wife is a homemaker. Humberto is a very responsible, hard working person. He will use the money from this loan to buy cellular accessories. All of the members have proven to be hard working and responsible, and in many cases must move their families ahead on their own. They are all very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in them in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs and inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel to sell.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriano A. is from the village of Yeban Norte. He is 51 years old, is married and has two adult children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Cipriano has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 60,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2008, Cipriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. As with his previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which he has successfully repaid, this new loan of 25,000 PHP will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the fifth loan he has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita G. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Rita is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure, pedicure, hair relax, haircut and other beauty parlor  services in the local community. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rita is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her beauty parlor services

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María de 36 años, vive en Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y tiene dos hijos. 

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres, hace cinco años atrás llego de Imbabura con su esposo e hijos para vivir en Duran. Poco a poco comprando algunos víveres inicio con una pequeña tienda para poder solventar su hogar. Ahora ella tiene su tienda de víveres trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.  

Pero para tener mas surtida su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo enlatados, arroz, aceites para su tienda. 
En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and lives with her two children in a house built from sugar cane stalks in Duran, on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Duran is now an urban area but was originally rural, with numerous hills, streams, and lakes. Although these are still present, the feeling of being in a natural environment is slowly disappearing. Five years ago, María and her husband and children moved to Duran from Imbabura. Little by little, she began to acquire merchandise and opened a small grocery store to help pay their household expenses. With her husband’s help, she now tends the shop every day. She would like to have more stock for her shop, so she will use the loan to purchase canned goods, rice, and oil. Her goal for the future is to have a cement house. She also wants her children to successfully complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Canned goods, rice, cooking oil

loans.name: Yossy

texts.es: Yossy, D. 24 años D. edad, convive con su pareja. ElL. vive en L. casa D. su pareja, ubicada en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, específicamente en L. localidad D. Quimbiri. Yossy, reconoce que para realizar un negocio propio, tiene que pasar por varias etapas en el plano laboral. Por el momento se encuentra trabajando en una entidad pública, reparando computadoras y con el sueldo que percibe trata D. apoyar a su pareja, es así que genera ingresos económicos considerables para L. familia. Su horario D. trabajo lo realiza a partir D. las 8:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 6:00 D. L. tarD.. Sus planes a futuro es tener su propia tienda D. heladería y  pastelería, ya que en su localidad no existe ese tipo D. negocio, es por ello que lo ve como un buen prospecto a ejecutarlo. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma D. pagos, además se siente cómoda con su grupo comunal, por los buenos beneficios que le otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar un juego D. sillas, D. esa manera emprender el negocio que tiene en manos.
texts.en:
Yossy is 24 years old, and she lives with her life partner. She lives in his house, which is in the beautiful Cuscan jungle. Specifically, she lives in Quimbiri. Yossy realizes that in order to have her own business she needs to go through various stages in the work plan. At the moment she is working for a public entity repairing computers. She tries to help her life partner with the salary she receives. That is how she generates considerable income for her family. Her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Her plan for the future is to have her own ice cream and pastry store. This type of business does not exist in her area. That is why she views it as a good prospect to follow through on. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She pledges to continue making her payments on time. Also, she feels comfortable in her communal bank because of the good benefits they proviD.. She will use the requested loan to buy a set of chairs. That way she can undertake the business that she has planned.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs to undertake her pastry and ice cream business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos G. D. M. D. 39 años D. edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar, ella vive en Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, Santos posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para el hogar, dicha venta esta ubicada frente al Instituto San Andrés, en donD. venD. la mayoría D. sus productos con los estudiantes D. este lugar y así mismo comercializa granos básicos con los empleados D. una fabrica cercana. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias justas para poder pagar la cuota mensual D. su casa y así mismo pagar todos los gastos D. la familia y el hogar, y así también contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Santos desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para Santos ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos G. D. M. is 39 years old. She lives with her family, which is comprised of two children. The children work. She lives in Colón, which is located in the La Libertad department. Santos has a store where she sells perishable products and basic needs products for the home. Her store is located in front of the Instituto San Andrés. She sells most of her products to the students in the area. She also sells basic grains to the employees of a nearby factory. This business has allowed her to count on fair earnings in order to make the monthly house payment, pay for all of the family and household expenses, and to have food and all of the necessities to live decently. That is why Santos wants to have more products in the store. That is the reason she is requesting a loan to be able to buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and other things that a good store carries. This is very important to Santos because there is a lot of competition in the area. That is why she needs to have everything that is necessary to satisfy her customers. Then she will win other customers who prefer to shop in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products and basic grains

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a single lady who currently lives with her old mother and other two relatives. To pursue a daily income, S. works in the construction field. In her free time, she also helps her mother sew clothes for extra profit.

 The roof of the family house is cracking since the heavy rainfalls came. S. hopes to mend it and is asking for a loan in order to replace the broken roof of her house.

loans.use: To replace the broken roof of her house

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.en:
Nazgul M. is a resident of Tup, a nice town in the Isykul region with a population of 15,000 people. She is 42 years old and married. She has three sons and two daughters. The first son is a farmer, the first daughter studies at university, the second son is at school and the other children are of preschool age (under 7). 

In 1995 when the collective farms broke up, Nazgul was given a parcel of land, so since that moment Nazgul has been engaged in farming.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase 300 liters of fuel for farming. In the future she wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Marco de 37 años, que es transportista, y de sus 3 hijos de los cuales el primero trabaja y se mantiene, pues ya es mayor de edad. Desde hace 4 meses trabaja prestando servicio de  seguridad en las calles, dice que ha sido contratada por la municipalidad de su distrito, y  junto a otras mujeres demuestra cada día que ellas pueden velar por la seguridad ciudadana con mucha dedicación. Le gusta este trabajo porque le permite obtener ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar, además se puede comprar sus gustos de vez en cuando. Lo que no le gusta es que sus compañeros varones duden de su buen desempeño, aunque asegura que luego de estos meses les ha demostrado que hay igualdad de género. En adelante, luego de mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, quiere instalar cabinas para ofrecer el servicio de Internet, para ello se asociara con su esposo. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente para no defraudar la confianza que depositaron en ella todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Nancy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su casa, pues para el futuro tiene planeado instalar en ese lugar un negocio, así espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Nancy is 37, lives at home with her husband Marco, also 37, he is a driver, she also lives with her three children, the oldest one works and supports himself as he is an adult. Four months ago she started working providing security service on the streets, she was hired by the municipality of the district and along with other women, she demonstrates every day that women can look after the security of the citizens with much dedication. She likes her job because it allows her to make income to help her husband in the constant home expenses, she can also buy herself something once in a while. What she doesn't like is that her male co-workers doubt of her good performance, she assures that after these months she has demonstrated that there is gender equality. Later on, after improving the infrastructure of her house, she wants to install cabins to offer Internet service, and she will work together with her husband. This is the first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time and this way not betray the trust given to her by all the people that made possible the loan that will allow her to keep working. Nancy has planned to invest the loan in buying building materials for the betterment of her house infrastructure, so that she can start a business in the future and achieve progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve house insfrastructure to start a business.

loans.name: Imtiaz's Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan. She owns a two room house where she has lived with her family for over 15 years. A very talented lady, Imtiaz is involved in an artificial flower making and selling business. She makes artificial flowers and sells them in the market to different decorative shops to help her family financially. She learned this skill from her mother who was involved in the same work.

Her husband's name is A. D., who operates a PCO (public call office, where people make a call and pay the call charges) in the market where he offers his clients national and international calls at cheap rates. He also sells calling cards to his customers. They both share their earnings to meet the financial expenses of the family. 

Imtiaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy telephone sets to offers his services to more people at a time and calling cards to sell to the customers. Imtiaz is hopeful that with the help of an investment her husband’s business will grow and his income will be increased.

This is a group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To buy telephone sets & calling cards for public calling office.

loans.name: James Njoroge

texts.en: James is 32 years old, married to Irene Wangeci, and they have two children.  He has been operating a motorcycle transport service in Naivasha town for the last five years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and this will be his first loan.  James plans to use the cash to renew his PSV licence and buy a headlamp for his motorbike.  He is also planning to buy a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a headlamp and renew his PSV licence.

loans.name: Floria

texts.es: Floria, una mujer valiente y optimista, de 45 años, convive con Amilcar, de 46 años; ambos tuvieron 7 hijos; de los cuales 3 murieron, ahora ellos viven solo con Ketty, de 15 años; en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. A pesar de los constantes momentos difíciles que le toco vivir; Floria, afirma que nunca se amilano y saco fuerzas para salir adelante. Hace 18 años que se dedica a la agricultura, donde siembra papa en sus diferentes variedades (yungay, pericholi y de color). Ella distribuye sus actividades, ya que de la misma manera, tienen 7 años dedicándose también a la elaboración de queso; que la leche de las 5 vacas le proporciona. Gracias al apoyo coordinado de su esposo e hija, todos los días elabora una porción considerable de queso, el cual los vende en el anexo de Huasahuasi, como también en el mercado central de su localidad. De la misma manera su esposo comercializa la papa, que juntos siembran y cosechan en todas las estaciones del año. Actualmente Floria, está juntando dinero para mejorar su casa. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, más respetado de su ciudad, donde podrá lograr sus objetivos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 11 sacos de abono y guano de correal (abono natural); como también una parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de cuajo para la elaboración del queso.
texts.en:
Floria is a courageous and optimistic woman. She is 45 years old and lives with Amilcar, age 46. Together they had seven children, three of whom have already died. Now the only child that still lives with them is Ketty, who is 15 years old. Floria has her own home in the rural district of Santa Clara. Despite the difficult moments she has had to endure in her life, Floria says she never got discouraged and always found the strength to press forward. She has been farming for eighteen years, growing potatoes of different varieties (Yungay, Pericholi, and other types in different colors). Floria pursues other activities in the same manner. She has been making cheese for seven years and has five cows that provide the milk. Thanks to the coordinated support of her husband and daughter, Floria is able to devote a considerable amount of her time to making cheese and selling it in the neighboring district of Huasahuasi and also at the central market in town. In the same manner, her husband sells the potatoes they have grown and harvested together throughout the year. Floria is currently saving money in order to make improvements to her house.

This is her first loan with MFP. Floria is very pleased to be part of her Communal Bank, which is well-respected in her city because its members are able to accomplish their goals. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy eleven sacks of compost and “guano” (bird manure used as a natural fertilizer). In addition, part of the money will be invested in the purchase of enzymes used in making cheese.

loans.use: Purchase compost & guano for her crops; acquire enzymes used in making cheese

loans.name: Nina's Group

texts.en:
Nina A. is the leader of the group. She is 58 and married. Her husband works in the business of goods transportation. Besides running the family business, cattle breeding, Nina is also a chemistry and biology teacher. The family’s total income makes it possible to satisfy their daily requirements. The family wants to purchase a calf in order to increase cattle stock, and is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Nina’s partners:
Janyl I., 52, married. Janyl is a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher. Because of the low salary, the family has to breed cattle in order to increase their total income. Janyl wants to obtain 3 sheep, and is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Chabagan K., 50, married. She is a Russian language and literature teacher. Her family is also engaged in cattle breeding. Her loan request is to purchase 2 calves for fattening.

Kulzada S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 44, married. She makes her living as a mathematics teacher. Her family earns additional income by breeding cattle. The loan purpose is to buy 2 calves to increase their stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Ramatu. She is married and has three children, ages 8, 5 and 3. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help around her home. 

In 1999, Ramatu established her food items business with the help of a friend. Working four days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about $50 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add more food items to sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $90. 

Ramatu is optimistic about a brighter future in her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business

loans.name: Samir

texts.ar:
سمير في عمر 40 سنة يعمل في دهان وتصليح السيارات له في عمله اكثر من 23 سنة يعمل بها بكد ونشاط 
سمير متزوج  وله 5 اولاد يحب عائلته ويعطيها الكثير من اهتمامه فهو يسعى الى تحسين وضع عائلته وتطويرها وتعليم اولاده بشكل جيد
يتلقى الدعم من العائلة بشكل كبير فهو يريد من خلال  طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد جديدة ومواد دهان لتجديد المصلحة
يجد صعوبة في المنافسة من محيطه بسبب نقص المال يجيد عمله كثيرا ويحب تطوير نفسه ومصلحته ثم عائلته
texts.en: Samir is 40 years old. He has been working in the automobile repair business for more than 23 years. He is diligent and active. Samir is married with five children. He loves and cares for his family. Samir hopes to enhance and develop his income, thereby educating his children well. He receives great support from his family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, Samir would like to purchase new paints and equipment to expand his business. He has lots of competition in the field and struggles to compete for business due to his lack of access to financial help. Samir loves his job and aspires to develop his business and secure a better life for his family.

loans.use: Renovations and purchasing new equipment to expand business

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia A. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Anatalia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Anatalia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Anatalia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Anatalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anatalia has successfully repaid her previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Anatalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Pring Y., 40, sells groceries, earning an income of $3 per day. Y. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $50 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Y. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Bubush

texts.en:
Bubush R. is a 58-year-old farmer from Kurbu village. She was born in a large family of farmers. After graduating from industrial college, she took a job as a shop assistant at the local market. When Bubush was 18, she got married and soon became the mother of six children. At present, Bubush is retired. In order to have a source of income in addition to her pension, she breeds livestock and cultivates wheat and perennial herbs.
   
A persistent person, Bubush works hard to enlarge her business and achieve success. Today she has one dairy cow, twenty sheep, one horse, and one bull calf. Her monthly profits may vary up to 30,000 KGS, which shows her ability and her determination to improve her business. Bubush plans to use her loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase one more dairy cow, sheep and bull calves. With the revenues, Bubush plans to renovate her house and help pay for her son's wedding. Bubush is an attentive mother to her family. She takes care of everyone and is a dear friend. She is also a wonderful grandmother to her grandchildren, for whom she works so hard.   

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 45, is married with six children, five of whom attend school. He has been practicing dairy farming for more than 10 years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to brokers in Litein town. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells locally.

He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero-grazing unit, or animal pen. By constructing this unit, he will be able to improve his farming and this will increase his milk output. He says that his biggest challenge has been the poor breed of cows he owns.  He would like to improve the quality of his dairy cows to increase his milk production.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit, or animal pen

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec un âge moyen de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de savon,  de charbon de bois, de mèche à cheveux, de pâtes alimentaires et  des fruits du jujubier. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter dix cartons de savons. Elle se ravitaille en savon au grand marché de Ségou en gros et effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant et au marché Médine à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Korotoumou  C. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. 
Elle a pour ambition, à l’image des autres membres du groupe d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The six women in the Benkadi group are married and on average are 37 years old with 4 children.  Most  of them live in monogamous families. They all live in the Medine district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their businesses in Segou's Medine market. The group members have small businesses selling soap, charcoal, hair extensions, pasta and jujube fruit.  In order to increase their working capital, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso  loan program where  they have their first solidarity loan.  Mrs. Korotoumou C. plans to use her loan to buy ten boxes of soap. She stocks up on soap wholesale at the Segou Grand Market and sells her merchandise retail, for cash and on credit, at home, door-to-door and at the Médine market to a clientele composed of men and women.  With this loan, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA which will used to reinvest in the business and to take care of small household expenses.  Her goal and that of the other group members is to increase their sales volume in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Ana Delmis Yamileth

texts.es:
Ana, resiD. en San Rafael Oriente, departamento D. San Miguel, tiene 30 años D. edad, su familia la conforman: su esposo y un hijo D. dos años; ella se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, negocio que inicio por la colaboración D. sus suegros quienes le enseñaron el negocio, no tiene un horario fijo y posee hoy día mucha experiencia en el cuido D. los cerdos, su alimentación, salud y el precio para comercializarlos. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en cerdos, ya que desea adquirir varios cerdos para aumentar su granja.
Con respecto al negocio Ana aspira tener en su granja los mejores cerdos, comercializarlos a buen precio y en su familia aspira ir mejorando las ganancias para ahorrar y estabilizar la condición D. su esposo e hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  Her family is comprised of her husband and a two year-old son.  For a living she raises pigs, which is the activity she began with the collaboration of her parents-in-law who taught her about the business.  She does not have any fixed work hours.  She has acquired a lot of expertise in raising pigs, such as how to feed them, related health aspects and sales pricing.

She is requesting a loan to buy pigs in order to increase her livestock farm.

Ana's goal is to have a farm with the best pigs so she can sell them at a good price and improve income so she can save money and proviD. a more stable environment for her husband and son.

loans.use: To buy pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin Gabriel B. L., tiene la edad de 25 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su mamá. El pretende comprar con el dinero los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno y el cultivo en buenas condiciones por lo cual quiere asistirlo para esta próxima cosecha llegar a tener mayores ingresos y producciones. El cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta área del café y también quiere crecer como caficultor de la zona y generar ingresos para su bienestar y el de su madre.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Martin Gabriel B. L., age 25, is single and lives with his mother.  He wants to use the money to buy supplies to help with his coffee crops.  He states that with the land and the crops in good condition, which he wants to help happen in the next harvest, he will come to have greater income and production.

He has a lot of experience in the field.  He also wants to grow as a coffee grower in the area.  This will generate income for his and his mother’s well-being.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his coffee crops

loans.name: La Union De Mujeres Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA UNION DE MUJERES, ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN PRESTAMO. MARIA DE JESUS M. H. ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, TIENE 45 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA SEGUNDO AÑO DE PRIMARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE UN TOTAL DE 5 HIJOS (4 VARONES Y 1 MUJER). ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE VERDURAS EL CUAL INICIO HACE MAS DE 7 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS DE VERDURAS YA QUE ELLA MISMA SE DEDICA A CULTIVAR LAS VERDURAS QUE VENDE. LA SEÑORA COMENTA QUE SUS CLIENTES HAN QUEDADO SATISFECHOS CON EL SERVICIO QUE OFRECE, ADEMAS DE QUE SUS PRODUCTOS SON DE BUENA CALIDAD. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR EL PRESTAMO SE SIENTE FELIZ PORQUE ASI PODRA CONTINUAR CON SUS INVERSIONES Y PRODUCCION DE VERDURAS. TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE A CORTO PLAZO PUEDA INVERTIR EN LA GANADERIA Y PODER SEGUIR APOYANDO A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE TERMINEN SUS ESTUDIOS. YA QUE DE ESA MANERA ELLA VE REFLEJADO EL FRUTO DE SU TRABAJO.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Unión de Mujeres' (Women's Union) and it is located in the State of Mexico.  The group has nine members and this is the first time that they have requested a loan.

Maria de Jesus M. H. is one of the members of this group.  She is 45 years old and studied up to the second year of her primary education.  She is married and has five children (four boys and one girl).  She has been selling vegetables for more than seven years.  Maria is requesting this loan to buy vegetable seeds since she grows the vegetables that she sells herself.  She tells us that her customers have been satisfied with the service that she offers and her produce is good quality.  At the time of requesting her loan, Maria feels happy because she will be able to continue with her investments and continue producing vegetables.  She also hopes that, in the short term, she will be able to invest in livestock and continue supporting her children so that they finish their studies.  In this way, she will see her work rewarded.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Bujinlham

texts.en:
Bujinlham is 52 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter, age 18, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. 

Bujinlham offers coping, scanning, and printing services at a rented space. She works there with her husband, who works as a trained English and Russian translator.  

Bujinlham began her service five years ago. Now their daily income amounts to approximately 55,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Bujinlham wants to buy new equipment and devices for her computer-service business to improve effectiveness and efficiency. She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy a new scanner and laser printer to increase her work output.

loans.use: to purchase a new scanner and laser printer

loans.name: Luisa Elena

texts.es:
Luisa Elena  de 30 años vive en la Urbanización La Playa con sus 4 hijos pequeños, con los que sueña apoyarlos hasta hacer de ellos personas exitosas. Los ingresos que Luisa aplica a su hogar dependen de su negocio  llamado  “Estadero mi Padrino y Yo”,  donde vende cervezas, jugos naturales y fritos.  Hace un poco más de un año,  su primo quien empezó esta actividad, se fue a vivir a un lugar muy lindo en el caribe Colombiano: La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta y él fue quien   propuso a Luisa que se quedara su negocio regalándole  el enfriador que aún  conserva.  Aunque ella aceptó la idea,  pensó que era un reto muy grande dedicarse a este negocio,  especialmente   los sábados y festivos cuando la actividad es de mayor movimiento,  pues en su condición de madre sola con 4 hijos se le dificultaba, pero de todas maneras  aceptó el desafío y le agregó además de la venta de bebidas, refrescos,  jugos naturales y fritangueria, actividad que   venía realizando y adicionalmente también pidió a su primo que trabajara con ella   los fines de semanas.  En el ejercicio diario y persistente de esta actividad,  su negocio  fue cogiendo fuerza , ella empezó en su residencia pero en la actualidad trabaja en la casa de su tío donde posee la infraestructura necesaria para ello: un enfriador, una licuadora y enseres para el almacenamiento de cervezas, y de los jugos .  
Su sueño es diversificar este negocio e incrementar sus ventas ya que sus clientes han aumentado y su capital es muy pequeño para responder a la demanda exigida por el mercado. Su máximo desafío es la atención de este negocio,  pues  en su calidad de mujer es muy pesado para ella sola y sus hijos aún no pueden apoyarla porque están pequeños; mientras Luisa trabaja en el cumplimiento de sus sueños, percibe una utilidad no menor del 26% la cual sueña con lograr aumentarla.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará  una vitrina calentadora para exhibir sus fritos y un mayor número de cajas de cervezas para la venta de los fines de semana , además planea  adquirir dos planes para vender minutos a celulares, aprovechando la gran demanda de clientes a quienes puede captar y ganar un poco más de dinero.
texts.en:
Luisa Elena is 30 years old and lives in the La Playa housing development together with her four young children.  She dreams of supporting her children until they become successful adults.  Luisa's household income comes from her business called "Estadero mi Padrino y Yo" where she sells beer, natural juices and fried food.

A little over one year ago, Luisa's cousin, who started the business, went to live in a very beautiful place on the Caribbean coast in Colombia: La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.  He suggested to Luisa that she take over his business, making her a gift of a cooler.  Although she accepted the idea, she considered it a very big challenge taking over the business, especially on Saturdays and holidays when things are at their busiest.  Luisa is a single mother with four children which makes things difficult.  However, she accepted the challenge and started soda, soft drinks, natural juices and fried food.  She also asked a cousin to work with her on weekends.  In carrying out her business every day, it has gradually become stronger.  She started the business in her home but currently works in her uncle's house because he has the infrastructure she needs: a cooler, a blender and equipment for storing the beer and juice.

Luisa's dream is to diversify her business and increase her sales since her number of customers has increased and she doesn't have much capital with which to respond to demand.  Her biggest challenge is serving in her business since it is very difficult for her as a woman living on her own.  Her children are not yet able to support her because they are still young.  Luisa continues working to fulfil her dreams, making profits of no less than 26%.  She dreams of increasing her profits.

This is Luisa's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy a heated cabinet to display her fried food, and a larger number of crates of beer to sell on weekends.  She also intends to acquire two phone plans so that she can sell cell phone minutes, taking advantage of her customer demand, attracting customers and earning a little more money.

loans.use: to buy a heated cabinet to display her fried food, and more crates of beer to sell on weekends.  She also intends to acquire two phone plans so that she can sell cell phone minutes

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 39 years old and lives in the community of Sta. Josefa,  Agusan Del Sur. He is a rice farmer and a piggery owner. He has been in these businesses for 11 years. His monthly income from his businesses is PHP 4,000.

With a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc., he will buy farm and agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. He will also buy pig feed and pay school fees for his children.

Rogelio has two children. His dream is to become successful in his swine fattening and rice farm businesses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells boodo at Elmina. Boodo is made from flour, sugar, maize and other ingredients. The process of cooking boodo is by baking. As you can see in this picture, Adjoa has filled the oven with boodo to bake. 

She wishes to expand her business so she needs a loan to buy maize, flour and other things to bake for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy maize, flour and other things to bake for sale

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 13 years. She is 64 years old and married to Joseph. They have four children. She practices small-scale farming and sells her harvest at the local market. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Lydia hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Genty

texts.en: Genty is a 32 year old married woman whose husband is business man. They have 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. Genty is currently in the business of selling fruit like tomatoes, mangoes, and pineapple, and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  With the extra profits from her loan, Genty hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba smokes a variety of fish at Abura for resale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been selling smoked fish for five years. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her industrial stove and to purchase corn, pork, and cheese.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

Grace has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David desde el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla nos informa que planea recibir su segundo credikiva, para surtir su negocio con ropa y sandalias y dar respuesta a un mercado fijo con el que cuenta. Con su anterior credikiva compró insumos para fabricar pan de bonos y también invirtió en calzado. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente:
“Gracias  a esta entidad es la segunda vez que me apoyan,  espero que continúen haciéndolo y también seguirles pagando muy bien.”
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de David, ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/203257
texts.en:
From the town of Malambo, Barranquilla metropolitan area, David tells us that he plans to receive his second Kiva loan to stock his business with clothes and sandals to meet the demand he has from his steady customers.  

He used his previous Kiva loan to buy ingredients to bake "pan de bonos" [Colombian cheese bread] and he also invested in footwear.  His message to all the lenders follows:

“Thanks to this entity, this is the second time they’ve supported me.  I hope they continue to do so and also to continue to repay them very well.” 

If you’d like to know David’s story, please click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/203257

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Dimar

texts.es: El Sr. Dimar, nacido en Chuquisaca no es casado pero convive con la Sra. María, tienen dos hijos. Ella es ama de casa, y él se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace más de 10 años, ellos viven en el Porvenir  en la provincia cordillera. Distante a 40 km. De Limoncito Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que han solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra y también siembran maíz, sorgo, y poroto. Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo al consumidor en el mercado de la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Dimar was born in Chuquisaca. He is not married, but he lives with Sra. María and they have two children. She is a homemaker while Dimar engages in farming and raising livestock. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. Dimar and his family live in El Porvenir in a mountain province that is 40 km from Limoncito Torno.

He has a parcel of land where he grows watermelon, corn, citrus fruits, and cassava. Dimar is requesting a loan for growing watermelon and covering the expenses related to preparing his land. He also wants to plant corn, sorghum, and beans. Everything he produces is sold directly to the consumer at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing watermelon and to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
"Touching and knowing the life of the client" is the secret of Lilibeth, 36 years old. She is married and has five children. She would like to have more clients and to invest in her personal collection business of plates, spoons and glasses. She has been engaged in her business for five years.

Lilibeth is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase different products that she can offer to her neighbors. She dreams that someday she will see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy glasses, spoons and plates for her business.

loans.name: Reina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
la sra. Reina de los Angeles tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 4 hijos, Reina se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, sus ventas son por pedidos diarios, tiene muchos clientes permanentes, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para elaborar las tortillas y luego repartirlas a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, cal, maiz y agua, en estos momentos los pedidos de sus clientes han aumentado y no se de abasto con la produccion que tiene, es por tal razon que desea comprar mas materiales para tener una mayor produccion.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Reina de los Angeles is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Reina makes and sells tortillas. Her sales are by daily request, and she has a lot of permanent clients. Her business is located in her home. Every day, she gets up very early to produce the tortillas and later to deliver them to her clients. 

She will use the loan to purchase firewood, quicklime, corn, and water. Currently, the requests of her clients have increased, and she does not have the supplies to keep up. Because of this, she wants to purchase more materials to make more products. 

She needs the earnings to help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, quicklime, corn, and water.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, tiene 24 años, no tiene hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 4 años. 
Nélida vende ropas en las ferias, ella desde muy pequeña trabajaba, recuerda que se inició vendiendo medias, y poco a poco pudo tener un pequeño capital para poder iniciar con la venta de ropas, Finca le ayuda mucho a poder valorarse y a poder administrar mejor su dinero, y todo lo que puede aprender lo practica en su negocio, ahora lo que mas anhela es poder tener una tienda de ropas, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando comprará mas ropas para poder llevar a la feria.
texts.en:
Nélida is a member of Solidaridad Communal Bank.  She is 24 years old and has no children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years.

Nélida sells clothing in the markets.  She began working when she was very young.  She remembers that she began selling stockings, and little by little she managed to have a little capital to be able to begin selling clothes.  FINCA helped her a lot to be able to assess herself and manage her money better, and in her business she practices everything that she is able to learn.

What she wants most now is to be able to have a clothing store.  With the loan that she is taking out now she will buy more clothes to take to the market.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to take to the market to sell.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida sells slippers and cloth at Takoradi by moving from one place to another. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a sand-winner. Vida has been selling cloths for 2 years. She assists her husband to take care of their home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more cloths to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy cloths to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is married with two children, ages three to six years old.  Both attend school. 

Alphonsine, age 28, sells a variety of products in her store, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, lotions and spices. 

She has requested a loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products in her store, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, lotions and spices.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been operating a small retail shop for the last four years, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to add additional stock of maize flour, cooking oil, Royco (a spicy seasoning) and tea leaves for sale. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children. In the future, the lady hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil, Royco and tea leaves.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Rosalie has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Progrès Plus Group

texts.en:
Julienne is the chairwoman of the community bank named Progrès Plus. It consists of 13 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Julienne has been in the microenterprise world since 2001. She has been running a restaurant located southwest of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of HOPE RDC, who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying a sack of flour, fish, and beans with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her area. 

Julienne is 58 years old, married and has seven children whose ages vary between 21 and 35 years old. One of them goes to school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying flour, beans, and other foods

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 37-year-old man from Western Kenya. He is married to Marry and they don’t have kids.

George operates a computer bureau business. He has been doing this business for the last six years and makes a monthly profit of 11,000 KES. He is taking his second loan with KADET Ltd. and will use the loan to complete his own premises and piping works and boost his supplies. He plans to plough back the anticipated profits into the business.

His dream is to open another branch at Muhuru Bay.

loans.use: to complete building and initiate piping works

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a vender ropa en los hogares, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 22 y 25 años de edad, el negocio lo aprendió hace dos años hasta ahorita no ha presentado ningún problema, trabaja  todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas y de esa forma podrá tener más ingresos.
El sueño de Reina es mantener estable su negocio apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios que ellos tengan lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Reina makes a living selling clothing door to door.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 25- and 22-years old, respectively.  She started the business two short years ago and is satisfied with her progress.  
Reina will use this loan to buy clothing for men, women and children: trousers, shirts, skirts, blouses, etc.
Reina wants a steady income so that she can help her chldren get a good education.

loans.use: to stock her retail clothing business.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es: Alan, de 30 años de edad, es de profesión técnico en enfermería, siendo un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, es soltero, vive en compañía de su madre y su hermano, a los que quiere mucho y apoya en lo que puede, habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre. La actividad que desea iniciar Alan es la de abrir un tópico de enfermeria ya que cuenta con el conocimiento por la carrera que estudió. Por eso tiene planes de asociarse con sus colegas de trabajo, donde él colaborará con parte del capital y sus futuros socios con el local, así formará una pequeña empresa.  Lo que espera es tener ingresos adicionales y así podrá apoyar a su madre con los gastos de su hogar, a parte de que tiene planes de independizarse buscando comprarse un casa propia, para ello deberá trabajar duro y ahorra. Mas adelante espera formar una botica. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en el negocio de un tópico de enfermería que tiene planeado.
texts.en:
Alan, 30, is by profession a nursing technician and a hard-working man.  He is single and lives comfortably in his mother's house with his mother and brother, whom he loves very much and supports as much as he can.

The job Alan wants to start is opening a basic health care facility, since he has the knowledge because of his studies.  This is why he has plans to get together with his work colleagues to set up a small business in which he will collaborate with part of the capital and his future associates with the location.

What he hopes for is to have additional income so he will be able to help his mother with the household expenses.  Besides, he has plans to become independent and is looking to buy his own house, for which he must work hard and save.  Later on he hopes to set up a pharmacy.

This will be his first loan with the MFP institution.  He feels grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to get ahead with his goals.  He also comments that he feels at home with his communal bank because he knows the majority of the members and considers them to be good people.

He will invest the requested loan of 1000 PEN in its entirely in the health care facility business that he has planned.

loans.use: to set up a basic health care facility.

loans.name: Wilmer Jose

texts.es: El joven Wilmer tiene 26 años de edad de familia agricultora él tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casado con un hijo no asiste a la escuela porque esta pequeño todavía la esposa es ama de casa, al inicio él tuvo dificultad con el financiamiento y otros problemas de plagas que atacaron su cultivo, pero gracias a Dios logro salir adelante; para tener cuidado de esto solicita su segundo crédito para darle mantenimiento a 1 manzana de piña, para el cual necesitara comprar abono, urea e insecticida. En un futuro desea poder sembrar más manzanas de piña para darle un mejor futuro a su hijo quien a medida que va creciendo sus gastos son mayor.

loans.use: Para comprar abono, urea e insecticida.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es: El Sr. Ciriaco tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la Población de Mariposas, de la provincia Carrasco, de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él está en concubinato con la Sra. Emeteria. Ciriaco tiene 7 hijos,  se dedica a la producción de plátano y la producción de cacao ya que el no pudo tener ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, ellos vivían en el departamento de Potosí  hace 31 años atrás ellos se volvieron a levantar  junto a su Esposa tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron de cero.  El préstamo que solicita Ciriaco es para la compra de Rondanas para Cablevia  y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar alguna carrera sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos y quiere que sus hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Ciriaco is 55 years old.  He lives in the town of Mariposas in the Carrasco province in the city of Cochabamba.  He is married to Emeteria and they have seven children.  He works growing bananas and producing cacao.  They used to live in the department of Potosi, and he was not able to earn enough money to support their family, so 31 years ago, they returned to take a new path, starting from nothing.  

Ciriaco is requesting this loan to purchase pulleys for a cable system for his banana plants.  This will allow him to earn more income and help his children finish their career.  He dreams of giving his children a better future and hopes that they will become professionals and be able to help people in the area.

loans.use: to purchase pulleys for a cable system.

loans.name: Aichatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, nommée Aichatou (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)âgée de 34 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Aichatou est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Ibrahim. Le couple a deux enfants, certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Aichatou vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que Aichatou vend  du maïs depuis trois ans environs. Aichatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Aichatou ensemble avec les membres de ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs.

loans.name: Myrlina

texts.en:
Myrlina is 64 years old and married with ten children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

Myrlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

Myrlina has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rehoboth Group

texts.fr: Léontine est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle vend des plats en plastique dans son quartier et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter des plats de grande taille quantité 10, et aussi des plats de petit modèle quantité 10 également, et diversifiés à 125 000 francs. Le lieu de commerce de Léontine fait face au marché central ce qui fait que la vente de ses plats en plastique marche bien et en plus de cela, elle propose  la qualité à ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire de l'épargne, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME
texts.en:
Léontine is married and has four children. She sells plastic dishes in her neighborhood and has been doing so for ten years. She needs a loan to purchase ten large dishes and also ten small dishes, and various other dishes for 125,000 francs.

Léontine's shop faces the central market which makes her plastic dishes sales successful. In addition, she has quality goods for her customers. After her sales, she would like to have enough profit for savings, to take care of her family, and also to continue her business. She has already received a loan and paid back ACFIME on time.

loans.use: to buy ten large dishes, ten small dishes and various plastic dishes for 125,000 francs.

loans.name: Stefan

texts.en: Stefan R. is private agricultural producer in Kardjali. He is 39 years old ad has s pedagogic education which he graduated in Plovdiv. His wife is also a pedagogue. While he was a student he tried some jobs such as teacher and taxi driver, but living in big city was not easy for him so he went back to his native city Kardjali. In 2001 he started his agricultural business. He hired 5 decares of land and started to grow peppers on it. On the next year he hired another 5 decares and now 6 years later Stefan cultivates 10 decares of pepper and 2 decares of watermelons. Stefan R. wants to buy a mechanic water sprayer for his farming and needs $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a mechanic water sprayer

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a seamstress who is very good at her vocation. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She understands the TEACH Lending program and is comfortable using book-keeping skills to run her business. She needs a loan of $750 to expand her business and employ more hands to help her.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire the resources needed to expand her business

loans.name: Aura

texts.en: Aura sells in a "Ventorrillo" which is a place where she sells vegetables, and various kinds of meat. She has been in the business for almost 2 years and before that she had a stand where she sold "Pastelitos" .She goes to the market in Santo Domingo to resupply and only goes every time she needs to restock. She is married with 3 children 1 girl and 2 boys. She also has her own place to sell the goods.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 24-year-old self-made woman living with her parents in Dekwaneh in Beirut. She strives every day to pay her university tuition fees through the embroideries she makes for wedding and evening dresses. She learned that skill from her mother and wanted to develop it into a sustainable business.

Rania has received 2 loans from Al Majmoua prior to this one. Now she needs USD 700 to buy fabrics and accessories to continue expanding her work. Once she graduates, her dream is to transform the small business she runs from home into a registered company. For sure, Al Majmoua will do its best to help her reach this goal.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and accessories for the embroidery work

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
VERONICA, age 30, has had 14 years of experience in hairdressing. Three years ago, she started her own business, “Vero Natural Beauty Hair Salon” and now employs 3 full-time workers to assist her. Business is going well and they have around 15 customers a day, bringing in about $35-40. Problems come when the electricity and water are not stable.

Knowing the potential of her growing business, Veronica hopes to get a loan to upgrade her salon with mirrors, shelves, and other salon furnishings. Living with her husband, 9-year-old son, and 3-year-old daughter, Veronica spends the profits from her business on school fees and improving their quality of life at home.

Veronica belongs to the group Ruaha (the name for a river in Tanzania), which consists of 19 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase salon furnishings

loans.name: Sophos's Group

texts.en:
These two families live in a small village off of National Road 2, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They are requesting this, their first group loan from Maxima, to buy a second cow and to buy a moto-remorque taxi. Mrs. C. Sophos was selected to be a group leader by members requesting a loan from Maxima.

1. Mrs. C. Sophos (age 25) and her husband (age 28) have been married for two years. They have one child. C. has worked in a nearby garment factory for six years. Her husband drives a moto-remorque taxi. They also raise cows (see image on right of photo). She is requesting a loan from Maxima of US$400. She will use this loan to purchase a cow to raise.

2. Mrs. N. Chanthorn (age 26) and her husband (age 33) have been married since 1997. They have three children, two of whom study in primary school in their village. N. has been working in a garment factory for a year. Her husband also drives a moto-remorque taxi (see image on left of photo -- her husband and son are pictured on one as an illustration.) Closer to Phnom Penh, National Road Two is lined with garment factories. At each shift change, thousands of workers, mostly women, need to be ferried to and from the surrounding villages. Cambodians use the moto-remorque, a very economical combination of a trailer pulled by a 100 or 125cc motorbike. They typically hold as many as eighteen or more people. N. is requesting a loan from Maxima of US$200. She will use this loan to purchase a moto-remorque carriage to provide transportation.

loans.use: Group loan to purchase a cow and a moto-remorque taxi.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence I. is 51 years old.  She is married, has four children, and lives in Benin City. She sells female clothing. She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more clothing to sell.  She spent three years learning about her trade before starting her own business in 2003.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nabidongha B South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca N.. She is currently in the business of water selling and is requesting a loan to start up a retail shop. Jesca is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 7 children ranging from age 6 to 21 and five of them go to school. Each week, Jesca makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater to home expenditures. Jesca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her water business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jesca is joined in her small group by Zaina N., Harriet N., Farida T., and Zaitula N.. Zaina N. has a business in selling clothes and groceries and wants to uplift the clothes business. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to start up a permanent clothes shop. Farida T. operates a local restaurant business and wants to invest in her restaurant. Zaitula N. is currently in the grocery business and is requesting a loan to increase the stock of items.

loans.use: To start up a retail shop and also add to the water business

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong S. Ley, age 28, runs a butcher shop at a market. She sells chicken that she buys from her nearby poultry breeder in her community , earning around $5 each day of income. Her husband is an electrician and makes on average $5 each day. She has four little children. Mrs. Duong S. would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.
